loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Thy is 52 years old and a mother of five children, some of whom are helping with the family business and some are still in school. Her family is living in the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province, where she manages a rice farming business as her main source of income. She also sells  palm sugar to earn additional income. From the current business that she has been with for 23 years, she manages to earn about 20,000 KHR per day. 

This is her first time with VisionFund for requesting a new loan. She has formed a group of three women; one of her group members is also a newly joined client while the remaining one is a second loan-cycle client.  Thy will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to make more profit so that she can keep her children in school until university level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Hedelita

texts.en:
Hedelita is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Hedelita is selling RTW's or ready-to-wear products like blouses, pants and slippers. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy more RTW's to sell.

Hedelita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Hedelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more RTW's or ready-to-wear products

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Cheryl is selling snacks and yellow bananas. She has had this business for 3 years. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy snacks and yellow bananas to resell. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of snacks and yellow bananas to resell.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en: Sofia is a married with three children. She is 38 years old and lives in Sepac, Sapang Dalaga. Sofia owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for two years and earns 12,000 PHP each month. She requested a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. Sofia has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, since 2011. In the future, Sofia's plan is to save her returns in order to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Neofita

texts.es:
Neófita tiene 41 años, está casada con Javier, de 56 años, tienen dos hijos, y juntos habitan en su casa propia, la cual está hecha a base de material rustico.
Ella es una mujer a quien le gusta el negocio, hace 3 años abrió una tienda de comestibles en su vivienda y a pesar que la atiende sola, a veces cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos o de su esposo. Ella empieza su trabajo desde muy temprano, a las 5 de la mañana, pues sus vecinos son agricultores que madrugan para poder trabajar en sus parcelas, por ello necesitan llevar los comestibles necesarios para que elaboren sus alimentos del día. El problema es cuando se le acaba la mercadería y no tiene el dinero necesario para abastecerse, por eso recurre a los préstamos.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se siente contenta por la oportunidad que le dan y por la confianza en su trabajo. Por ello se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos, así podrá acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su banco comunal se siente tranquila por trabajar con socios amables y responsables.
Con estos 4,000 nuevos soles se abastecerá de mercadería para su tienda, comprará sacos de azúcar, cereales, bebidas, golosinas, etc.
texts.en:
Neófita is 41 years old, and is married to 56-year-old Javier. They have two children and live together in their own house, which is made from simple material. 

She is a woman who likes business. She opened a grocery store 3 years ago in her house, and despite that she alone serves it,  sometimes she counts on the support of her children and her husband. She starts her work very early, at 5 in the morning, since her neighbors are farmers who wake up early to work in their plots. Thus, they need to have the necessary groceries to make their food for the day. The problem is when she runs out of merchandise and doesn't have the money necessary to stock up. For this reason, she turns to the loans. 

This is her first loan with MFP and she feels happy about the opportunity that they gave her, and for the trust in her work. For this, she promises to be punctual in her payments, and such will be able to access other loans in the future. In her communal bank, she feels peaceful to work with kind and responsible members. 

With these 4000 nuevos soles, she will stock up with merchandise for her store. She will buy sacks of sugar, cereals, drinks, candies, etc.

loans.use: to stock her store. She will buy sacks of sugar, cereals, drinks, candies, etc.

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en:
Chorn, age 40, is a resident from Ang Snoul district, Kandal province, Cambodia. She lives there happily with her spouse and three teenage children who are attending school. Chorn’s husband is a soldier and he’s not always at home. He usually goes to work in the provinces around the country and visits home just a few times a month. 

To add to her husband’s income, Chorn dedicates herself to selling different kinds of desserts in the vicinity of a garment factory where many workers eat breakfast and lunch. From this type of business, she is able to make around 5.00 USD per day, which is used to cover her household expenses, including food, clothing and allowances for her school-age children. 

Nowadays, Chorn’s family doesn’t possess a vehicle for their transportation needs, so she has encountered difficulties in transporting her desserts to sell at her rented booth. Because of this, she usually pays a lot of money for transportation fees. She wants to cut down unwanted expenses and save more money for her family. That is why she is now asking for a loan in the amount of 600 USD to purchase a motorcycle for the support of her current business as well as for household use. She hopes that her loan will be approved and that Kiva lenders will help her to make improvements in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for the support of her current business as well as for household use.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her vegetables.

loans.name: Jesssica

texts.en:
Jesssica is 19 years old, single, and lives in the Philippines. She provides motorela or motorcycle services with her cousin as the driver. She has had this business for 2 years. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to pay for the maintenance of the motorcycle. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future,Jesssica hopes to improve her services.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 38 años, tiene tres hijos, a quienes brinda amor de padre y madre. Juntos habitan en su propia casa, la que logró comprar algunos años atrás.
Ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas (gaseosas y refrescos) y golosinas desde su vivienda, labor que realiza hace 7 años y que considera tranquila, pues no tiene que hacer esfuerzo físico y puede estar en su casa al cuidado de sus hijos. Pero como toda mujer en busca de progreso, su deseo es lograr implementar una tienda completa, donde pueda vender todos los productos que sean necesarios para sus vecinos. Por ello sigue trabajando para ir incrementando la mercadería que tiene poco a poco.  

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se siente contenta por este préstamo porque le permitirá seguir con sus planes de trabajo.
Con estos 1,500 nuevos soles comprará cajas de galletas, bebidas, dulces y otras golosinas.
texts.en:
Julia is 38 years old. She has three children, to whom she provides the love of father and mother. They live together in their own house, which she managed to buy a few years ago. 

She sells drinks (soft drinks and fruit drinks) and candy from her home. She has been doing this work for seven years and considers it easy to do, as she doesn't have to use physical effort, and can be in her home, looking after her children. 

But as with every woman looking to progress, she wishes to succeed in operating a well-stocked store, where she can sell all the products that her neighbors need. This is why she keeps working, in order to little by little increase the merchandise that she has.  

This is her first loan with MFP, and she feels happy about this loan, because it will allow her to continue with her plans for her business. With these 1,500 nuevos soles, she will buy cases of cookies, drinks, candy and other sweets.

loans.use: To buy cases of cookies, drinks, candy and other sweets.

loans.name: Ma.conception

texts.en:
Ma.Conception is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Ma.Conception is providing multi-cab services transporting different kinds of products with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 7 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to pay for the maintenance.

Ma.Conception has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Ma.Conception hopes to improve her services.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance

loans.name: Eaem

texts.en:
Eaem is 51 years old and married. He is a father of seven children living in a rural area of the Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province. Six out of his seven children are still living with him; some of them have their own employment and some are still in school. He is the main source of the family's income with his wife, farming two hectares of farmland growing paddy rice, the business that they have been with for 13 years. They also use their spare time for raising a pig to generate additional income. Both businesses earn them about 18,000 KHR. 

Eaem has been with VisionFund for one cycle. He has managed to his loan successfully so as to better support his household and business especially in purchasing fertilizer for boosting the productivity for his cash crop and to buy more pigs to raise. Now, he is seeking a new loan in the amount of 1,200,000 KHR to buy more piglets and fertilizer for his farmland. He hopes to gain more yield from his crop husbandry and have a lot of fat pigs so he can make more income to maintain his family.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and fertilizer for his farmland

loans.name: Amihan

texts.en:
Amihan is business-oriented woman who is 52 years old and has four children. Three of them are currently employed locally. Amihan is widowed but determined enough to provide sustenance for her family. Her youngest child still attends school. Amihan sews school uniforms, table cloths and curtains to sell at a profit. She had been in her sewing business for almost 10 years.

She is now asking for a loan of P13,000 to buy thread and cloth for use in her sewing business. She hopes to improve the quality of services she gives her customers. 

In the future, Amihan would like to earn more funds from her simple business and someday provide a better way of living to her family.

loans.use: to buy thread and cloth used in her sewing business

loans.name: Edita

texts.es:
Edita tiene 35 años, ella es padre y madre para sus tres hijos, a quienes saca adelante para que tengan una mejor calidad de vida. Juntos viven en la casa que pudo comprar hace 13 años.
Ella se dedica a la venta de mantas bordadas, las cuales compra de un grupo de artesanas cuyo pueblo se encuentran a 7 horas de su comunidad. Esta labor la empezó hace 2 años y siempre está en constante viaje. Sus proveedoras le dan un precio al por mayor, es por eso que ella puede solventar sus viajes y además obtener buenas ganancias de las ventas. Es así como logra solventar la educación de sus hijos y los gastos domésticos. Su deseo a futuro es tener una tienda artesanal en su localidad, ya que sería la única en ese rubro.

Este es su crédito número 5 con MFP, por lo que se siente agradecida, una vez más, por el apoyo recibido. Asimismo, le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal, ya que trabaja con personas que también desean progresar.	
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles de este préstamo hará su siguiente viaje para comprar las mantas que requiere para seguir vendiendo.
texts.en:
Edita is 35 years old. She is father and mother to her three children, whom she is raising to have a better quality of life. They live together in the house she was able to buy 13 years ago. 

She sells embroidered shawls that she buys from a group of artisans whose village is located seven hours from her community.  She started this work two years ago, and travels constantly. Her suppliers give her a wholesale price, and that is how she can pay for her trips and in addition obtain good profits from the sales. 

This is how she manages to pay for her children's education and the household expenses. Her wish for the future is to have a handicrafts store in her community, as it would be the only one in this line of business. 

This is her fifth loan with MFP, so she feels grateful, once again, for the support received. Likewise, she enjoys being part of her communal bank, as she is working with people who also wish to progress. 	

With the 2,000 nuevos soles from this loan, she will make her next trip to buy the shawls that she needs to keep selling.

loans.use: To make her next trip to buy the shawls she needs to continue selling.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Jennifer has a shop that buys and sells copra (dried coconut meat). She has had this business for 6 years. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more copra to resell. Jennifer is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more copra to resell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha lives at Enrile with her spouse and three children. To make a living she sells fruit and vegetables for a profit while her spouse works as a security guard. Together, they generate income for their children's school fees. She had insufficient funds to increase her merchandise so she is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy bananas, squash, cabbages and tomatoes to sell.

In the future, Editha hopes to keep making the business grow profitably so she can construct a stall to conveniently stock up on her products. Her photo was taken on her way going to the public market using her bicycle for transportation.

loans.use: to buy bananas, squash, cabbages and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is a dried fish vendor at the village of Marracuro where her family resides. She is 60 years old and has 11 children. They live separately from her. 

Leticia has been in the dried fish vending business for over nine years now. She earns P400 each month and it goes for meals and bills at home. She is now asking for P9,000 to buy more dried fish to sell. This will help increase sales and profits as well.

Someday, she hopes to improve her business and enable income development.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Hermila

texts.es:
Hermila tiene 64 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a una hija en uno de los barrios que conforman la parte urbana del distrito de Cayaltí, una zona predominantemente agrícola y comercial, es productora de caña de azucar y arroz, su posición geográfica le favorece ya que se encuentra cercana a poblaciones de la sierra que constantemente llegan a comercializar los frutos de sus cosechas y diversos artículos que producen .

Hermila se dedica a preparar y comercializar comida en el mercado del distrito desde hace más de diez años. El negocio va bien y cuenta con bastante acogida ya que prepara los alimentos con muy buena sazón, los clientes que acuden a su negocio principalmente son los trabajadores que se encuentran de paso por la zona. Este negocio le sirve para sentirse activa y ayudar a su familia con el mantenimiento de los gastos económicos. Su esposo es trabajador jubilado de la empresa de la zona y juntos se apoyan en todos los aspectos. Son una pareja bastante unida.

Actualmente Hermila desea realizar algunas mejoras en su domicilio, para lo que necesita adquirir algunos materiales como ladrillos y cemento, como no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción por si sola ha recurrido a Edpyme Alternativa para solicitar un préstamo de 1300 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.

Hermila agradece de antemano a los prestamistas de Kiva que le ayudaran a conseguir su objetivo.
texts.en:
Hermilia is 64 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and a daughter in one of the neighborhoods that make up the urban district of Cayaltí. It is predominately an agricultural and commercial area. It produces sugar cane and rice. Its geographical position is favorable as it is located near the people living in the mountain ranges who constantly bring their diverse crops to market.

Hermila has been working preparing and selling food at the market in the district for more than ten years. Her business is going well and she has been welcomed as she prepares good food that is well flavored. Her customers are mostly the workers passing by the area. This business helps her by keeping her active and helping her family to pay the household expenses. Her husband retired from working in an area business and they support one another in all ways. They are a close-knit family.

Currently Hermila wants to make some improvements to her home, and this is why she needs some supplies such as bricks and cement, and as she does not have enough capital to do it alone she has asked for a loan through Edpyme Alternative for 1300 soles to help her achieve her goal.

Hermila gives thanks in advance to the Kiva lenders for helping her achieve her objective.

loans.use: to buy bricks and cement to make improvements to her home

loans.name: Pol's Group

texts.en:
Pol is a 44-year-old married mother of three children. She is living in a rural area of the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province in which rice farming is the common business for the villagers. She is also a farmer on two hectares of farmland, from which she is able to earn income to support her family by growing paddy rice. The current business earns her about 17,000 KHR per day. 

Pol's group consists of four female members and she is the group leader. She and one of her members have been with VisionFund for one cycle while the remaining two members are the newly joined clients. She has managed her loan successfully in stabilizing her family's living conditions and has set aside some money for future needs.

Now she and her group members are seeking a new loan. She is going to use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and vegetable seed. She wants to grow vegetables in addition to rice in order to earn extra income. She hopes to produce a good yield and sell at a high price so that she can build a new house and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, and vegetable seed.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. She has a retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 8 years. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Celsa has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Rusell

texts.en:
Rusell is from Southwestern Pob., Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Rusell is married and has 1 child. To make a living, she sells meat like pork and beef in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for 6 years and earns about 9,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, she joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional meats to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional meats to sell.

loans.name: Nimol

texts.en:
Nimol is a 32-year-old mother of two children residing in a rural area of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Cambodia. She is engaged in rice farming, which she has been doing for fourteen years, and she can earn about 11 US Dollar only. 

With VisionFund, she is a third-time borrower. She has managed her past two loans with success by improving her family's life gradually with proper clothes and decent food. Moreover, she was able to set aside some money for future needs. 

Now she is seeking a new loan to buy a motorbike as a means for transportation to better support not only her current business, but also to help her husband's commuting back and forth to his workplace. She hopes that this new motorbike will save traveling time for her husband so he can use his spare time to help her with her own current business and help look after the children.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to better support her business and provide transportation for her husband.

loans.name: José Lucio

texts.es: José Lucio de cuarenta y siete años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo en caso propia, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo se ubica en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y cercano a donde vive, todo lo que produce lo vende en los alrededores de la comunidad y tiene mucha clientela que lo prefiere porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan a precios accesibles y con producto de calidad además se caracteriza por el buen servicio; José es un hombre admirable, dedicado a su labor y a su familia, quiere cumplir sus objetivos y esta trabajando duro para lograrlo, piensa que la vida es un reto y el esta dispuesto a llegar al éxito, en esta temporada de siembra quiere aumentar la producción porque así aumentara sus ganancias, necesita de capital para la inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, abono, herbicida, insecticida, etc. José Lucio tiene buenas referencias de pago y asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y al mismo tiempo podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
José Lucio is 47, and lives with his life partner and son in their own house. He grows corn, and has several years of working in agriculture. He has acquired a great deal of experience that allows him to to obtain good harvests. 

His farmland is located in an area that is primarily agricultural and close to where he lives. Everything he produces, he sells in the area surrounding the community. He has many customers who prefer him, because he always has what they need at affordable prices and with quality product, and in addition, he is noted for good service. 

José is an admirable man, devoted to his work and to his family. He wishes to meet his objectives, and is working hard to achieve them. He thinks that life is a challenge and is ready to attain success. 

In this planting season, he wants to increase his production, because in this way he will increase his earnings. He needs working capital, and that is why he is applying to Integral for a loan that will allow him to buy corn seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, insecticide, etc. 

José Lucio has good payment references, and says that he will be able to pay the debt within the established period, and at the same time be able to bring financial security to his household.

loans.use: To buy corn seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and insecticide.

loans.name: Claudia Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. Claudia  tiene 28 años y tiene una hijita de la edad de 3 meses,   La señora Claudia vende sabrosos sándwiches de pollo, de cerdo y de chorizo en la feria más populosa de la ciudad de El Alto, Este préstamo es el su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Claudia va a usar este préstamo  para invertir en la compra de 2 parrilleras para su negocio. Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la señora es nueva cliente y le gusta mucho el trabajar e invertir ara progresar ya que comprara dos parrillas grandes, la Sra. Claudia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia de señoras nuevas que se han apostado en el mismo lugar de venta que esto le perjudica un poco, por este motivo desea crecer en su negocio para así elaborar mas sándwich para vender más e incrementar sus ganancias y   va a utilizar los beneficios en la comprara de nuevos utensilios para seguir mejorando en su trabajo, su deseo a la larga para su  negocio es abrir una pensión, para lo que necesitara capital para alquilar un ambiente y el mobiliario
texts.en:
Claudia, age 28, has a three month old daughter.  Claudia sells delicious chicken, pork, and sausage sandwiches at the most populous fair in the city of El Alto.

This loan is her first cycle within the institution.  Claudia is going to use this loan to buy two grills for her business.  Her reason for requesting this loan is that she is a new client, and she really likes the work.  She will invest in order to make progress because she will buy two large grills.

Claudia faces challenges in her business, the competition of new women who have stationed themselves in the same place that she sells.  This hurts her a little.  That is the reason she wishes to grow in her business in order to make more sandwiches to sell more and increase her income.  She will use the profits to buy new utensils in order to continue improving her work.  

Her wish in the long term for her business is to open a cafeteria.  In order to do so she will need capital to rent a place and the furniture.

loans.use: to buy two grills in order to sell chicken, pork, and sausage sandwiches.

loans.name: La Nueva Guardia Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LA NUEVA GUARDIA Está  compuesto por ocho  integrantes siete mujeres y un varón, la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Nancy tiene 39 años con un hijo de 17 que se encuentran estudiando en la universidad, ella se dedica a la venta de comida y refrescos, actividad que realiza todos los días en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en su mismo domicilio de la localidad La Guardia,  preparando y ofreciendo a su clientela platos variados, La mencionada actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ella y su familia la misma que  desarrolla conjuntamente con una persona quien  le ayudan a preparar y atender a sus clientes, el destino del crédito es para la compra por mayor de insumos (papa, arroz, fideo y otros) para lograr tener una despensa llena,  la Sra. Nancy es una persona muy trabajadora lleva años en esta actividad de la venta de comida está muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella ya que esta es la única actividad con la que mantiene a su familia y también agradecida por la ayuda a sus compañeras de grupo ya que en muchos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank La Nueva Guardia is made up of 8 members of which seven are women and one is a man. 

The president of the bank is Nancy. She is 39 years old with a 17 year old child who is a university student. She works selling food and drinks, an activity that she does every day in her facility located in her own home in the town of La Guardia. She prepares and offers her customers a variety of dishes. This activity is the main source of income for her and her family. She started this business together with another person who helps in preparation and in serving the clients. 

The loan will be used to buy wholesale supplies (potatoes, rice, noodles and other items) to stock her pantry. Nancy is a very hardworking person who has years of experience in this business of selling food and she is very grateful to the institution for the help given to her as this is the only activity with which she can support her family and also she is grateful for the help of her friends in the group who in many cases are the sole provider of their households.

loans.use: to buy supplies at wholesale including potatoes, rice, noodles and other items

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is 22 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. For the past two years, Oliver has been working hard to manage her small business selling cassava, bananas, tomatoes and onions. 

To help expand her business, Oliver has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh vegetables to sell and will help Oliver to generate greater profits and pay for rent. Oliver hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Oliver is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh vegetables to sell

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is 22 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is currently in school. For the past three years, Winnie has been working hard to manage her salon where she sells braids and weave and does haircuts. 

To help expand her business, Winnie has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more products like braids and will help Winnie to generate greater profits and buy a plot of land for a house. Winnie hopes that in the future she will be able to driver herself in her own car. 

Winnie is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy more hair products like braids for her salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena has been a hog raiser for almost three years. She is married to Efren, a farmer, and they have five children. 

From a hog she sold, Elena earned about P3,000. She is now asking for a loan of P8,000 to buy feed and medicines for her hogs. She hopes to grow healthy hogs to earn an income.

Someday, Elena would like to improve her hog sales to pay her children's matriculation fees on time.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her hogs

loans.name: Loreto

texts.en:
Loreto is 48 years old, married to Maria and has eight children. Three of them already are married, and the rest still live with them. To earn a living, he raises hogs and sells them. He would like to ensure healthy hogs to raise so he is asking for additional capital of P7,000 to buy medicines, feed and vaccines for the hogs.

Loreto also is saving funds for school fees. In the future, Loreto hopes to achieve a more profitable hog-raising business for the overall welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy medicines, feed and vaccines for his hogs

loans.name: Heriberto Antonio

texts.es: Heriberto Antonio de treinta y ocho años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida Vilma y sus cuatro hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura desde muy joven aprendió el oficio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia, se siente orgulloso porque siempre realiza un trabajo excelente y obtiene las mejores cosechas que le dan la oportunidad de mantenerse adelante de su competencias, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona accesible y apta para el cultivo, todo lo que produce lo comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan a precios accesibles y con producto de calidad además con un buen servicio; Heriberto es un hombre dedicado a su labor, honesto y muy responsable siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le abran paso al éxito, confía en si mismo para cumplir esos objetivos pues sabe que aunque la espera sea larga siempre obtendrá su recompensa, en esta temporada de siembra quiere aumentar la producción pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, abono, herramienta, insecticida, etc. Heriberto Antonio tiene buenas referencias de pago, segura poder saldar la deuda y a la vez darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Heriberto Antonio is 38, and lives with his life partner Vilma and their four children. He grows corn and beans, and has several years of working in agriculture. He learned the occupation from a very young age, and that has endowed him with a great deal of experience. He feels proud, because he has always done an excellent job and has the best harvests, which give him the chance to stay ahead of his competitors.

His farmland is located in an accessible area, suitable for farming.  Everything he produces he sells in the area surrounding the community, as he has a lot of customers who prefer him because he always has what they need at affordable prices, with quality product and good service.  

Heriberto is a man devoted to his work; honest, very responsible, and always expecting new opportunities that will pave the way to success. He relies on himself to meet those objectives, as he knows that although the wait may be long, he will always get his reward. 

He wants to increase production in this planting season, but needs working capital. That is why he is applying to Intergral for a loan that will allow him to buy corn and bean seeds, fertilizer, tools, insecticides, etc. 

Heriberto Antonio has good payment references, and says that he will be able to pay off the debt, and at the same time give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy corn and bean seeds, fertilizer, tools and insecticide.

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther's group is comprised of two hard working women. Esther is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past two years, Esther has been working hard to manage her small business where she sells sugar, rice, salt and soap. 

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a refrigerator and will help Esther to generate greater profits and buy a plot of land. Esther hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Esther is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala East region of Uganda. For the past three years, Faith has been working hard to manage her small business where she sells all types of shoes. 

To help expand her business, Faith has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a wide range of shoes to sell and will help Faith to generate greater profits and buy a house, if possible. Faith hopes that in the future she will be able to buy houses to rent. 

Faith is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy a wide range of shoes to sell

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn lives at Enrile with her spouse Rolan. They have no children yet but are hoping to soon. Ginalyn raises hogs and sells them for profit. She wants to ensure good growth of her hogs through feed and vaccines, but she has insufficient funds now. 

She is now borrowing P6,000 to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs. Someday, Ginalyn hopes to keep making her business profitable so she can save sufficient funds for the family's emergency expenses.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a widow with two kids. She is 56-years-old and lives in the Philippines. 

Carmen is a banana farmer. She has been doing this for four years, and every month she earns 6,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. Carmen has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Carmen hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure

location.town: San Roque, Rizal Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Nayheang's Group

texts.en:
Nayheang, originally from the Kandieng district of Pursat Province, is 63 years old and a mother of six. Currently, they are living with her and helping the family's business, rice farming and food selling. She has managed her food stall and her rice cropping on two hectares of farmland for 27 years, earning about 8,000 KHR per day. 

The main difficulties for her are the lack of water supply for growing rice and the yields being destroyed by insects. To overcome these challenges, she formed a group of three members to seek a new loan. Nayheang and one of her fellow group members are first-time borrowers with Kiva partner VisionFund, while the remaining member is a second-time borrower. 

As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy 10 sacks of fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to gain more yield than before so as to maintain a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Agriculture is the major business for people living in Kampong Cham province. Due to its rich fertile land in the area, local people prefer to grow many different kinds of crops such as rice, potatoes, rubber trees, peppers, corns, coconut trees, beans, tobaccos, fruits, and vegetables. 

One of them, Neang, 24, is engaged in rice farming as the main source of her income. In the same manner, her husband also works in the same type of business. They have strong determination to improve their standard of living and give their only child a bright future. 
 
She aims to expand her farmland in order to increase her yields, but due to the shortage of capital, Neang is asking for a loan of 2,000,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) to supplement her savings to purchase a plot of land. Through the expansion of her business, Neang hopes that she will have an abundant harvest each season and yield a better profit to uplift her living conditions.

loans.use: to supplement her savings to purchase a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Un's Group

texts.en:
Aged 37 and a rural villager from the Kror Lanh district of Siem Reap Province, Un is a mother of three sons. They are dependent on her as some of them are still in school, and some are under-aged for schooling. 

To support the daily basic needs in her household, she grows paddy rice on 1 hectare of farmland and raises one pig. She has been with these businesses for four years. 

To better support her crop and animal husbandry, she formed a group of two female members. Together they are seeking funds in their first loan cycle in the amount of 1,000,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) each. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for farmland, and a portion of it to buy two more piglets in order to expand her pig-raising business. 

She hopes to double her income via her both businesses and attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed and two more piglets.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en: Brenda is from D'ban, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Brenda is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Brenda is selling used products such as perfumes, lotions and many others. Brenda has been in her business for 8 years and earns 6,000 PHP a month. Brenda joined GDMPC in 2008 and is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to buy more stocks of lotion, perfumes, etc. to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of lotion, perfumes, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Amarmurun

texts.en:
Mrs. Amarmurun is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Huvsgul. Her daughter has just graduated from high school and her son goes to kindergarten. Her husband operates a fruit and nuts trading business. 

Since 2000, Amarmurun has been selling organic milk and dairy products. Her business seems to be sustainable because she has already gained a number of regular customers from the local market. She needs 1,500,000 MNT to purchase more organic milk and curds from the countryside to sell at her counter. She is a hardworking and hilarious woman who says ''My daughter will soon join to college. So I have to prepare for my daughter tuition."

loans.use: To purchase more organic milk and curds from the countryside to sell at her counter

loans.name: Elgie

texts.en: Elgie is married with 1 child. She is 32 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. Elgie sells "banana cue" (fried bananas on a stick) to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Every month she earns 8,000 PHP from it. She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase bananas, barbecue sticks and charcoal. In 2008, Elgie joined GDMPC. She hopes to increase her savings for the future needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, barbecue sticks and charcoal

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel is married with 2 kids. She is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. Maribel is a farmer and she operates a banana production business to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years and every month she earns 6,200 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Maribel has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Maribel hopes to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Myagmarsuren is 42 years old and lives in a private house. Her husband runs a transportation business. They have two daughters who are students of the secondary school.  

Mrs. Myagmarsuren has rented some apartments of her private house for three years. Now she is starting a grocery-products trading business. She decided to build a small grocery store near her house. Therefore, it is possible to increase the sales and improve her business. 

She requests a 3,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) loan for it. She is a sanguine woman.

loans.use: To start her new grocery-trading business to build a small grocery store.

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Chheng is 61 years old and a humble farmer residing in a small village of Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She is married with six children, four of whom started their new families while the remaining two are still single and help their parents in the farming business. Chheng has been cultivating rice as her main source of income since 1996, earning approximately 10,000 KHR per day. Her husband, 60, is very supportive in managing their farm.

At the present, Chheng would like to obtain a loan in the sum of 2,000,000 KHR to invest in the farming business. She will use it to pay for operating expenses and to purchase fertilizers and pesticides to apply on her crops. In the future, Chheng wants to expand her farming business and save money for emergency needs.

loans.use: to pay for operating expenses and purchase fertilizers and pesticides to apply on her crops.

loans.name: Earl Roy

texts.en: Earl Roy, 25 years old, is a single entrepreneur of D'ban, Calamba and is earning from his gardening business. It has been going for almost 2 years now and he earns 3,000 PHP a month. To improve business, he borrows 5,000 PHP from GDMPC micro-credit, which he just joined recently, to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Before long, he’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Milena

texts.es: Milena de 33 años de edad es una mujer casada que tiene 4 hijos en las edades  de 4 meses a 13 años, quienes son el motor que la impulsan a buscar cada vez mas el bienestar de su hogar. Ella es una confeccionista  que inició su negocio desde el año 2003 y quien siempre ha dado sentido a su vida diseñando y confeccionando, por eso implementó un taller de confecciones en una habitación en su propia casa donde fabrica ropa y también compra vestidos ya elaborados que comercializa en una clientela fija que la identifica.  Ella decidió orientar su negocio no solo a la fabricación de ropa sino también a su compra, pues encuentra muchas veces precios económicos en las oferta que hacen los proveedores  en el mercado y porque entre su clientela, maneja diferentes perfiles de clientes,  algunos les gusta comprarle ropa sobre sus medidas y a otros encontrar rápidamente lo que buscan y a un precio mas económico. Sus ventas las realizan de contado y a crédito, en oportunidades cuando el mercado incrementa su demanda, debe contratar a otras confeccionistas para responderle a su clientela. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, quinto crédito que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materias primas e insumos como telas, hilos, accesorios y comprará ropa ya elaborada, que le han ofrecido con precios de oportunidad, pues son colecciones que salen del mercado, por los cambios que trae consigo la moda.
texts.en: Milena is 33 years.  She is married and has four children, between the ages of four months and 13 years, and they are the engine that motivates her to look for the betterment of her home’s well-being.  She makes clothing, a business that she began in 2003.  This has always given a meaning to her life of designing and manufacturing, so she set up a workshop in her home, where she makes clothing and also buys ready-made dresses, which she sells to steady customers who know her.  She decided to begin her business not only making clothing, but also buying it.  She often finds good prices through sales that the vendors have.  Some of her customers – she has different types of customers – like to buy clothing made to measure and others like to quickly find what they are looking for at a lower price.  She makes her sales for cash and credit.  Whenever the market increases her demand, she must hire others in order to be able to respond to her customers’ needs.  She is asking for a Kiva loan, her fifth though Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which she can buy raw materials and supplies, such as fabrics, threads, accessories, and also ready-made clothing, which she has been offered a deal on.  These are items that have become available due to the change in fashion.

loans.use: to buy supplies and clothing for resale.

loans.name: Savorn's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village in the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Savorn is 22 years old and married. However, they do not have any children yet. He is a rice farmer and fisherman, while his wife is a fish seller. To supplement the family’s income, they also raise pigs at home. They have engaged in this business for 2 years, earning about 20,000 KHR per day and saving approximately 10,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. However, low crop yield destroyed by an unpredictable flood is the main challenge for his business. 

This is the first microloan for Savorn’s group with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. Now he and a co-member are applying for a loan of 800,000 KHR each. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for his farmland and use a portion of it to purchase materials for his fishing business, including a gill net and plastic barrel for storing the fish. He hopes to gain a larger income from his businesses so he can set aside some money to run a grocery stall in the village for his wife.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, and a plastic fish barrel

loans.name: Sinouch's Group

texts.en:
Age 26 years old, Sinouch has one son who is under school age living in a rural area of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia. Sinouch has been growing paddy rice, beans, and corn for about 5 years while his wife also helps to generate additional income via fish selling. Drought is the main challenge for the field business. 

Sinouch’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. Now he and his fellow group member are applying for their first loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR each with Kiva partner VisionFund. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy fertilizers for his farmland and use a portion of it to spend on water pumping for his rice field. He hopes this loan will enable him to make more income so as to have a good living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and to spend on water pumping for his farmland

loans.name: Racquel

texts.en: Racquel is from the village of Maligaya. She is 33 years old and is married with two children. To earn a living, Racquel engages in a direct-selling business.This serves as her source of income. She has been in this business for 5 years and earns a net income of 3,500 PHP a month. Through her income, she allots funds to save for emergency purposes. As of now, she has insufficient funds, so she is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy shoes, blouses, shorts and perfume to offer and sell in the local community. Racquel would like to have her own stall that will lead to the betterment of her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy shoes, blouses, shorts and perfume to offer and sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes for clothes-selling business

loans.name: Ranel

texts.en:
Ranel is single and 22 years old. He lives in Dban, Calamba. 

Ranel is operating a retail store, selling a variety of products to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for two years and every month he earns PHP 3,000 from this work. 

He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. 

Recently, Ranel joined GDMPC. He hopes to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is a hardworking mother of one child. She is 23 years old and married to a farmer. The family lives in the peaceful village of Maligaya. 

To add to her spouse's income, Mylene raises hogs to fatten and breed, and then sell to butchers in the future. Through her income, she allotted funds to save for emergency purposes. As of now, she has had insufficient funds, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy vitamins and feed for hog sustainability. She would like to ensure proper growth of her hogs so that she can offer them at higher cost. 

Someday, Mylene would like to have a stable hog raising business that will lead to the betterment of her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and feed for hog sustainability.

loans.name: Solidario Las Sunamitas Group

texts.es: Solidario las Sunamitas  este Dúo está integrado por doña Francisca de 35 años de edad tiene bajo su responsabilidad a sus 4 hijos menores de edad, ella es originaria del municipio de San José Poaquil, y se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano y a la crianza de animales, ya tiene varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad  y gracias a Dios por medio de este negocio a podido sacar adelante a sus hijos, el esposo de ella trabaja como jornalero y con el sueldo que gana ayuda a su familia con los gastos de la casa, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de materia prima para la confección de tejidos típicos para la venta.
texts.en: Solidario las Sunamitas: this duo was formed by Francisca, who is 35 years old and cares for her four young children. She is originally from the municipality of San Jose Poaquil, and works making traditional textiles by hand and raising animals. She has worked at this for many years, and she thanks God that through this work she has been able to provide for her children. Her husband works as a laborer and with the income he earns he helps the family with household expenses. She is applying for this loan in order to to buy raw material for the weaving of traditional textiles to sell.

loans.use: to buy raw material for the weaving of traditional textiles.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy embroidery materials for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Doradas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “DORADAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Yola es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de mantas, costura de busos y deportivos, fabricación de muebles, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida, carnicería, venta de regalos, venta de muebles.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Yola es una integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su cuñada que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción de muebles; cuenta que  este taller lo iniciaron conjuntamente su esposo desde que se casaron.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para incremento de capital (compra de madera) mismo que adquirirá de las barracas y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializa a las ferias de la ciudad. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.

En la fotografía podemos ver a la hija de la señora Susan, ella esta parada detras su madre
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Doradas" will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer.  It is part of the central focus of the John Paul II group, is made up of 8 members, and is directed by a board with Mrs. Yola as President.  The businesses of the communal bank members are varied and among them are the following: weaving blankets, sewing pullovers and sports clothes, making furniture, selling cosmetics, selling meals, butchering meat, selling gifts, and selling furniture.  The credit that they receive will benefit small micro businesses like that of Yola, who is a group member.  She indicates that six months ago she joined Pro Mujer, entering based on the invitation of her sister-in-law who is a member of the institution.  Currently she has a business making furniture.  She states that she began the shop together with her husband when they got married.

The credit that she will now receive is for increasing her capital (to purchase wood) which she will acquire from market stalls and later make furniture and sell it in the markets of the city.  This form of work allows her to generate income in order to support her family as much as possible.  She now lives outside of wedlock and has three children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the information about health.  

In the fotograph, in addition to "Doradas" group members, we are able to see the daughter of member Mrs. Susan.  The daughter is standing behind her mother.

loans.use: To purchase wood

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: El Sr. Rubén  tiene 26 años, tiene un hijo de la edad de 1 año, se dedica a la Agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también papa y yuca y maíz en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad 1º DE MAYO,  este préstamo es el su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución,  el Sr. Rubén  va a utilizar  este préstamo para la siembra de maíz y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir, Ruben  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios Para mejorara la calidad de vida del cliente y de sus familiares ya que el ayuda con los gastos del hogar, es un joven responsable y trabajador se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Ruben is 26 years old. He has a one year old child. He works in agriculture growing a variety of vegetables and also potatoes, cassava and corn in his field that is located in the community of 1º de Mayo. This is his 2nd loan cycle with the institution. Ruben is going to use this loan to plant corn and and for what he needs to prepare the land. His reason for asking for this loan is to obtain resources for the planting and to be able to live. Ruben faces challenges in his business such as the bad weather that many times ruins the crops. The proceeds will be used to improve the quality of life of the client and his family and to help with the household expenses. He is a responsible and hardworking young man who feels grateful with the institution for giving its support.

loans.use: to plant corn and rice

loans.name: Cinthia

texts.es: La Sra. Cinthia tiene 27  años tiene dos hijos que son de las edades de 4 y 2 años, ella se dedica a la Agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también papa y yuca en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de Pacay, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Cinthia  va a utilizar  este préstamo para la siembra de maní y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir,  la Sra. cinthia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios Para mejorara la calidad de vida su familia ya que ella corre con todos los gastos del hogar, la Sra. es una persona  responsable y trabajadora se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Cinthia is 27 years old, and she has two children, ages 4 and 2.

She grows a variety of vegetables and potatoes and yucca on her plot of land in the Pacay community.  This loan is her first cycle within the institution.  Cinthia with use the loan to plant peanuts and to prepare the land.  Her reason for requesting this loan is to get resources for the planting and to be able to survive.

Cinthia faces a challenge in her business, which is the inclement weather that often ruins the sown fields.  She will use the profits to improve her family’s quality of life because she is responsible for all of the household expenses.  She is a responsible and hard-working person.  She is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to plant peanuts and to prepare the land.

loans.name: Ang's Group

texts.en:
Ang is 35 years old and married with two daughters, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She lives in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district of Cambodia. 

For her children’s sake, she has been involved in rice cultivation as the main source of income for 15 years. For her family, the main challenge is the drought, which reduces her crop yields. 

Ang has been with VisionFund for six cycles and completely paid back the past loans, while her co-member is just a first-cycle client. She has successfully used the past loans to support her children's education and save some money to set up a pole at her house.  

Now she is leading her group to request a loan; she and the co-member are taking out a new loan of 1,400,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR, respectively. 

Ang is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland, and some portion will be used to buy soil for refilling her house. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from the current business so as to improve her living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland and also soil for refilling her house.

loans.name: Sokhea's Group

texts.en:
Living in a village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia, Sokhea is a 24-year-old married mother of one son. 

She makes a living through farming rice on three and a half hectares of farmland. Having been in this business for six years, she is able to earn approximately 15,000 KHR per day, and manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge for her paddy field. 

Sokhea’s group consists of two members who live in the same village; she is a second-time borrower and her co-member is a first-time borrower. She completely paid back the prior loan, which has helped her relieve the family’s burden and improve her livelihood. 

Now Sokhea and her group member are applying for a loan with VisionFund of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland. She hopes her crop yield will become more profitable so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland.

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia, Sinat is 27 years old and a married mother of three sons, all of whom are still in school and dependent on her. She makes a living through planting cucumbers and cabbages, and supplements the family’s income by raising chickens. She has engaged in this business for one year. Her husband works for others for a fee. 

Low crop yield caused by flooding is the main challenge for her business. This is the second loan cycle for Sinat with Kiva partner VisionFund, and the first loan cycle for her fellow group member. The past loan helped her in having sufficient food and supporting her children’s education. Now leading her group of two in this loan request, Sinat will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seed for planting vegetables and to buy chickens and piglets for raising to earn extra income. She hopes this loan will enable her to expand her current business so as to improve her standard of living and keep the children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for planting vegetables

loans.name: Uk

texts.en: Uk is a resident living with her brother in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province, Cambodia. She is 36 years old and single. To earn a living, Uk has been engaged in rice farming for almost 22 years. She is very fortunate that she is able to grow and harvest rice to sell to local traders each harvest season, which usually occurs twice a year. She typically generates income of 10,000 KHR each day. Uk has transportation difficulties because she doesn’t own a vehicle. She has to pay for transportation if she wants to get somewhere. Uk would like to reduce her expenses and save more money for her business and her family’s future, so now she is asking for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for commuting. She believes that good transportation will help her get involved in other businesses. In the future, Uk plans to purchase extra land to make her farming business more productive.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Jessica Marianela

texts.es:
Jessica vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en una de las comunidades que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, dedicada principalmente al cultivo de arboles frutales como el mango y el limón.

Jessica mantiene un negocio de venta de prendas de vestir desde hace varios años. Empezó ofreciendo mercadería en su domicilio y poco a poco su demanda fue creciendo, a tal punto que ahora tiene clientes en caseríos y en comunidades aledañas, ella recorre estas zonas constantemente ofreciendo sus productos y entregando pedidos. Ella pone mucho esfuerzo y ganas a su trabajo, ya que la ayuda a sentirse activa y le otorga la oportunidad de ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de la zona. Su motivación diaria es tratar de brindar a sus hijos un futuro mejor.

Ella ya ha tenido créditos financiados a través de Kiva anteriormente y, gracias al apoyo brindado su negocio crece cada dia mas. Jessica desea seguir adquiriendo mercadería de temporada para incrementar su stock y diversificar su oferta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar un nuevo crédito de 2500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Jessica se encuentra bastante agradecida con las personas que le apoyaron con su préstamo anteriormente y agradece de antemano a las personas que le apoyarán en el presente. Ella les manda bendiciones.
texts.en:
Jessica lives with her husband and children in one of the communities that makes up the agricultural district of Tambogrande, an agricultural area located in the region of Piura, dedicated mainly to the cultivation of fruit trees such as mango and lemons. 

Jessica has had a business selling clothing for many years. She began offering merchandise in her home and little by little the demand grew to the point where she now has customers in the villages and surrounding communities, and she travels to these areas constantly offering her products and delivering orders. She puts a lot of effort and enthusiasm into her work as it helps her to feel active and offers the opportunity of helping her husband with support in the economic area. Her daily motivation is to try to give her children a better future.

She has had financial loans funded through Kiva previously and thanks to the support provided her business grows more each day. Jessica wants to continue buying seasonal supplies in order to increase her stock and diversify her merchandise. This is why she is asking for a new loan of 2500 soles to help her achieve her objective.

Jessica is very grateful to the people that helped her with her previous loan and gives thanks in advance to the people that will be helping her now. She sends them blessings.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing to expand her business

loans.name: Isaias

texts.es: El Sr. Isaías tiene 36 años tiene 2 hijos que son de las edades de 7 y 5 años,  el se dedica  a la  venta y  crianza de ganado en la localidad de Villa Tumavi, este préstamo es su quinta secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Isaías va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ganado para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de ganado, el Sr. Isaías enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su calidad de vida y  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar la calidad en la alimentación de sus ganado,  su deseo es poder tener una granja donde pueda criar mayor cantidad de ganado para que de esta manera pueda mejorar su estabilidad económica, ya que esta es la única actividad con la que mantiene a su familia.
texts.en: Isaías, 36, has 2 children ages 7 and 5. He makes a living by raising and selling cattle in Villa Tumavi. This will be his fifth loan with the institution. He will use it to purchase cattle for his business and is asking for a loan as he himself lacks the capital. Isaías' business faces some challenges such as improving his quality of life. He plans to use his profits for improving his cattle feed. His desire is to own a farm where to grow more cattle and be more stable financially because this is his family's only livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 49 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. 

Marina is engaged in mango production and a vending business and earns approximately PHP 7,000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 50000 to purchase fertilizer for mangoes.

Marina has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years. In the future, Marina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for mangoes

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa is 39 years old and married with two children. She has had a general store in the village of Maligaya for more than six years. This is her way in helping her husband as well as improving their living situation. To earn a higher income, she is asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP for additional working capital. This will be used to purchase condiments, daily use products, assorted breads, and soft drinks, in addition to products she already offers. Hopefully, she will be able to improve their lifestyle, which is a goal other people are also aiming for. She prays for the growth of her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase condiments, daily use products, assorted breads, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Jacinta Lucia

texts.es: A sus 45 años Jacinta ha logrado cumplir algunos de sus sueños como apoyar a sus hijos en su educación mejorar su vivienda y mantener su negocio. Jacinta se dedica a la venta de golosinas, bebidas y confiterías hace más de 15 años. Comenzó vendiendo dulces  poco a poco fue mejorando su negocio, actualmente nos manifiesta que también ofrece jugos de frutas, siendo  sus principales clientes  personas que viajan al centro del país. Jacinta es madre de 04 hijos, actualmente sigue apoyando a 02 de ellos. Posteriormente desea terminar de construir su vivienda. El crédito que solcito lo destinará para la compra de golosinas bebidas y frutas y así poder atender a sus clientes. Jacinta se siente feliz y agradece  la ayuda brindada.
texts.en: At 45 years old Jacinta has achieved some of her dreams such as helping her children with their education, improving her home, and maintaining her business. Jacinta has been selling sweets, drinks and candy for more than 15 years. She began selling sweets and little by little her business improved. She discloses that she is currently also offering fruit juices since her main customers travel to the center of the country. Jacinta is the mother of 4 children, currently she continues supporting 2 of them. In the future she hopes to finish constructing her home. She is asking for a loan to use to buy sweets, drinks, and fruit and thus to be able to serve her customers. Jacinta is happy and grateful for the help provided.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, drinks, and fruit

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a 48-year-old married woman. She has five children between the ages of 15 and 25. She describes herself to be faithful and trustworthy. She operates a beauty salon where she provides hair services. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located at a busy market and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low purchasing power for her hair services. She will use the 11,100 KES loan to buy a water tank for her family's use and her household chores. Her business goal is to improve her hair services within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will open a big beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy scrap for scrap business

loans.name: Edgar Rafael

texts.es: Edgar de 33 años vive en la ciudad de Cartagena, una ciudad al norte de Colombia a orillas del mar Caribe, lugar donde estudió una carrera técnica y donde al finalizarla y no lograr ubicarse  laboralmente, decidió sugerido por su familia, dedicarse a una actividad comercial, la cual inició con mucho recelo, pero poco a poco al enfrentarse como comerciante al mercado, encontró una gran oportunidad de generar ingresos; pues le ha ido muy bien, ha fortalecido su autonomía y por eso planea invertirle todos sus esfuerzos para hacerla crecer; no obstante Edgar tiene un gran desafío de  inversión y su capital de trabajo es insuficiente para lograr ampliar su cobertura de clientes en el mercado. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  mediante el cual comprará artículos para el hogar y de aseo personal, productos de una mayor rotación y que coprados en mayor volumen incrementan las utilidades del negocio de Edgar. Su meta mas adelante es convertirse en uno de los más grandes distribuidores de estos productos  y muy seguramente lo conseguirá, porque tiene la disciplina y capacidad de trabajo que se requiere para ser exitoso y llevarle a su familia bienestar.
texts.en: Edgar is 33 years old and lives in Cartagena, a city located in northern Colombia, along the Caribbean Sea, where he studied for a technical career, and where he was not able to find a job once he completed his studies.   He decided, on his family’s suggestion, to start a business, which he began with caution, but little by little he was able to find a great opportunity to generate an income.  Things have gone well for him.  He has strengthened his autonomy and so he plans to put all his efforts into making it grow, however Edgar has a great investment challenge and his working capital is insufficient to be able to expand his coverage to his clients in the market.  This is why he has requested a Kiva loan.  It will be his first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which he will use to buy household and personal items.  These items sell well and buying them in quantity increases Edgar’s business’ profit.  His goal for the future is to become one of the largest distributors of these products and he will certainly achieve it because he is disciplined and has the ability that he needs to be successful and ensure his family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy household and personal use items for resale.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 10 years. She describes herself to be an aggressive woman. She operates a retail store where she sells fabric and threads. She has been involved in this business for 7 years and employs 1 staff members. Her business is located in a competitive business environment and her primary customers are students and residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be fluctuations of demand on the fabric sometimes. She will use the Kes 15,600 loan to buy a water tank for her family's use. Her business goal is to improve her business  within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business into a big retail store business premise.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 49 years old. She is married, with three children. She has been engaged in her sari-sari store for  three years and earns about PHP 300 a day. Jacqueline needs additional capital. That is why she is taking out this loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to buy additional stocks of groceries such as canned goods, noodles, condiments, candies and biscuit to sell. Jacqueline hopes to improve  her business to secure her family's future and continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries such as canned goods, noodles, condiments, candies and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Kibet

texts.en:
Kibet is a married man. He has 8 children. He describes himself to be determined and warm. He operates a farm where he sells maize and tomatoes. He has been involved in this business for 30 years and employs 4 staff members. His business is located in an agricultural area and his primary customers are farmers. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be low purchasing power of items sometimes. He will use the Kes 21,000 loan to buy a water tank. His business goal is to export his maize to outside the country within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business. Kibet has received four loans which he repayed.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 59 years.She is married to Peter and they are blessed with four children aged 28, 25,18 and 15 years old.

She has been in the retail shop business for two years and earns a monthly income of KES.6,000. The loan will be used to purchase stock items for her business such as sugar, flour and soaps for sale. The anticipated profits will be used to pay school fees for her children.

This is her first loan term from KADET LTD. Her hopes and dreams are to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy stocks of sugar, flour and soaps for sale.

loans.name: Yomina James

texts.en:
Yomina is a 38 year-old  businessman who lives in Juba.  He is married and has four children between the ages of five and twelve.  All of them go to school.  Yomina  runs a business selling poles and has been in business for 6 years.  He has one employee.   He heard about Finance Sudan through  other clients.  He is taking a loan of 3000sdg to purchase poles, timber and other wood.  In addition to this business, he has no other source of income.

In 5 years, Yomina would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high transportation costs. Yomina  says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy items like timber, poles, bamboos, etc.

loans.name: Zita

texts.en:
Zita is 47 years old and married with six children.

Zita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and medicines for her pigs.

Zita has been raising pigs for seven years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva, to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and medicines for her pigs.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Encarnacion works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and vegetable vending. Encarnacion is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her business.

Encarnacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis is 33 years old and lives in Sebac,Tudela.  He is married, with two children. 

Dennis is a private employee, a security guard at PMPC Tudela Branch and earns about PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work.  Dennis has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase additional housing materials.

Dennis has been a member of PMPC for seven years.  In the future, Dennis hopes to send his children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional housing materials.

loans.name: Pamfila

texts.en:
Pamfila is married, with three children. She is 54  years old and lives in Overview, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Pamfila owns a sari-sari store to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns 3000 doing this type of work.
