She has requested a loan of 20,000 to purchase more stock for her general store.

Pamfila has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Pamfila hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en: Trinidad is 52 years old and widowed with 5 children. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and works hard to provide for her family. Trinidad has been in this business for 8 years and has previously borrowed funds through Kiva partners. Trinidad requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in the store.  Trinidad aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in the store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee plants and fertilizer

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en: Gilbert is a 34 year-old married man. He has four children, with ages ranging from four years to twelve years. He describes himself to be a determined and informed man. He operates a retail business where he sells plastic items such as water storage containers, utensils, school boxes, etc. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located within a busy business area and his primary customers are teachers, farmers and students' parents and guardians. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the family's over-dependence on him, which makes it difficult to improve his business. He will use the Kes 8,700 loan to buy a water tank for his family use. His business goal is to diversify his business into opening a new shopping mall in his hometown within 5 years. Gilbert also sells milk in addition to his retail business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Di

texts.en:
Di is an industrious mother who always seeks ways to make a better income for her family. She is 34 years old and has one child who is still enrolled in a local school. She and her husband own a few hectares of farmland on which they grow and harvest rice This produces their income and satisfies their living needs. Aside from rice farming, they are involved in trading lotus fruits they collected around their community. They are raising the family in Baray district, Kompong Tom province.

In order to sustain their business and stabilize her income, Di is now requesting a loan of 3,000,000 to purchase lotus fruits for trading. She believes that through this loan she will be able to generate better revenues and hopes that she will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to purchase lotus fruits for trading.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is 28 years old and married to Gilbert. She has been loaned 60,000 KES by KADET LTD. This is her third loan with KADET which she will use to buy knitting items for sale such as materials, threads and laces and also to her other business to purchase stocks of clothes for sale.

Everlyne currently earns 13,250 KES monthly. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her clothes business. Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique in the future and be able to provide a quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase knitting materials, different colors of threads, laces, designs, etc.

loans.name: Cesar Julio

texts.es:
Cesar es un padre de familia de 29 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en uno de los caseríos que conforman la parte rural del distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola que produce principalmente frutas como el mango y limón. La zona se encuentra situada en la región norteña de Piura.

Su vivienda se encuentra situada en un campo de cultivo que es de su padre y que el ayuda a administrar. En ese terreno han instalado los cultivos de mango, limón y cacao. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza de animales, especificamente de ganado vacuno. En la zona estas actividades son bastante comunes por lo que existe un mercado con demanda estable, los productos frutales que se ofrecen generalmente son vendidos a plantas procesadoras de la zona, que exportan los productos una vez procesados y envasados.

Gracias a este tipo de actividad los pobladores del distrito estan viendo mejorar poco a poco su calidad de vida y el acceso a servicios básicos como la electricidad es cada vez mas extendido. Tambogrande se caracteriza por ser una comunidad pujante y creciente.

Cesar es uno claro ejemplo de los pobladores de la zona: enteramente dedicado a labores agropecuarias y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Actualmente el desea adquirir fertilizantes para abonar sus cultivos y también contratar a un grupo de trabajadores (jornaleros) que le ayuden a brindar mantenimiento a sus cultivos, de ese modo espera poder asegurarse una mejor producción. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles.

Cesar agradece de antemano el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Cesar is a 29 year old father who lives with his wife and two children in one of the villages that make up the rural part of the district of Tambogrande, an agricultural district that produces mainly fruits such as mango and lemons. The area is located in the northern region of Piura. 

His home is located on a farm that his father helps to manage. On this land they are growing mango, lemons and cocoa. Additionally he breeds animals, specifically cattle. These activities are common enough in this area so a market exists with a stable demand. The fruit is usually sold to processing plants in the area, that export the products once they are processed and packaged.

Thanks to this type of activity the residents of the district are seeing their quality of life improve little by little and access to basic services such as electricity is becoming more widespread. Tambogrande is characterized by an energetic and growing community. 

Cesar is a clear example of the residents of the area: entirely dedicated to agricultural work and eager to get ahead. Currently he wants to buy compost to fertilize his crops and also to contract a group of workers (laborers) to help him maintain his crops, and in this way he hopes to be able to make sure of a better production. In order to achieve his objective he has decided to ask for a loan from Edpyme Alternative of 3000 soles. Cesar gives his thanks in advance for support given.

loans.use: to buy compost to fertilize the crops and to contract a group of laborers to provide maintenance to the crops of mango, lemons, and cocoa.

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Ganbaatar is 53 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger in Uvurhangai Province, Mongolia. His wife, Butedmaa, is also 53 years old. His older daughter, Erdentsetseg, is 25 years old. His son, Narmandah, is 23 years old. His daughter is unemployed. His son works in Ulaanbaatar - the capital city. 

Mr. Ganbaatar started his oven making business in 2005 with his wife. He makes stoves, which work with small sized coal. Now that winter is approaching, customers demands are high; therefore, he needs to keep up with the demands in order to be successful. He is a hardworking and quiet-natured man. He needs 2,300,000 MNT to purchase raw materials for his business

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for his business.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 34 years old, married to Peter and blessed with 4 children ages 14, 9, 5 and 2 years old, respectively. Annah sells grocery goods, a business she started 12 years ago. She earns a monthly income of 5,000 KES. 

She has requested her first loan of 10,000 KES to purchase more fruits and vegetables for sale. The anticipated profit will aid her to pay school fees for her children. 

Her dream is to be a successful businesswoman as well as educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 29 years old. She is married to Cosmas and they are blessed with two children, ages 3 and 8 years old.

Margaret has been in the quarry business for 2 years and earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES. The loan that she acquires from KADET LTD will be used to buy equipment for her quarry business. The anticipated profits will be used to pay school fees for her children and also diversify her business ventures.

This is Margaret's second loan from KADET LTD and she has successfully repaid her previous loan. Her hopes and dreams are to own several quarries and also start up a retail shop in the aim of diversifying her businesses.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her quarry business.

loans.name: Lifamy

texts.en:
Lifamy is 27 years old and is from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married and her husband works as a fisherman. 

Lifamy and her husband are engaged in fishing for an income. She is asking for a loan to buy gasoline for their boat, fish hooks, a fish net, and wood and nails for house renovation. Lifamy plans to expand her fishing business to make better income so that she can support her family and future children.

loans.use: to buy gasoline for their boat, fish hooks, a fish net, and wood and nails for house renovation.

loans.name: Pat

texts.en:
Pat is a 42-year-old married woman who has been residing in Baray District, Cambodia, where she and her husband are operating a farming business on their inherited farmland. Rice is their focused crop and has become the major source of their income. Together, they have been working in this occupation for almost 30 years. Most of their profit goes for food, clothing, commodity costs, and allowances for their four children who are still students in local schools.

Due to the needs of capital to invest in their farming business, Pat has turned to HKL for her second loan to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for their one hectare lot of farm land and to pay for other operating expenses. With her hard work and the help of this loan, Pat knows that someday she will attain success and provide a better life and education for their children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for their one hectare lot of farm land and to pay for other operating expenses.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en: Ofelia is 44 years old, married and has three children. Ofelia sells fish around their village using their transport motorcycle. She has been in this business for 3 years and earns about 1,500 PHP a week. She is happy with her busines because this is the main source of her income. Right now, Ofelia is asking a loan in the amount of 12,000 PHP to buy more fish such as milk-fish and "tilapia" to sell. With this loan, Ofelia hopes to expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more fish such as milk-fish and "tilapia" to sell

loans.name: Luka

texts.en:
Luka is a 35-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has 3 children between the ages of 5 and 12; all of them go to school. Luka runs a general store and has been in business for 3 years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. He is taking a loan of  2,500 SDG to purchase soda, water, pens and many other items. In addition to this business, Luka has no other source of income.

In 5 years Luka would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high prices in the market. Luka says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy items like pens, sandals, soda, water. sweets, etc.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 43 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su pareja y sus 3 hijos, a quienes ama y son principal en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto a su pareja unen todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; en sus ratos libres  le gusta ver programas educativos y noticieros en televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un delicioso Lomo Saltado para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, día a día Carlos trabaja brindando servicios de seguridad, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, a veces puede trabajar en turnos rotativos, tanto de día como de noche, Carlos trabaja un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Carlos se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de estudio de uno de sus hijos, ya que desea poder brindarle educación superior, así el podrá pagar la matrícula y comprar los equipos y herramientas que necesita su hijo para desarrollar la carrera de Mecánica Aeronáutica; de esta manera Carlos seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para cumplir su gran sueño de ver convertidos a sus hijos en grandes profesionales y en hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Carlos, 43, lives in the city of Nazca with his partner and three children whom he loves and are the focus of his life. He is a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person. Together with his partner they put all their effort into getting their family ahead.  In his spare time, he likes to watch educational programs and the news and sometimes cooking the delicious Lomo Saltado to share with his family. 

With a lot of effort and enthusiasm, Carlos makes his living providing security services.  He works everyday from early in the morning, sometimes working both morning and night shifts. He works about 12 hours a day and believes that he does well because of his good performance and his kindness towards others. 

Carlos is very grateful for the Kiva loans because they will allow him to cover the school costs for one of his children as he would like to give them a higher education. In this way he can pay tuition and buy the equipment and tools his son will need to develop his career as an Aviation Mechanic.  Carlos will continue to work and strive to fulfil his dream of seeing his children become great professional and honest men.

loans.use: Para cubrir los gastos de estudio de uno de sus hijos.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 42-year-old single mother of two children aged 23 and 10 years old. She runs a restaurant alongside farming, a business she started 11 years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

Hellen has requested her first loan of KES 25,000 to purchase a refrigerator for proper storage of food. The anticipated profit will aid her in catering to her family's basic needs. Her dream is to be a successful business woman.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigirator for proper storage of food.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 39 years old and is married with three children. She has been running her sari-sari store for 2 years and earns about 300 PHP a day. She wants to improve and expand her business. To make this possible, Evelyn is asking for a loan in the amount of 12,000 PHP to buy assorted bread, condiments, and daily use products to sell. She believes that she can improve her store through the loan she requested.

loans.use: to buy assorted bread, condiments, and daily use products to sell.

loans.name: Dorica

texts.en:
Dorica is 40 years old and single. She has four children aged 18, 15, 10, and 7 years old.

She has been in the grocery business for 4 years and currently earns a monthly income of KES 5,000. This loan will be used to purchase vegetables and fruits for sale. The anticipated profits will be used to pay school fees for her children.

This is Dorica's first loan with KADET LTD. Her hopes and dreams are to raise her family well by providing for their basic needs adequately and make her family happy.

loans.use: to purchase vegeatables and fruits for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a raw materials for his business.

loans.name: Asca

texts.en:
Asca is 63 years old, married, and blessed with seven children who are all grown ups. She is a poultry farmer - a practice she ventured into 4 years ago. She earns a monthly income of KES 8,000. 

Asca has requested a second loan of KES 30,000 to purchase more chicks for rearing and chicken feed. The profit she earns will help her build a rental house, clear her debts, and expand her farming business. She hopes to be successful in life.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 43 years-old.  She is married to Samuel and together they have four children aged 14, 12, nine and five years.

She has a school which she has run for the last 10 years and earns a monthly income of KES.5,000.  The loan will be used to purchase extra desks for her school.  The anticipated profits will be used to renovate the classrooms.

This is the 1st loan term with Kiva partner KADET LTD.  Her hopes and dreams are to start up a university.

loans.use: to purchase desks for her school.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 35 years old and married with 5 children. With 4 children in school, Rosana works very hard to provide for them.

Rosana runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. Rosana requested a loan of 19,500 PHP through NWTF to buy more charcoal to sell.

In the future, Rosana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl works hard to support her family. Cheryl is married and has a banana retail business in the Philippines.

Cheryl is borrowing PHP 1,400 through NWTF to buy an Envirofit Cookstove.

She is getting the Envirofit Cookstove because she wants to make the firewood that she buys last longer (the Envirofit Cookstove needs less fuel to cook food).

Cheryl is aware that by using the Envirofit Cookstove, she is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To buy an Envirofit Cookstove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy essential materials for his motorbike.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Luis  tiene 28 años tiene un hijo de la edad de nueve meses, el se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida en su restaurante  que se encuentra  ubicado en la zona central de la ciudad de La Paz,  actividad que realiza todos los días preparando y ofreciendo a su clientela platos variados, La mencionada actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para el y su familia la misma que  desarrolla conjuntamente con su pareja quien le ayudan a preparar y atender a sus clientes, el destino del crédito es para la compra de un televisor, vajilla y mesas,  el Sr. Luis es una persona muy trabajadora lleva años en esta actividad de la venta de comida está muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Luis is 28 years old and has a nine month old son.  He makes and sells food in his restaurant, located in the central zone of La Paz.  He does this daily, preparing and offering various dishes to his customers.  This activity is the main source of income for him and his family.  He and his wife run the business together.  She helps him prepare the food and serve the customers.  He will use the money from this loan to buy a television, dishes, and tables.  Luis is a very hardworking person and he has been selling food for many years.  He is very grateful to the institution for its support.

loans.use: to buy a TV and dishes for his restaurant.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 60 years-old and married with nine children.

Nida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 23000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Nida has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal sales business for 15 years and also earns an income from banana sales and farming vegetables.

Nida aspires to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Alejandria

texts.en: Alejandria lives in Poblacion, Aurora. For the last 20 years, she has earned an income through providing retail services in order to support the needs of her four children. She gets an income of 6,000 a month from this business. For a 56-year old mother, there’s nothing more that can make her happy except to see her children successful in their studies. Without hesitation, Alejandria borrows the amount of 10,000 from Kiva partner GDMPC microcredit to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. She joined GDMPC just this year. Her plan in the future is to hopefully improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Mayllen Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Mayllen” está conformado por 19 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de empanadas, venta de completos, feriantes, venta de ropa, venta de verduras, venta de abarrotes, venta de pescado, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Conchalí, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Silvana, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda a su lado derecho se encuentra su nieta, viste un pantalon de color negro, encima lleva puesto una chaqueta de color café, su pelo es de color oscuro y lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro de alimentos, específicamente ofrece almuerzos, se desempeña en sus labores desde hace 15 años. Comenta que trabaja sola de lunes a domingo desde las 8ºº hasta las 17ºº horas, ya que a esta hora llega su ultimo pedido de almuerzo.
Su mercadería la compra en diferentes parte, donde encuentra su mercadería a bajo costo, supermercados, distribuidoras, tiendas.
Con el crédito comprará una juguera, microondas, platos, servicios, mercadería en alimentos.
Una de las metas de Silvana es tener un negocio más grande y comprar un horno industrial para poder hacer empanadas y vender en grandes cantidades.
Silvana vive junto a su esposo, hermana, sobrino y una sobrina. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es tener la oportunidad de comprar un horno  industrial para poder generar mayores ingresos, así darle un buen pasar a su familia.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses, lo cual le ha servido como un momento de  distracción. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Conchalí es una comuna de la región metropolitana (donde está Santiago, capital de Chile)  ubicada hacia el norte de la misma. Posee un barrio industrial delimitado, y múltiples actividades económicas y comerciales de pequeño tamaño, incluyendo ferias libres, talleres artesanales, garajes, terminales de buses, entre otros. El sector microempresarial es muy relevante en su actividad comercial.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Mayllen” and is composed of 19 entrepreneurs that make their living in different sectors which include selling meat pies, selling food, peddlers, selling clothing, selling vegetables, selling groceries, selling fish, services and more.  All of them are part of the community of Conchali, located in the city of Santiago. 

Silvana, a member of the communal bank, is sitting in the front row of the picture, the second adult from the right. Sitting next to her is her granddaughter. She is wearing black pants and a brown jacket. She had dark hair and she wears it up. Silvana makes her living in the food sector; specifically she sells lunch which she has done for 15 years. She says that she works alone from Monday through Sunday from 8am through 5pm because that is when she receives her last lunch order.

She buys her merchandise from different locations, wherever it’s cheapest, including supermarkets, distributors, and shops.  With the loan she will buy a juicer, microwaves, dishes, amenities, and food.

One of Silvana’s goals is to have a bigger business and to buy an industrial oven in order to be able to make meat pies and sell them in larger quantities. Silvana lives with her husband, sister, nephew, and niece.  Her dreams at work include to opportunity to buy an industrial oven so as to generate more income and in this way give her family a good life. 

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has given her because it has allowed her to invest in her business. Additionally, she feels very comfortable in the company of the other entrepreneurs of the communal bank because they share different activities and interests which gives her a quick pastime. In regards to the trainings at these meetings, she has learned how to manage her business better. 

Conchali is a municipality in the metropolitan area (located in Santiago, the capital of Chile) located in the northern region. It has a defined industrial area and has many economic and commercial activities of a smaller scale including street markets, craft workshops, garages, and bus terminals among others. The microenterprise sector is very relevant to her commercial activity.

loans.use: to buy a juicer, microwaves, dishes, amenities, and food

loans.name: Asima

texts.en:
Mrs. Asima is a young, married woman. She has been selling fruits enthusiastically for 5 years. Her husband facilitates this by purchasing different fruits from the market and bringing them home. She sells them to her neighbors and earns enough to support her family well.

She has three kids. She is able to provide them with good quality food, clothing, and an education. In order to improve her business, she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy more fruits and in a greater quantity in order to sell them to more people. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and in a greater quantity

loans.name: Bolivianitas - 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento BOLIVIANITAS-26 Está  compuesto por once  integrantes nueve mujeres y dos varones, la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Angelica tiene 40 años y dos  hijos de las edades de 12 y 19 años,  que se encuentran estudiando en la universidad y en colegio, ella se dedica a la venta de desayunos, actividad que realiza todos los días en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en su mismo domicilio por la zona de Vino Tinto,  preparando y ofreciendo a su clientela  variedad  de desayunos, La mencionada actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ella y su familia la misma que  desarrolla conjuntamente con una persona quien  le ayudan a preparar y atender a sus clientes, el destino del crédito es para la compra por mayor de mobiliario y para la ampliación de su negocio la Sra. Angelica es una persona muy trabajadora lleva años en esta actividad de la venta de desayunos está muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella ya que esta es la única actividad con la que mantiene a su familia y también agradecida por la ayuda a sus compañeras de grupo ya que en muchos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank Bolivianitas 26 is made up of eleven members, nine women and two men. 

The bank president is Angelica. She is 40 years old and has two children who are 12 and 19 years old who are studying at school and university. She works selling breakfasts, an activity that she does every day from her facility in her own home in the area of Vino Tinto, preparing and offering her customers various breakfast dishes. This activity is her main source of income for her and her family. She started this together with another person that helps her in preparations and in attending to the clients. 

The loan is to be used to purchase wholesale furniture and to expand her business. Angelica is a hard working person with many years experience in this business of selling breakfasts.She is very grateful with the institution for the support given to her as this is her only activity with which she maintains her family and she is also grateful for the help of her friends in the group as in many cases they are the sole support of their families.

loans.use: to expand her business and to buy furniture

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support her family. Helen is married and has a house rental business in the Philippines.

Helen requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to repair and renovate her house for rental.

She has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To repair and renovate her house for her business

loans.name: Ma. Lyn

texts.en:
Ma. Lyn is 44 years-old and married with four children.

Ma. Lyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Ma. Lyn has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal sales business for 15 years and also earns an income from buying and selling ready to wear and farming vegetables.

Ma. Lyn aspires to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Yun is 40 years old and a farmer living in Baray district with her family: her husband and four children who are studying in a local school. Yun typically earns around 10,800 KHR per day and another income is generated by her husband. Presently, some of her children help her as her motivation in her farming business when they have no schedule at school. Yun has been planting and harvesting rice and other seasonal crops to sell for over 20 years.

Yun inspires to increase her yields and better her living standard, so she is borrowing a loan of 1,500,000 KHR to hire laborers planting rice crops. With the help of the loan and a suitable manner she applied to her crops, she is confident she can have a satisfactory yield. She will save her profit for her children’s future education and emergencies of the family.

loans.use: to hire laborers to plant her rice crop.

loans.name: Brejido

texts.en: Every individual aims to be successful in life; they work hard and strive even harder to achieve their goals. Likewise, Brejido aims to improve his living conditions and give his family a better life. He is 33 years old and newly married. He owns and manages a variety store in their community while his wife has applied to work abroad. At this time, they plan to earn and save more income to satisfy their needs and build their own dream house someday. To work out their plan, Brejido aims to strengthen his variety store to increase his income. Due to having inadequate capital, he is asking for a loan of PHP 45,000 to buy additional canned goods, snack foods, noodles, soaps, beverages, candies, seasonings, and soft drinks to sell. Despite having competitors in the area, he has the determination to improve his business, as he believes that patience and sacrifice are the keys to success.

loans.use: To buy additional canned goods, snack foods, noodles, soaps, beverages, candies, seasonings, and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen, 50 years old, is a farmer villager living in Baray district. He lives with his wife and six single children, with the oldest child already married with a new family. Pen has been farming for over 25 years. To earn additional income, in his spare time he always goes fishing along the nearby river with some of his children. 

Pen aims to send one of his sons to a mechanical training course in Phnom Penh, so he will get a specific skill in his life. Moreover, this will enable him to start his first business and to provide this service in his community. Pen is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR to add to his existing money to pay his son's tuition fees. Pen hopes that he could help all of his children in pursuing their education and skills in life.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for his son.

loans.name: Los Intachables Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LOS INTACHABLES Está  compuesto por ocho  integrantes todas mujeres, la presidenta del banco La Sra. Albertina tiene 50 años y es casada con dos hijos que son de las edades de 18 y 21 años, ella se dedica al  comercio de combustible y lubricantes para movilidades ella tiene su tienda  de venta en un lugar estratégico de la localidad de El Torno,  este préstamo es su cuarta secuencia dentro de la institución la Sra. Albertina va a usar este préstamo para la compra de lubricantes y combustible por mayor para así surtir su puesto  razón para solicitar este préstamo es que  quiere mejorar su negocio y ofrecer sus productos por mayor, la Sra. Albertina  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son que no es estable ya que es según la temporada  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando variedad de productos, su deseo es tener un negocio estable y rentable y de esta manera genera más ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida, está muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella ya que esta es la única actividad con la que mantiene a su familia y también agradecida por la ayuda a sus compañeras de grupo ya que en muchos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The LOS INTACHABLES (The Impeccables) communal bank is made up of eight members, all of them women. Albertina, the bank's president, is 50 years old, married and with two children ages 18 and 21. She makes a living selling fuel and lubricants for vehicles. Her shop is located in a strategic place in the community of El Torno. This will be her fourth loan with our institution.
Albertina will use this loan to purchase wholesale fuel and car lubricants for having a better-stocked business. She is asking for this loan because she wants to improve her shop and become a wholesaler. Her business' challenge is instability due to seasonality. She will use her profits for purchasing more products. Albertina's desire is to have a stable, profitable business that leaves her a greater income with which to improve her quality of life. She is very grateful to the institution for the support she has received, particularly because this is her family's livelihood. She is also thankful for the support given to the other members of her bank, who in most cases are the only providers of their corresponding households.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale fuel and car lubricants

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Sin works very hard every day at the rice field because he wants to stabilize his income and provide his children a quality of life. He is 50 years old, married, and lives with his spouse and three single children in a small village of Baray district, Kompong Tom province. Aside from farming, Sin devotes himself to a recycling business (buy and sell recycled materials) for more income. Through his tireless work, he hopes to satisfactorily provide the needs of his family. Sin is very happy because he has a supportive wife who always helps him in generating income for family.

To better his living conditions and to meet transportation needs of the family, Sin has applied for a loan of 800,000 KHR to purchase a used motorcycle for the support in his recycling business as well as for household use. He would appreciate for unending support from Kiva lenders which enables him to contribute to the development of his family. This will be his sixth loans through HKL.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for commuting as well as for household use.

loans.name: 74-Las Julianas Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento 74- LAS JULIANAS Está  compuesto por diez integrantes ocho mujeres y dos varones, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. María tiene 38 años, tiene cuatro hijos  que se encuentran estudiando,  La Sra. María se dedica  a la   venta de ropa según la temporada, ella tiene un puesto fijo en uno de los mercados más concurridos de la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. María va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de ropa de temporada por mayor como ser chompas y chamarras para combatir esta época de invierno y de esta manera brindar variedad de ropa  a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. María va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de ropa según la temporada, la Sra. Maria es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en: Communal Bank 74- LAS JULIANAS has 10 members, 8 women and two men. The bank's president is Maria, 38, with two kids of school age. She sells clothes according to the season and has a booth in one of the most visited markets in the city of Santa Cruz. This will be his third loan with our institution and she will use it to purchase wholesale seasonal garments such as jackets and coats, very needed in this winter time. She wants to offer diverse garments to her customers and increase her profits. Maria is asking for this loan because she wants to expand her business. She will use her profits for buying more clothes for each season. Maria is a very hard-working woman and is very happy for the support given to her and her fellow bank members, who in some cases are the sole breadwinners of their homes.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale seasonal garments such as jackets and coats

loans.name: Sofia Teresa

texts.es: Sofía  de 32 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y su hija de 7 meses; allí hace un año inició su negocio de alquilar lavadoras a las amas de casa de su barrio, para que optimizaran su tiempo de lavado de ropa, e hicieran esa labor con un mínimo de esfuerzos, mientras ella generaba ingresos para fortalecer el bienestar de su familia. En su negocio alquila las máquinas por horas y lo realiza diariamente durante todo el día; sus principales clientes los conforman los vecinos de su barrio y de sectores cercanos a su vivienda, quienes realizan su rutina de lavado de ropa con una frecuencia semanal, cada uno en días especiales de acuerdo a su esquema de trabajo en los diferentes hogares. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará 2 lavadoras mas, atendiendo a la demanda que hace  su clientela y que algunas veces no hay forma de responderles, por lo cual deben regresar a sus hogares sin la prestación del servicio. Con esta inversión logrará aumentar sus utilidades pues agregará nuevos clientes y fidelizará otros que son el objetivo del negocio de Sofía.
texts.en:
Sofía is 32 years old and lives with her husband and seven month old daughter in Cartagena.  A year ago she started her business of renting washing machines to housewives in her neighborhood so that they can optimize their time washing clothes and do the work with little effort.  She generates income to strengthen her family’s wellbeing.  In her business she rents the machines by the hour and does this all day, every day.  Her main customers are her neighbors from her neighborhood and nearby areas who do their washing weekly, each one on specific days, based on each home’s work schedule.

She is currently asking for a Kiva loan, her first through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy two more washing machines, so that she can satisfy her customers because there are times that she is not able to serve them and they have to return to their homes without service.  This investment will allow her to increase her utility, add new customers, and increase the loyalty of others, as is the objective of Sofía’s business.

loans.use: to buy two washing machines.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz is married with 4 children. She is 54 years old and lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. Beatriz owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas and coconuts to earn a living. She has been in this business for 16 years and earns 7,000 each month. She requested a loan of 8,000 to purchase farm chemicals. Beatriz has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, since 2010. In the future, Beatriz's plan is to save her returns in order to buy an additional piece of farmland.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en: Ma. Theresa is married. Ma. Theresa is 42 years old, and lives in Kapalaran, Tambulig. Ma. Theresa owns and operates a farm where they plant & harvest rice for sale to earn a living and she's been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns 7,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2011, Ma. Theresa joined GDMPC. In the future, Ma. Theresa wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Reysalyne

texts.en: Reysalyne is 27 years of age and has one child. She’s aiming to use her earnings from her direct sales business in her village to educate her only child until the last of her schooling. With Reysalyne's persistence and hard work, she is capable of providing for their daily allowance. However, Reysalyne wants to improve her business to further save for their basic commodities and business needs. She is applying for a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase Avon, MSE and Sundance products such as lipstick, face powder and deodorant. She hopes to access her requested amount in order to make her dreams realistic.

loans.use: to purchase Avon, MSE and Sundance products such as lipstick, face powder and deodorant

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia is a hog-raiser in the village of Guayabal. She is 56 years old, and is married to Carlos. Leticia has been engaged in her business for 10 years. She earns about PHP 7,500 per head every time she dispose it. At this moment, Leticia wants to have an additional hog to raise, but she lacks the necessary capital. In this regard, Leticia is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 12,000 to purchase feed, vaccines, and an additional hog to raise.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines, and an additional hog to raise

loans.name: Elddy

texts.es: La Sra.  Elddy tiene 42 años,  se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la localidad de Puerto Rico,  este préstamo es su segunda  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Elddy  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para su negocio y  de esta manera brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Elddy va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener un restaurante y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela. La Sra. Elddy es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: Elddy is 42 years old and sells food from a stall located in the Puerto Rico area.  This will be her second loan through the institution.  Elddy will use the money from this loan to buy tables and chairs for her business so that she can make her customers more comfortable.  She wants to continue improving her business.  Elddy will use these benefits to improve her business and increase her income.  Her desire for her business is to have a restaurant and provide better service to her customers.  Elddy is a hardworking person and feels happy and grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela tiene 48 años,  su pareja es Alfredo, con quien tiene seis hijos, pero ahora sólo vive con tres de ellos. Esta familia habita un hogar sencillo, pero propio, ubicado en una comunidad nativa de la selva central.
Desde su juventud se dedica a la agricultura. Actualmente cuenta con siete terrenos en producción donde cultiva café, achiote y frutos cítricos como naranjas y tanyelos (híbrido de abundante zumo). Acaba de plantar sus frutas y esperará dos años para recoger los primeros frutos. Mientras tanto se esmera en la limpieza y mantenimiento de sus cultivos de café y achiote. 
“Calculo que este año el achiote subirá a 6 soles, porque el año pasado el precio era similar”, menciona. Espera que este año le vaya mejor, por eso se esforzó en la limpieza y fertilización del achiote.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y se siente agradecida por el apoyo que tuvo con los créditos anteriores. También se siente a gusto en compañía de sus socios del banco comunal “Flor de Almendra”, porque son alegres y responsables en las reuniones.
Manuela destinará estos 3000 nuevos soles en el pago a los jornaleros quienes limpiarán sus parcelas. Invertirá como 400 soles por cada parcela.
texts.en:
Manuela is 48 years old.  Her partner is Alfredo, with whom she has six children, but now she lives with only three of them.  This family lives in a modest home that belongs to them, located in a native community in the central jungle.

She has worked in agriculture since her youth.  Currently she has seven plots of land in production where she grows coffee, annatto, and citrus, such as oranges and tangelos (a hybrid with abundant juice).  She just planted her fruit trees and she will wait two years to pick the first fruit.  In the meantime she is taking care of weeding the land and maintaining her coffee and annatto crops.

"I calculate that this year annatto will go up to six soles [PEN] because last year the price was similar," she says.  She hopes that it goes better for her this year, which is why she made such a great effort to weed and fertilize the annatto.

This is her third loan with MFP and she is grateful for the support she had with the previous loans.  Also, she feels comfortable in the company of the members of her communal bank, Flor de Almendra, because they are happy and responsible in the meetings.

Manuela will use the 3000 nuevos soles [PEN] to pay the day laborers who will weed her plots of land.  She will invest about 400 soles per plot.

loans.use: to pay day laborers to weed her land

loans.name: Mukinah

texts.en:
Mukinah opened a shop at home to help the family's finances. Sukendar, her husband, is only a temporary worker. The economic conditions are not good and they are earning just enough for the basic daily needs. Mukinah feel scared because of the cost of the vocational school for her daughter Kafita. Mukinah does not want her to quit school so she is applying for loans through the Student Loan program from Kiva. In the picture, Mukinah and Kafita, her daughter.

Kafita already graduated from junior high school and wants to go to vocational school. Kafita hopes God will give her a way that she can go back to school, graduate and get a decent job so she can help her family and achieve her goals.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La Sra. María tiene 43 años y un hijo de la edad de 16 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio que se encuentran en la localidad de Joronchito, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. María va a usar este préstamo para la compra de abarrotes por mayor para surtir su tienda, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para adquirir lo necesario, la Sra. María pretende ampliar la gama de productos a vender y  va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de abarrotes como ser azúcar, fideos, arroz, etc. su deseo para su negocio es tener un negocio estable y rentable, que le genere más ingresos y le permita mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old and has a 16-year-old son.  She works selling basic staples in her neighborhood store in the town of Joronchito.

This loan is her first sequence with the institution.  María is going to use this loan to buy groceries wholesale to supply her store.  Her reason for requesting this loan is that she doesn't have enough money to get what she needs.

María plans to expand the range of products she sells and she's going to use the profits to buy groceries such as sugar, noodles, rice, etc.  Her desire for her business is that it be stable and profitable, generate more income for her, and allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as sugar, noodles, and rice

loans.name: Warsono

texts.en:
Warsono works as a temporary worker who does not have a specific work time. His wife is a domestic servant. Warsono and his wife's income is uncertain and usually only enough for their daily needs.  Novi, his child,  is sad because he wishes to continue school. With the Student Loan program of Kiva, Warsono is hoping to help Novi to reach his goal.

Novi wants to make his parents happy and proud of him. Novi will not waste his time again. With the help of Kiva through the Student Loan program, he wants to finish school. Novi will do his best to learn and take advantage of this great opportunity for the future. In the picture, Novi appears with Warsono, his father.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy raw materials for her business.

NWTF is presenting Leonarda's business for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Sukiyem

texts.en: Sukiyem is a peasant who has a very minimal and uncertain income that varies depending on the harvest and the weather. Sukiyem's children cannot go to school because of the family's minimal economic resources. Sukiyem's only hope is her son Enggi. Sukiyem decided to take a student loan from Kiva so that Enggi can finish school and get a job. Enggi lives in a barren and hilly area. He attends a vocational school. He has only two brothers, but because of their limited economic resources, his sister could not attend school. Enggi is afraid he would be like his brother who has dropped out of school. With the Student Loan program, he is hoping to realize his dream as a computer technician. In the picture are Enggi and Sukiyem, his mother.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Tak

texts.en:
Tak is 35 years old and married with two dependent children, residing in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She is a mobile fish seller – meaning to say that she uses her vehicle to go around her community in order to sell fish to local people. Her husband goes fishing and supplies fish he caught from the river to Tak every day. Together, they are able to earn approximately 4.00 USD per day from the business activities. This couple also is involved in a firewood-trading as a supplementary business besides farming, fishing and the fish selling business.

Tak would like to acquire a loan of 1,200,000 KHR to purchase a boat motor and supplies that will be used for fishing. Also with the remainder of fund, she will purchase firewood to stock for the future sale. She hopes that these purchase will enable her husband to make his business more productive, and thus increase their household income. She plans to use her profits for her children’s education and for future emergencies in the family.

loans.use: to purchase firewood to sell and a boat motor and supplies to be used for fishing.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Mildred requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in their community.
She has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Mildred would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in their community.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia tiene 61 años, está casada con José, con quien tiene siete hijos. Ellos viven en la casa que construyeron en una comunidad nativa de la selva central.
Alicia es una mujer dulce y laboriosa, se dedica a varias actividades; empezó con la agricultura, que le dio buenas satisfacciones y aún su esposo trabaja en ello con la producción de café y achiote. Mientras tanto ella se encarga ahora de atender la bodega que tienen en su vivienda. En esta actividad lleva como 5 años; “decidí abrir mi tienda porque me sentía cansada”, comenta.
Afirma que le va bien en las ventas, pero sus actividades no se quedan ahí, ya que tiene en mente mejorar este negocio y ofrecer desayunos y almuerzos y por las tardes piensa vender comida rápida. Cree que será rentable porque su casa se ubica cerca de la escuela y los profesores siempre buscan lugares para ir a comer.

Esta es la primera vez que Alicia accede a un crédito con MFP y se compromete en pagar las cuotas con responsabilidad. Acaba de integrar el banco comunal “Nueva Jerusalén”, por lo que se siente emocionada por ello.
Ella invertirá este dinero en la compra de mesas y sillas para adecuar su el espacio de su casa como un comedor, también comprará insumos para la preparación de sus primeras comidas.
texts.en:
Alicia is 61 years old, married to José, and they have seven children.  They live in the home they built in a native community in the central jungle.


Alicia is a sweet, hardworking woman who does various things.  She began farming and this gave her good satisfaction.  Now her husband works in the production of coffee and achiote.  In the meantime she takes care of the store that she set up in her home.  She has been doing this for about five years.  “I decided to open my store because I felt tired,” she says.


She says that things are going well in her sales but this is not all that she does.  She also plans to improve this business and offer breakfast and lunch and sell fast food in the evening.  This will be profitable because her home is located near a school and the teachers are always looking for places to eat.


This will be the first time that Alicia requests a loan through MFP and she is committed to making her payments responsibly.  She recently joined the “Nueva Jerusalén” communal bank and she is excited about that.


She will invest this money to buy tables and chairs to set up a space in her home as a dining area.  She will also buy supplies to prepare her first dishes.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and supplies.

loans.name: Oneida

texts.es:
Oneida tiene 21 años, es soltera y aun no tiene hijos. Vive en la casa de sus padres, una casita rústica ubicada en una comunidad nativa de la selva central.
Ella se dedica a la agricultura porque le gusta esta actividad. Sus padres la impulsaron a trabajar en ello y lo realiza con esfuerzo porque sabe que las ganancias son buenas si sabe negociar bien los productos. Posee una parcela de tiene café y frutas cítricas; “cada vez que cosecho el café lo vendo a depósitos, ahí me pagan al instante”, menciona. Pero en el caso de los cítricos, ella tiene que trasladarlos hacia la ciudad más cercana (a 45 minutos) para la venta. Oneida tiene muchos planes y se siente contenta de tener las cosas claras, quiere aumentar su producción y adquirir más terrenos, pues sabe que después de conseguir algo de dinero podrá empezar con la construcción de su propia casa.

Esta es la primera vez que Oneida trabaja con MFP y es la primera vez que pertenece a un banco comunal, su grupo se llama “Flor de Almendra”, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y en las actividades. 
Con este dinero podrá adquirir bolsas de fertilizantes y podrá realizar la limpieza de su parcela.
texts.en:
Oneida is 21 years old. She is single and still does not have children. She lives in her parents' home: a small rural house located in a native community in the central tropical forest. 

She farms, because she likes this occupation. Her parents encouraged her to work in it; and she works hard, because she knows that the earnings are good if she knows how to negotiate the sale of her crops well. 

She has a plot of land with coffee and citrus fruit. “Each time I harvest the coffee, I sell it to the warehouses; there they pay me right away," she says. But in the case of the citrus fruits she has to transport them to the nearest city to sell, 45 minutes away.

Oneida has many plans and is happy to be clear about things. She wants to increase her production and acquire more land, as she knows that after getting a bit of money together, she will be able to begin the construction of her own house. 

This is the first time that Oneida has worked with MFP, and it is the first time that she has belonged to a communal bank. Her group is called, “Flor de Almendra.” That is why she promises to be on time in making her installment payments and in the activities. 

With this money she will be able to acquire bags of fertilizers and do the clearing of her parcel.

loans.use: To buy bags of fertilizers and clear her parcel of land.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando tiene 19 años, es un joven soltero que vive con sus padres y hermanos.
A pesar de su juventud ya se dedica a la agricultura, como es uno de los hermanos mayores sus padres le otorgaron dos parcelas de terreno donde cultiva achiote y café. Estos productos tienen que esperar como 3 años para la primera cosecha, Orlando recién cosechó el café este año, obteniendo tres sacos de 60 kilos cada uno. Pero afirma que el año que viene cosechará como 10 sacos; “es gradual cada año se cosecha en mayor cantidad”, menciona entusiasta. Ahora tiene planeado adquirir más viveros de café, para plantarlos en la otra parcela; “quiero aumentar mi producción de café y achiote porque son más rentables y después empezaré con las frutas”.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete en pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco “Flor de Almendra”, del que se siente contento porque sabe que en equipo sus objetivos se pueden alcanzar.
Ahora invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de viveros de café y bolsas de fertilizantes para ampliar su producción.
texts.en:
Orlando, 19, is a single young man who lives with his parents and siblings.  Despite his youth he already works in agriculture.  As he is one of the older siblings, his parents gave him two parcels of land where he grows annatto and coffee.  These products have a delay of about three years before the first harvest.

Orlando just recently harvested the coffee this year, getting three 60-kilo bags.  But he says that next year he'll harvest about 10 bags.  "Little by little, each year the harvest is bigger," he mentions enthusiastically.  Now he plans to acquire more coffee supplies to plant the other parcel of land: "I want to increase my coffee and annatto production because they are more profitable, and then I'll start with the fruit."

This is his first loan with MFP and he promises to make his payments punctually.  He belongs to the Flor de Almendra bank and is happy about it because he knows that he can reach his goals with a team.

Now he'll invest the money from this loan to buy coffee supplies and bags of fertilizer to increase his production.

loans.use: to buy coffee supplies and bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis tiene 37 años, su pareja es Yolanda, con quien tiene seis hijos. Juntos viven en una casa sencilla, pero propia, construida en una comunidad nativa de la selva central.
Él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 15 años, cultiva café, achiote, yuca, maíz y kión. Por eso no le falta dinero en todo el año, porque sabe cómo programar sus cosechas para que en cada temporada no le falten ventas. “Me gusta cultivar achiote porque siempre hay ventas y sus precios son buenos”, menciona, haciendo una comparación con los otros productos. Acaba de cosechar por primera vez el café y solo obtuvo cinco sacos, pero afirma que los años siguientes la producción aumentará, está entusiasmado por la idea. Sus planes próximos son de sembrar más achiote y mejorar su producción.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se siente comprometido con los pagos puntuales de las cuotas. “Flor de Almendra” es el nombre de su banco comunal y se siente a gusto con sus socios, por el apoyo en equipo.
Con el dinero de este préstamo podrá comprar semillas de achiote (con 600 soles), con lo que reste pagará al personal que realizará la limpieza de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Luis is 37 years old and married to Yolanda.  Together they have six children.  They live in a simple home, but a home of their own, built in a native community on the central jungle.

He is a farmer and has been for 15 years.  He raises coffee, achiote, yucca, corn, and ginger.  This is why he is not short of money year-round, because he knows how to schedule his harvests so that he will not be short of sales during any season.  “I like raising achiote because there are always sales and the prices are good,” he says while comparing it to other products.  He just made his first coffee harvest and he only got five sacks, but he says that production will increase in the coming years.  He is excited by the idea.  His next plans are to plant more achiote and improve his production.

This will be his first loan through MFP and he is committed to making his payments on time.  “Flor de Almendra” is the name of his communal bank and he is comfortable with his fellow members because of the team support.

He will use the money from this loan to buy achiote seed (with 600 PEN), and the rest to pay for field hands to clean his fields.

loans.use: to buy seed and hire field hands.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma is a mother who loves to sell snacks. She usually sells snacks like halo-halo (dessert made from shaved ice and condensed milk, mixed with sweet beans and/or fruit) in their village. She is 36 years old and is married to Liopuldo. She has been in her business for almost three years and earns about PHP 300 a day. Thelma wants to have more snacks to sell in their local community, but she has an insufficient capital. Therefore, Thelma is asking a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients such as banana, nata de coco (a chewy, translucent, jelly-like food), gulaman (bars of dried seaweed used to make jellies or flan) and native cakes to cook and sell. Thelma hopes to grow and expand her business to secure her family standard of living.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients such as banana, nata de coco, gulaman, and native cakes to cook and sell

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
Tomasa is a determined person. She is 53 years old, married, and has three children. She is vending vegetables and at the same time raises hogs to resell for profit. She has been in the hog raising business for over three years now and earns P3,000 per each hog sold. Tomasa is asking for a loan of P20,000 to ensure their growth so she can offer the hogs at a profitable rate. She will buy hog feed and vitamins for sustainability. 

With good income from her businesses, she will achieve financial stability and better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and vitamins for sustainability

loans.name: Carmen Patricia

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias al apoyo de su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Carmen se encuentra estudiando la carrera técnica de Contabilidad, en sus ratos libres le gusta compartir gratos momentos con su familia y en algunas de estas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con ellos.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, día a día Carmen trabaja como Auxiliar de Ventas en una empresa de transportes de su ciudad, desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella trabaja un aproximado de 8 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño  y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Carmen se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar los acabados de su vivienda, ella desea poder realizar el tarrajeado, pintado y puesta de ventanas de su vivienda; de esta manera Carmen tendrá su vivienda en mejores condiciones y podrá brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar a su familia, así ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose por convertirse en una buena profesional y en una mujer de bien, para así poder ayudar a su familia para que juntos puedan salir adelante.
texts.en:
Carmen is a woman of 21. She lives in the city of Chincha with her parents and siblings. She is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to achieve. Thanks to her effort and the support of her parents, Carmen is studying for a career in technical accounting. In her free time she likes to share pleasant moments with her family, and on some of these occasions she cooks a very delicious "carapulcra with dry soup" (a Peruvian stew made from meat, freeze-dried potatoes, noodles, vegetables, and seasoning) to share with them.

With great effort and enthusiasm, Carmen works every day as a sales assistant for a transportation business in her city. She begins her work in the early hours of the morning, and she works about 8 hours a day. She feels that it is going very well for her because of her good effort and because of the friendly treatment that she gives to others.

Carmen is very thankful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help offered to her she will be able to complete some finishing work in her home. She wants to be able to finish the plastering and painting and put windows in her home. In this way Carmen will have her home in better condition and will be able to offer better security and well-being to her family. Thus she will continue working and striving to become a good professional and a good woman, to thus be able to help her family so that they can advance together.

loans.use: to complete finishing work in her home.

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en:
Bonifacio is 57 years old, married, and has four children. He was not able to send them all to school due to lack of finances. Bonifacio had a farming business but only derived just enough income for the family. He decided to raise hogs to add to his income. He is currently feeding four hogs. He is asking for a loan of P20,000 to enhance nutrition and some day sell them at gainful prices. He will buy vitamins, medicines, and hog feed to sustain the hog's good nutrition. Bonifacio promises to pay back his loan in full. 

Someday, Bonifacio hopes to achieve progress in his businesses for the betterment of the family's poor living condition.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, medicines, and hog feed to sustain his pigs and ensure good nutrition

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.es:
La señora Cormelia se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva en diferentes partes de la ciudad.
Solicita el préstamo porque le están ofreciendo una mercancía y muy buen precio y desea obtener esa oportunidad, y así tener más inversión y variedad de producto para sus clientas. Ya que tiene mas de 27 años dedicándose a las venta de ropa para damas. 
Doña Cormelia es viuda, tiene dos hijas bajo su responsabilidad que están estudiando la universidad. Por ella desea mejorar su negocio y tener mas ingreso, y ayudarlas a terminar una carrera profesional para un mejor futuro.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtendrá del negocio, los gastos familiares serán cubiertos con la pensión que recibe por la muerte de su esposo.
texts.en:
Cormelia sells new clothing in different parts of the city.

She is asking for this loan because she has been offered merchandise at a very good price and she would like to take advantage of that opportunity so she can have a greater variety of products for her customers.  She has been selling women’s clothing for more than 27 years.

Cormelia is a widow and has two daughters who depend on her and are studying at university.  She would like to improve her business, increase her income, and help them finish their studies for professional careers so that they will have a better future.

She plans to repay this loan with the earnings she gets from the business.  Her family expenses will be covered by the pension she receives as a result of her husband’s death.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her business.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Sra. María  tiene 63 años y es divorciada con 2 hijos mayores que son de las edades de 35 y 28 años, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como abarrotes, fideo, arroz y azúcar, su tienda se encuentran ubicado en la zona Santos Dumont,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. María  va a usar este préstamo de para compra de abarrotes por mayor como fideo, arroz y azúcar y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir ampliando su  negocio ya que con el anterior credito le fue muy bien, la Sra.  María va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando mercadería y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener una amplia gama de productos de primera necesidad para ofrecer a su clientela y incrementar sus ventas y por ende sus ganancias.
texts.en: Señora Maria is 63 years old. She is divorced and has 2 adult children, ages 35 and 28. Her business is selling basic products such as groceries, pasta, rice, and sugar. Her store is located in the Santos Dumont zone. This is her second loan with this institution. Sra. Maria is going to use this loan to buy groceries wholesale, such as noodles, rice, and sugar, and in this way increase her working capital. Her reason for applying for this loan is to continue expanding her business, since with the last loan it went very well. She is going to use the earnings to continue buying merchandise and thus improving her income. Her wish for her business is to have a wide range of basic products to offer her customers and increase her sales and therefore her earnings.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as noodles, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Claudia Lizeth

texts.es: CLAUDIA TIENE 28 AÑOS DE EDAD, ELLA ES CASADA Y TIENE UN HIJO DE 6 AÑOS DE EDAD. DESDE HACE 5 AÑOS TRABAJA COMO AUXILIAR ADMINISTRATIVO EN UNA CONSTRUCTORA. SU ESPOSO ES EMPLEADO EN UNA MAQUILADORA Y AMBOS HAN VISTO LA NECESIDAD DE AMPLIAR SU CASA PARA BENEFICIO DE SU FAMILIA. ELLOS CONSTRUYERON OTRA HABITACION, CON LA CUAL BUSCAN DARLE A SU HIJO UN ESPACIO MAS COMODO EN SU CASA. POR TAL MOTIVO  ELLA Y SU ESPOSO ACUDIERON A ESTA INSTITUCION PARA SOLICITAR UN PRESTAMO QUE LES AYUDE A TERMINAR LOS ACABADOS INTERIORES DE ESTA NUEVA HABITACIÒN, CON ESTO ELLOS BUSCAN PODER CONTRUIR POCO A POCO UN PATRIMONIO FAMILIAR QUE BENEFICIE A SU HIJO EN UN FUTURO.
texts.en:
Claudia is 28 years old.  She’s married and has a six year old son.  For the past five years she worked as an administrative assistant for a construction company.  Her husband works in a factory that makes goods for export and both have seen the need to expand their house for their family’s benefit.

They built another house, with which they want to give their son a more comfortable space in the home.  For this reason she and her husband came to this institution to request a loan that will help them finish the interior of this new house.  With this they hope to, little by little, build a family atmosphere that will benefit their son in the future.

loans.use: to finish the interior of their new home.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: El Sr. Luis tiene 57 años y es viudo, es de ocupación electricista y se dedica a todo tipo de instalaciones eléctricas, el vive por la zona 26 de Mayo, este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Luis utilizara  este préstamo  para la compra materiales y herramientas  para realizar las conexiones y que le permita hacer un buen trabajo, el Sr. Luis enfrenta retos en su negocio que son  la competencia en el rubro y utilizara los beneficios en la compra de mas herramientas para su negocio ya que siempre falta algo con el anterior credito le fue muy bien ya que compro la escalera que tanta falta le hacia , su deseo del Sr. Luis es tener un vehículo que le ayuda a transportar sus herramientas, se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Luis is 57 years old, an electrician by trade, and he does all types of electrical work.  He lives in the “26 de Mayo” zone.  This will be his third loan through the institution.  Luis will use the money from this loan to buy supplies and tools to make electrical connections so that he can do good work.

Luis has some challenges in his business, such as competition in the field.  He will use these benefits to buy more tools for his business, because there is always something that he needs.  He used the money from the previous loan to buy the ladder that he desperately needed.  His hopes are to have a vehicle that will help him transport his tools.  He is grateful to the institution for its support.

loans.use: to buy tools and supplies.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene lives in Solana with her spouse, Venancio, and three children. She raises hogs to sell and augment their income. She gains about PHP 3,000 for each hog sold. She would like to ensure good nutrition for her hogs so she can offer them at a good price and increase her income as well. She is asking for PHP 20,000 to buy feed, vaccines and medicines for her hogs. 

Through the help of this loan and their hard work, Arlene believes she can reach her dreams of lifting her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and medicines to ensure good nutrition for her hogs

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter de 20 años de edad, padre de un hijo de 2 años, es un joven artista inspirado que pinta cuadros   en lienzo los envía a la marquetería y los vende; él tiene experiencia de negocio desde sus 15 años de edad,  cuando aprendió a aprovechar el resultado de su inspiración y hacerlo su propio estilo de vida que le generara ingresos. Sus principales clientes son amas de casa y empleados que le pagan semanal, mensual o quincenal de acuerdo a las posibilidades de cada uno, pero a corto plazo. En la actualidad no accede a clientes efectivos, con quienes pudiera negociar si le ofreciera plazos más amplios y esto se convierte en uno de sus mayores desafíos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará marcos, lienzos y pinturas en mayor volumen, para ofrecerle mejores condiciones de pago a su clientela y ganar un mayor número de ellos. Walter es un joven muy trabajador, que  sale todos los días con sus cuadros y los ofrece puerta a puerta en toda la ciudad de Cartagena, siempre buscando vender cada vez más. Su meta es terminar el fin de año con el aumento de su cartera de créditos y lograr responderle a todos los desafíos que trae consigo la actividad empresarial, pues  es muy joven y tiene las capacidades para lograr su sueño de prosperidad, que no es otro, que el de aumentar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Walter is 20 years old and the father of a 2-year-old son. He is an inspired young artist who paints pictures on canvas. He sends them to a framing shop and sells them. He has had business experience since he was 15, when he learned to profit from the products of his inspiration and make it his own lifestyle that would generate income for him. His principal customers are homemakers and employees who pay him weekly, monthly, or every two weeks, according to each one's ability, but in the short term. Now he does not have access to clients with whom he could negotiate if he offered longer term loans, and this has become one of his greatest challenges. This is why he is turning to a Kiva loan, which will be the second financing that he has had with Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, and with which he will buy frames, canvases, and paint in greater quantities, in order to offer better payment terms to his customers and win a larger number of them. Walter is a hard-working young man who goes out every day with his paintings and offers them door-to-door throughout the the city of Cartagena, always seeking to sell more each time. His goal is to end the year with an increase in his loan portfolio and succeed in responding to all the challenges that entrepreneurial activity brings with it, since he is very young and has the ability to achieve his dream of prosperity, which is nothing other than improving his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy frames, canvases, and paints in large volume.

loans.name: Ma. Elma

texts.en:
Ma. Elma is 37 years old and married with 2 children.

Ma. Elma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Ma. Elma has been in this business for 5 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Ma. Elma aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell such as t-shirts, blouses, slippers and other ready-to-wear items.

NWTF is relisting Norma's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as t shirts, blouses, slippers and other ready-to-wear items.

loans.name: Munawar

texts.en:
Munawar is an energetic married women. She has had a business selling fruit for the past 12 years. She is working hard to earn as much as necessary to meet her household’s requirements.
She has four sons and four daughters. Two of her sons are handling a fruit cart with her while the other two are going to be involved in this business once she expands it with a loan. She requested for a loan of 20,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to purchase more fruit from the market at lower prices and will manage to keep the stock at home to meet the demand at the right time.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit from the market at lower prices.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a married mother of two children and works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish business in the Philippines. Nelly is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her dried fish.

Nelly has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her dried fish.

loans.name: Neneth

texts.en:
Neneth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an Internet cafe business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy an additional computer unit and computer supplies for her business.

NWTF is relisting Neneth's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional computer unit and computer supplies.

loans.name: Nerita

texts.en:
