Nerita is a mother who has two school-age children. She aims to become financially stable to improve their living status and give her children a better life. To generate income, she owns and manages a variety store in their village while her husband operates their farmland. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, they need to increase their income to cover their needs and finance the education of their children. 

In this regard, Nerita aims to improve her variety store to earn sufficient income. Due to insufficient capital, she is requesting a loan for PHP 25,000.00 to buy additional stocks of grocery items like soft drinks, canned goods, beverages, detergent soaps, eggs and seasonings to sell. She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to work out her plan and is hoping that she will improve the business and make it a viable source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, beverages, detergent soaps, eggs and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy various goods such as lotions, soap, plastic shoes for resale.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

NWTF is relisting Victorina's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Fareeda

texts.en:
Fareeda is 36 years old, married and has four children. She has been successfully running a cosmetics business for five years. Her husband assists in her business. She supplies cosmetics products to different beauty parlors. She is very famous in her city and counts as good clients a list of 100 people. 
She is working hard to cover the expenses of their education, food and clothing. She has gradually improved her business with support from Kashf Foundation. Due to her good past experience with this microfinance institution, she again requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase more beauty products in bulk including lotions, light creams and face washes which will meet an increasing demand in the city. It will generate more profits and increase her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty products in bulk including lotions, light creams and face washes.

loans.name: Felipe Arnoldo

texts.es:
Felipe Arnoldo vive en el municipio de El Sauce, ubicado al occidente del departamento de León, es un señor de 58 años, casado, con 2 hijos, de los cuales solo una a su cargo en edad escolar. Gracias a su oficio como obrero que ha desempeñado por más de 20 años logró preparar a su hijo mayor el que ya no depende de él y que son personas de bien, luchadores,  con buenos principios al igual que su padre, quien los educó con la ayuda de su esposa.

Cabe mencionar que gracias a esta profesión también ha mejorado su vivienda en cuanto a sus condiciones y mejorado su nivel de vida. 

Está solicitando un crédito para comprar medicina y pago de consultas médicas con el fin de mejorar su salud y la de su esposa, ya que últimamente se han sentido un poco mal de salud y así realizar muy bien su trabajo el cual se ha caracterizado por ser un excelente trabajador.

Se siente muy agradecido y satisfecho por el apoyo que le ha brindado KIVA y Ceprodel  al financiarle con estos créditos que ayudan a mejorar la salud de muchas personas de bajos recursos que no pueden cubrir este tipo de gastos por ser demasiados costosos.
texts.en:
Felipe Arnoldo lives in the municipality of El Sauce, located in the west of the department of León. He is 58 years old, married, and has 2 children, only one of whom is still in his charge and is school aged. Thanks to his work as a laborer, which he has done for more than 20 years, he was able to educate his older son, the one who is no longer economically dependent on him. His son is a good person and a hard worker, with the same good principles as this father, who raised him with his wife’s help.

It is worth mentioning that thanks to his profession, he has also been able to improve the conditions of his house and has also improved his quality of life.

He is requesting a loan to buy medicine and to pay for doctor visits, with the goal of improving his health and his wife’s health. They have been feeling a little poorly of health lately. If he improves his health, he can do his job really well, because he has always been known as a good worker.

He feels very grateful and satisfied with the help that Kiva and Ceprodel have provided him by financing the loans that help him and many other low-income people improve their health, since they can’t easily cover these types of expenses because they are too costly.

loans.use: to buy medications and pay for doctor visits

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 39 years old, single and lives in Taguitic, Kapatagan. In order to add income for the family, she started a business buying and selling crabs 10 years ago. She usually gets PHP 30,000 per month. With the help of GDMPC microcredit, Jocelyn has been able to buy crabs to sell because of the PHP 45,000 loan given to her. She joined GDMPC just this year. She’s hoping for much greater revenue someday for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy crabs to sell.

loans.name: Gerson

texts.es:
Gerson tiene 25 años, su pareja es Maribel, con quien tiene una hija de 4 años llamada Angely. Ellos viven, por ahora, en una casa alquilada ubicada en la ciudad. 
Él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 6 años, es la actividad que practican sus padres y la que aprendió. Cuenta con dos parcelas de terrenos en las que produce café. “El café de mi zona es más solicitado porque sus granos son más grandes”, menciona orgulloso. Su trabajo lo llena de satisfacciones, ya que consiguió compradores que se hicieron sus amigos. A la vez también produce plátanos entre los espacios libres que quedaron en el cafetal, así aprovecha cada parcela al máximo. Ahora tiene pensado iniciar la limpieza de sus cultivos, ya que cada 3 meses la maleza va impidiendo el normal crecimiento de sus plantas. 

Esta es la primera vez que Gerson accede a un crédito con MFP y da su palabra que será responsable en el pago de las cuotas. Pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Jerusalén”, un grupo nuevo y entusiasmado por las acciones a desarrollarse.
El dinero de este préstamo lo invertirá en el pago de los jornaleros que contratará para la limpieza de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Gerson is 25 years old. His partner is Maribel, with whom he has a 4 year old daughter named Angely. They live, for now, in a rented house located in the city.

He has been working in agriculture for 6 years. This is the work his parents do and that he learned. He has two parcels of land where he grows coffee. “The coffee from my area is the most sought after because it has large coffee beans,” he proudly explains. His work fills him with pride because he was able to get buyers that became his friends. He also grows plantains in the empty spaces in his coffee farms so that he can take maximum advantage of each parcel. He plans to begin weeding his crop because every 3 months the weeds start to impede the growth of his plants.

This is the first time that Gerson is requesting a loan from Microfinanzas Prisma and he gives his word that he will be responsible with his repayments. He belongs to the “Nueva Jerusalén” communal bank, a new communal bank that is enthusiastic about the work being done.

He will use the money from this loan to pay for the laborers that he will hire to weed his crops.

loans.use: to pay for laborers that he will hire to weed his coffee crops.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 39 years old and is married with six children between the ages 6 and 16 years old. He sells various goods, such as lotions, soap, sugar, rice, cooking oil, etc., from a store that operates from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day. He currently employs two people to help him, and he has seven years of experience in this work. 

Thomas has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various goods, such as lotions, soap, sugar, rice, cooking oil etc., to resell. He plans to use any profits generated from this loan to satisfy his family's basic needs and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy various goods, such as lotions, soap, sugar, rice, cooking oil, etc., to resell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Virginia works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit selling business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store and pig fattening. Virginia is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell in her food stall.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her past eleven loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is 41 years old. She is married and has four children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Celsa is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been cultivating rice for 31 years. She earns 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) every quarter. 

Celsa is in need of rice seedlings to plant her next crop. She has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC to buy rice seedlings to plant her field for the coming season. Celsa been a member of GDMPC since 2008. In the future, she hopes to widen her rice farm.

loans.use: to buy rice seedlings to plant in her field for the coming season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Clever

texts.es:
Clever tiene 23 años, es un joven independiente que vive en la casa de su tía, ayudándola y trabajando por su cuenta. 
Salió de la casa de sus padres a los 19 años, desde entonces vive con su tía, a quien quiere mucho. Gracias a ella posee varias parcelas de terrenos donde cultiva frutos cítricos como: naranjas, mandarinas y otros; además produce achiote, que es muy solicitado por los compradores para preparar condimentos o colorantes naturales. Menciona que la venta del achiote, este año, fue buena, pero con los cítricos no le fue tan bien. “El mes pasado la canasta de naranjas estaba a 5 soles, pero en marzo llegó a costar de 10 a 12 soles”, dice. A pesar de ello se esfuerza en todo el año. Sus planes son de adquirir más terrenos de cultivos para aumentar su producción de achiotes y además empezar a sembrar papayas.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, promete ser responsable con los pagos de las cuotas mensuales. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Flor de Almendra”, donde se siente contento porque gracias a los ahorros puede cumplir sus proyectos.
El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de 15 bolsas de fertilizantes, lo restante será para comprar semillas de papaya.
texts.en:
Clever is 23 years old. He is a young man who is economically independent and lives in his aunt’s house. He helps her out and pays his own way. 

He left his parent’s house when he was 19 years old, and he has lived with his aunt, who he loves very much, ever since. Thanks to her, he has several parcels of land where he cultivates citrus fruits such as oranges, tangerines, and others. He also produces annatto, which is very sought after by buyers to make condiments and natural colorings. He explains that the sales of annatto were very good this year, but his citrus sales weren’t so good. “Last month the price for a basket of oranges was at PEN 5.00 (nuevos soles), but in March it went as high as PEN 10.00 or 12.00,” he says. In spite of this, he works hard all year long. His plans are to acquire more farm land to increase his production of annatto and also to start planting papayas.

This is his third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. He promises to be responsible with his monthly repayments. He belongs to the “Flor de Almendra” communal bank, where he feels happy because, thanks to the savings, he is able to finish his projects.

He will use the money is he is requesting to buy 15 bags of fertilizer. He will use the remainder to buy papaya seeds.

loans.use: to buy 15 bags of fertilizer and papaya seeds.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is sixty years old, married and has five children. She has run a sari-sari (general store) and has sold food she prepares for the past fifteen years.

Leonila is applying for a loan of 29,000 PHP, her thirteenth from NWTF; she successfully repaid her previous loans. She will use the loan to buy grocery items for her shop as well as the ingredients for the food she sells. Leonila's sari-sari continues to provide her and her family with an income that improves their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy items for her shop and ingredients to make the food she sells.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Edina is 30 years old, married to Titus, and blessed with two children aged six and two years. She practices poultry farming, a business she started five years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 7,000. 

She has requested a fifth loan of KES 15,000 to purchase chicken feed and renovate their shelter. The profit from her business will help her expand this business and also care for her family's basic needs. 


She hopes to lead a happy life with her family.

loans.use: To purchase chicken feeds and renovate their shelter.

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en:
Irene's group is comprised of four hardworking women. Irene is twenty years old and lives in the town of Kinoni in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past two years, Irene has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, salt, soap and rice. 

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like sugar, soap, salt and rice for resale. It will help Irene to generate greater profits and take care of her child and her parents. Irene hopes that, in the future, she will be able to expand her business into a wholesale shop. 

Irene is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like sugar, soap, salt and rice for resale.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lillian is a 50-year-old single mother of two adult children, from Kisumu city.

Lillian sells drinking water in her home area, a business she has been doing for the last seven years and makes a monthly income of KES10,000. 

She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy a water pump. Her profits will be used to provide basic needs for the family. Her dream is to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a water pump.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy wool for a carpet weaving business.

loans.name: At

texts.en:
At, age 36, is married to Van, age 38. They live in a village approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three sons and one daughter. All of their children are attending school. 

At and his wife are rice farmers. When he is not at the farm, At also does construction work and his wife makes and sells Onsorm. Onsorm is a kind of Cambodian cake that has rice, coconut, soybean and pork in the middle and is cooked by steaming.

At wants a trailer to connect to his motorized hand tiller (in the photo). This would make it easy for him to transport his rice and vegetables when farming season comes. Hence, At decided to ask for his first loan in order to buy a trailer.

loans.use: To buy a trailer to connect to his motorized hand tiller.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is 48 years old and the mother of two sons and a daughter, living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is very hard-working and an independent woman. By stitching clothes, she helps her husband to meet the family needs and her children's education expenses. 

Nazia has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan for purchasing a sewing machine to stitch up more dresses and for the expansion of her business. She has been operating her business very efficiently and honestly for the past eight years and her clients always appreciate her work. Zareena is hopeful about her business success as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy, age 30, is a garment worker. Her husband, Tan, age 29, is a farmer and does construction work when he is not at the farm. They have been married since 2008 and have one son. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh. 

Chanthy is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to supplement new pig farming business and to assist in her husband’s farming business by buying seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

With new pig farming business, Chanthy will be able to earn extra income from selling pigs when they are fully grown.

loans.use: To supplement new pig farming business and to assist in her husband’s farming business by buying seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is from Mayor's Village, Lapasan, Clarin. She is 43 years old. Luzminda is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Luzminda sells daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Luzminda has been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns PHP 8,000 a month from these activities.

In 2007, Luzminda joined GDMPC. Luzminda is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase new items such as candy, Milo (malted milk), shampoo, soap, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candy, Milo (malted milk), shampoo and soap

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat is a 31-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and two daughters. Since 2009, her husband has been running a small vegetable shop and usually sells his vegetables in the central bazaar.

Nusrat, as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan for the expansion of her husband's shop. With the loan investment, her husband can buy a variety of fresh vegetables that will allow him to offer more varieties to his clients and increase his sales and income.

Her husband is very hardworking and honest man and is confident about his family’s bright future.

loans.use: to expand her husband's vegetable shop.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Rosana is providing motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 8 years. She requested a loan for 8,000  PHP to pay for the motorcycle maintenance and buy some motor parts need to be replace.

Rosana has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Rosana hopes to improve her services so that many passengers will be served.

loans.use: to  pay for the motorcycle maintenance and  buy some necessary motor parts.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en: Vicente, forty years old, is a married entrepreneur with five children, from Balintawak, Aurora, in the Philippines. He earns a living from his transport service business. He has been in business for almost two years now and earns 6,000 PHP a month. To improve his business, Vicente is borrowing the amount of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC Microcredit, which he joined just last year (2011) to obtain accessories and tires. He is hopeful for the possibility to expand his business before long.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Imrana

texts.en:
Imrana, a 22-year-old woman, is living with her spouse and three children in a remote place of Punjab, Pakistan. It’s really difficult for her husband to run his family with his little income and as a result she wants to change her life through hard work in her embroidery business.  

For that she requested a loan amount of PKRS 15,000 from KIVA Partner BRAC Pakistan to buy cloth, thread, and other materials for her business. She has almost seven years experience in stitching and embroidery . She is very much hopeful that this loan will help her to lead a happy life.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel is from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with two children, ages 2 and 4. She works hard by selling her home-cooked meals so she can provide for her children's needs. Her business has been doing well for a year now. She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as pork, chicken, fish, seasoning, coconut, and vegetables. This would help so she can continue her business while trying her best to provide for her children. Maribel would like to add more menu items in the future to attract more customers and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as pork, chicken, fish, seasoning, coconut, and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to  pay for the maintenance of Motorela services and buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is a 27-year-old man from Nyalenda, Kisumu, and is married to Emilly. They have two children, ages three and six years.

Jeremiah operates a bicycle transport business (locally known as a "boda-boda") and has been in this business for the last four years. He makes a monthly income of 10,000 KES. 

He is now taking his first loan from KADET LTD which he will use to service his bicycle and buy another one. He will use the expected profits to educate his children. Jeremiah's dream is to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a new bicycle and service his current one.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hair clippers and other small equipment.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is from San Carlos, Tukuran. He is 39 years old. Edgar is married and has two children. To make a living, Edgar owns and operates a specialized retail store. Edgar has been engaged in his business for nine years and earns 3,500 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Edgar joined GDMPC. He is requesting a loan of 5,000, which will be used to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Association Dental 7 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "Dental 7" est un regroupement  de 5 femmes, toutes mariées et qui évoluent toutes dans le meme secteur d'activité qui est le commerce.Elles habitent dans la meme localité et sont sont représentées par madame Fatim ( celle qui a le doigt levé sur la photo)Madame Fatim est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle pratique la vente de produits cosmétiques. Les bénéfices que lui génère son activité lui permet de satisfaire les besoins en habillement de sa petite famille,ces mêmes bénéfices lui permet de prendre en charge les frais d'entretien et médicaux de ses enfants.Elle sollicite un crédit prévu pour l'achat de parfums , de lait de beauté et mèches a vendre.Son objectif st de renforcer son fond de roulement afin de développer son activité par la conquête de nouveaux marchés.Ainsi l'augmentation de ses profits lui permettra d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa progéniture.
texts.en:
The Dental 7 Group is a group of five women, all of them married and working in the same sector, which is trade. They live in the same area and are represented by Fatim (lifting her finger in the photo). Fatim is married and a mother of two. She cosmetic products. 

The president (with her finger raised [in the photo]) is the youngest of the group. She is married and a mother of two. The income from her business allows her to meet the clothing needs of her small family, and to see to the medical expenses and expenses of caring for her children.

She is seeking a loan to buy perfumes, lotions and hair extensions to sell. Her objective is to strengthen her working capital in order to develop her business by exploring new markets. The increase in profits will allow her to improve the living conditions of her children.

loans.use: To purchase cases of perfume, beauty cream, and hair extensions.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is from Alang-Alang, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 31 years old. Jasmin is married and has 2 children. 

Jasmin runs a retail store to make a living, selling a variety of food and home use products in the local community. Jasmin has been in her business for 9 years and earns 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Jasmin is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. Recently, Jasmin joined GDMPC. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Loreto

texts.en:
As a responsible father, Loreto engages in buying and selling fresh eggs, smoked fish, and fruits and vegetables to generate additional income. He uses his motorcycle to transport and sell his products through house-to-house delivery. 

Loreto needs to earn and save more income to satisfy his family's needs and support the schooling of his children. He wants them to finish their studies, earn a degree, and find a stable job someday. In this regard, he plans to acquire additional stocks of his products and sell them to the nearby village. 

Due to financial difficulty, he is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of eggs, smoked fish, and fruits and vegetables to sell. He believes that, through this financial assistance, he will improve the business. He is hoping that he will be successful in carrying out his plan.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of eggs, smoked fish, and fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Tuvyurane Group

texts.fr:
Césarie fait partie du groupe Tuvyurane et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 60 ans et est mariée  à  Helmenegilde, vendeur de banane. Ensemble ils ont  5 enfants  qui étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de  vin  banane  depuis 3ans. 

Elle est à son troisième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de bananes pour la préparation d’une grande quantité de vin de banane à vendre, pour gagner plus. 

Les bénéfices de son commerce, lui permettent de payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants et satisfaire les besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Césarie belongs to the Tuvyurane group and lives in Gitega. She is 60 years old and married to Helmenegilde, who sells bananas; They have five children together and all of them are studying.

She has been selling banana wine for the past three years and is on her third loan from Turame. With the loan she is granted from KIVA she is going to buy a lot of bananas in order to prepare a large quantity of banana wine to sell, so that she can earn more money. 

The profits from her business enable her to pay for her chidren's schooling and provide for the family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a lot of bananas in order to make a large quantity of banana wine to sell, so that she can earn more.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes for clothes selling business

loans.name: Asri Lestari Group

texts.en:
Asri Lestari group received another loan from MUK, in the amount of 12,600,000 Indonesian rupiahs, to be shared among the eight group members. Three of the members have requested a larger loan amount because they want to develop their businesses. These loans will be used to support pig-raising.

Ni Nyoman will use this loan to buy three superior-quality piglets for fattening. The price today is Rp. 450.000 per piglet. The remainder of the loan will be used to buy feed. To reduce the cost of feed, Ni Nyoman feeds her pigs with traditional feeds made from banana stems and various kinds of leaves. Ni Nyoman is pursuing this effort to support her family, particularly to renovate their house.

loans.use: To buy two superior-quality piglets

loans.name: Valasi

texts.en: Valasi is a 34-year-old married woman with 4 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Valasi has requested a loan to pay for sack of cement, wheelbarrow and school fees. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Valasi hopes to supplement her family income.

loans.use: to pay for sack of cement, wheelbarrow and school fees

loans.name: Ven's Group

texts.en: Living in a rural area of the Kandal province’s Sa Ang district of Cambodia, Ven is 49 years old. He is a married father of six children, two (one daughter and one son) of whom are dependent on him. He has been working as a paid worker for several years, earning about 10,000 KHR per day and saving about 4,000 KHR per day after the daily expenses to support his family.  Ven’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. He is the second-time borrower while the other member is the first-time borrower with Kiva partner VisionFund. Now leading the group of two applying for a loan, Ven, who is the leader, will use his portion to buy the above-the-ground shelter (roof, cement, brick, etc) plus a latrine slab for constructing a decent toilet for his family. He hopes that his new standard toilet will promote good hygienic practice for his family, especially his kids.

loans.use: To buy above-the-ground shelter and a latrine slab for constructing a toilet

loans.name: Tuungane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Vumiliya est une femme ambitieuse du groupe de crédit Tuungane. Agée de 52ans est mariée à un homme sans emploi  et mère des  9 enfants tous scolarisés.  Elle est vendeuse des chèvres  depuis sa jeunesse ; le crédit sollicité lui servira  à l’achat de 16 chèvres.  La cliente veut voir son entreprise grandir et  remercie Hekima.
texts.en: Vumiliya is an ambitious woman and a member of the borrower group Tuungane. She is 52 years old and married to  an unemployed man. She is the mother of 9 children who all go, or have been, to school. She has been selling goats since her childhood - the loan being requested will be used to buy 16 goats. The customer would like to see her business expand, and thanks Hekima.

loans.use: to buy 16 goats.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es:
Salvador tiene 32 años, su pareja es Olga, con quien tiene tres hijos de 10, 8 y 5 años. Ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en una comunidad nativa de la selva central.
Él es un hombre fuerte y decidido, hace 11 años empezó con las actividades agrícolas y le agrada lo que realiza;”el Aire libre me gusta, además trabajo a mi manera y no tengo jefes, solo soy yo”, menciona contento de su actividad. A pesar del trabajo duro se levanta muy temprano y coge las herramientas para trabajar bajo el intenso sol, Salvador lo hace porque sientes que eso lo dignifica. En las cuatro parcelas que su comunidad le otorgó cultiva café y plátanos. La ventaja que tiene es que ahorra en el transporte porque sus compradores llegan hasta su chacra para adquirir sus granos de café y sus plátanos. A la vez, tiene que invertir en otras necesidades como el pago por la limpieza y mantenimiento de sus cultivos. 

Esta es la primera vez que Salvador accede a un crédito con MFP, por lo que da su palabra de pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Acaba de formar parte del banco comunal “Nueva Jerusalén”, donde también se compromete en ser responsable.
Salvador invertirá este dinero en la compra de bolsas de fertilizantes para sus diferentes cultivos.
texts.en:
Salvador, 32, and his wife, Olga, have three children, ages 10, 8 and 5.  They live in their own house in the native community of the central forest.

He is a strong, determined man who started his farming activity 11 years ago and enjoys his line of work.  "I like the outdoors, and I do my own work and do not have bosses, because it is just me.", he says, content with his work.  Despite how hard the workload is, he gets up very early and goes with his tools out to work under the intense sun.  Salvador does this because he feels it makes him dignified.  On the four patches of land he was given by the community, he grows coffee and bananas.  The advantage he has is that he saves on transportation because the buyers go to his plantation to buy coffee and bananas.  He also invests in other necessities such as payment for cleaning and mainentance of his crops.

This is the first time Salvador has requested a loan through MFP, and he is committed to paying back the loan on time.  He just joined the communal bank "Nueva Jerusalén", where he promises to be responsible.

Salvador will use this money to buy bags of fertilizer for his different crops.

loans.use: To buy bags of fertilizer for his different crops.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Ablavi a 47 ans, elle est mère de 5 enfants âgés de 10 à 23 ans et tous scolarisés. Ablavi est vendeuse d’ustensiles de cuisine en plastique sur un marché de Lomé. Elle sollicite un crédit auprès de Wages afin de disposer de fonds pour acheter ses produits en gros. Elle compte réinvestir une partie du profit qu'elle réalisera et d'épargner l'autre en vue d'ouvrir des points de vente sur d'autres marchés de la capitale. Elle espère que son activité continuera à assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en: Ablavi is 47 years old and the mother of 5 children aged between 10 and 23 years old, all of whom have been to, or are going to, school. Ablavi sells plastic kitchen utensils at a market in Lomé. She is requesting a loan from WAGES in order to have sufficient funds with which to buy her merchandise wholesale. She plans to reinvest part of the profits she earns into her business, and she will save the rest, with a view to opening other points of sale at other markets in the capital. She hopes that her business will continue to ensure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils, bowls and plastic items.

loans.name: Cite Vie Nouvelle Group

texts.fr: CITE VIE NOUVELLE est un groupe de six personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Marie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 30 ans et est mariée à un certain Romaric. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Marie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari, les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de dix ans, Marie vend des bois de chauffage et du pétrole d façon secondaire à son domicile. Marie s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes au Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Marie et les autres membres du groupe CITE VIE NOUVELLE sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Cite Vie Nouvelle group has 6 members who live in the same district. The group's representative, Marie (whose hand is raised in the picture), is  30 years old and married to Romaric. The couple have 3 dependent children who all go to school. Marie lives together with her children and husband, and she and her husband both take care of the household's various responsibilities.

For almost 10 years, Marie has been selling firewood from her home, as well as petrol, as a sideline business. Marie gets her supplies from the wholesalers in Benin. This is the 3rd time that Marie and the other members of the Cite Vie Nouvelle group request ALIDé's  financial support, with a view to strengthening their working capital and their businesses, so that they are better able to fulfill their customer demand. The previous loans have been correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 41 años, es viudo, pero tiene cuatro hijos de 15, 14, 7 y 6 años. Ellos viven en una casa sencilla, pero propia, ubicada en una comunidad nativa de la selva central.
Juan es hombre ejemplar y de mucho respeto, hacerse cargo de sus cuatro hijos después de la muerte de su esposa, no es fácil. Gracias a la agricultura ha logrado obtener lo necesario para mantener su hogar. Posee siete parcelas de terrenos en las que produce café, cacao, yuca, plátano y maíz. “Me gusta trabajar en la tierra, me entretiene y además porque me da ganancias gracias a mi esfuerzo”, dice con orgullo. Una de las dificultades que casi siempre le sucede, es la falta de capital para pagar a los jornaleros que contrata para la limpieza y la cosecha; invierte de 250 a 500 soles por parcela, y los gastos de fertilizantes y semillas son muy aparte. 

Esta es la primera vez que Juan accede a un crédito con MFP. Agradece la oportunidad y da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Hace poco se formó su banco comunal “Nueva Jerusalén” y se siente alegre de poder participar en un grupo de personas empeñosas.
Juan invertirá estos 1000 nuevos soles en el pago del personal para la limpieza de sus diferentes cultivos.
texts.en:
Juan, 41, is a widower with four children, ages 15, 14, 7 and 6.  They live in a simple house they own, in the native community of the central forest.

Juan is an exemplary man who is very respectable.  Caring for his four children after his wife's death has not been easy.  Thanks to agriculture he has been able to earn a living and maintain the household.  He has seven patches of land where he grows coffee, cocoa, yucca plant, bananas and corn.  "I enjoy working on my land, it keeps me busy and lets me earn a profit for my efforts.", he says proudly.  One of the difficulties he always runs into is the lack of capital to pay the workers he hires to clean the cropland and work at harvest time.  He spends from 250 to 500 PEN per patch, and the fertilizer and seed expenses are in addition to this.

This is the first loan for Juan through MFP.  He is grateful for the opportunity and committed to paying back the loan on time.  Just a short time ago his communal bank "Nueva Jerusalén" was set up, and he is happy to form part of a group of such hard-working people.

Juan will use these 1,000 PEN to hire workers to clean his cropland.

loans.use: To hire workers to clean cropland.

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Komi a 31 ans, il a ouvert l'année dernière une cafétéria à Lomé. Il  possède déjà un employé. Pour développer son activité Komi a besoin d'un stock plus important. Dans ce but il sollicite auprès de notre institution un crédit. Il compte réinvestir ses profits dans l'entreprise. Il espère a long terme être reconnu dans la restauration et surtout gagner un revenu suffisant pour pouvoir se marier et fonder une famille.
texts.en: Komi is 31 years old. Last year, he opened a cafeteria in Lomé. He already has one employee. In order to be able to develop his business, Komi needs a larger inventory. With this in mind, he is requesting a loan from our institution. He plans to reinvest his profits in his business. He hopes, in the long term, to become known in the restauration business, and particularly hopes to earn a big enough income to be able to get married and start a family.

loans.use: to buy food products for his café.

loans.name: Adzovi

texts.fr: Adzovi habite à Lomé avec son mari et ses 2 enfants de 9 et 11 ans, tous les deux scolarisés. Son mari exerce la profession d'enseignant. Adzovi est quant à elle revendeuse d'alimentation générale. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 12 ans sur la devanture de sa maison. Adzovi sollicite pour la troisième fois un crédit chez Wages toujours dans le but d'augmenter son stock. Ses profits lui permettront de réinvestir dans l'activité. Elle espère pouvoir un jour ouvrir une vraie boutique dont les revenus lui permettront d'aider son mari à financer les études de ses enfants.
texts.en: Adzovi lives in Lomé with her husband and her 2 children, aged 9 and 11, who both attend school. Her husband is a teacher. Adzovi herself sells general food supplies. She has been doing this for 12 years, in front of her home. Adzovi is requesting a loan from WAGES for the 3rd time, with the aim of increasing her stock. Her profits will enable her to reinvest in her business. She hopes one day to be able to open a real shop which will generate enough of an income to allow her to support her husband with their children's educational expenses.

loans.use: to buy basic food items.

loans.name: Libre Group

texts.es: Doña Blanca tiene 35 años de edad, es miembro del Grupo Solidario Libre, es madre soltera de una hija, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y hace algún tiempo decidió poner una venta de pasteles, negocio que lo aprendió de su madre y que actualmente se dedica a lo mismo, trabaja todos los días empieza de 6:00 am y culmina a las 6:00 pm. El préstamo que solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos y productos como ser harina, azúcar, leche, soda, sal, y todo lo necesario para fabricar pasteles. Con la ayuda de este préstamo doña Blanca podrá ofrecer a sus clientes todo tipo de cosméticos y diferentes sabores, tamaños y tipos de pasteles. Su meta es poner una muy buena repostería y tener un local más amplio. Doña Blanca es el segundo préstamo que solicita en FAMA y ha cumplido con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Blanca is 35 years old and is a member of the "Solidario Libre" group. She is a single mother with one daughter. She earns her living selling cosmetics and a while ago she decided to start selling cakes, a business she learnt from her mother who still works in this way. She works every day starting at 6:00 am and finishing at 6:00 pm. 

She is asking for a loan to buy cosmetics and ingredients such as flour, sugar, milk, soda, salt and everything else she needs to make cakes. With the help of this loan Blanca will be able to offer her customers a wide range of cosmetics and different flavours, sizes and types of cakes. Her goal is to start a nice cake shop and obtain a larger premises. This the second loan Blanca is requesting from FAMA and she has made all of her repayments punctually.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and ingredients with which to make cakes.

loans.name: Loukiatou

texts.fr: Loukiatou a 38 ans, elle est mère de deux enfants âgés de 10 et 15 ans, tous deux scolarisés. Le mari de Loukiatou vend des voitures d'occasion. Loukiatou vend, pour sa part, des jus sur le marché. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 15 ans. Loukiatou sollicite un crédit auprès de Wages dans le but d'acheter les ingrédients nécessaires pour les jus. Elle compte réinvestir une partie des profits qu'elle fera et d'épargner l'autre. Son objectif est de développer des points de vente dans plusieurs marchés différents. Elle désire surtout assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en: Loukiatou is 38 years old and the mother of 2 children aged 10 and 15, both of whom attend school. Her husband sells second hand cars. Loukiatou herself sells juices at the market. She has been doing this for 15 years. Loukiatou is requesting a loan from WAGES in order to buy the necessary ingredients to make juice. She plans to reinvest part of the profits she earns and to save the rest. Her aim is to establish points of sale at several different markets. She especially wishes to ensure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients with which to make juice.

loans.name: Nehemias

texts.es:
Nehemías tiene 32 años, su pareja es Elizabeth, con quien tiene cuatro hijos de 14, 13, 11 y 7 años. Ellos viven en la casa que construyeron en una comunidad nativa de la selva central.
Él se dedica a la agricultura desde los 20 años, aprendió muy joven, ya que necesitaba solventar los gastos que sus hijos le exigían. De esa manera empezó produciendo café, plátanos y maíz. 
Él es muy empeñoso y gracias a su arduo trabajo logró adquirir 10 terrenos de cultivos, pero por ahora sólo utiliza seis. Tiene muchos planes en mente, como sembrar nuevos productos (yucas y frutas cítricas), así como aumentar sus plantas de café. “Podría sembrar en mis otras tierras pero a veces me falta dinero para invertir”, menciona como una de las principales dificultades dentro de su trabajo. Pero gracias a su experiencia sabe cómo distribuir su dinero a fin que le alcance para el fertilizante, las semillas y el pago del personal. Ahora se esmerará en la limpieza de sus cultivos, pues realiza esta actividad cada 3 meses. 

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por eso se siente comprometido en pagar las cuotas en las fechas indicadas. Ingresó al banco comunal “Nueva Jerusalén” y afirma que pondrá empeño en las actividades.
Nehemías invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en el pago por la limpieza de los terrenos que están cubiertos de maleza.
texts.en:
Nehemías, 32, and his partner Elizabeth have four children, ages 14, 13, 11 and 7.  They live in a house they built in the native community of the central forest.

He has been involved in agriculture for 20 years, and learned the trade when he was very young in order to cover his children's expenses.  That is how he began growing coffee, bananas and corn.

He is very hard-working and thanks to his efforts has been able to acquire 10 patches of cropland, but he only uses six right now.  He has many plans in mind, such as sowing new crops (yucca plant and citrus fruits), as well as increasing his coffee production.  "I could plant on more land but sometimes I run out of money to invest.", he mentions since this is one of his main difficulties in the business.  But thanks to his experience he knows how to distribute his money in order to buy fertilizer, seeds and to pay hired workers.  Now he will take care to clean his cropland, which he must do every three months.

This is his first loan through MFP, so he is very committed to paying it back on time.  He has joined the communal bank "Nueva Jerusalén" and says he will put much effort into his activity.

Nehemías will use this loan to pay for clearing weeds off his land, since it is covered with them.

loans.use: To pay for clearing out weeds on his land.

loans.name: Yesica

texts.es:
Yesica tiene 19 años, su pareja es Vinath, con quien tiene un pequeño hijo de un mes de nacido. Ellos viven en una casa rústica, pero propia, ubicada en una comunidad nativa de la selva central.
Desde hace un año se dedica a la agricultura, con la ayuda de su conviviente han logrado realizar las arduas tareas en sus chacras; como la limpieza de los terrenos, la siembra y plantación y luego el mantenimiento. Ahora cuenta con dos parcelas donde produce café, achiote y plátanos. Ella se siente contenta con su labor, por lo gratificante que es obtener dinero por un  gran esfuerzo. “Cuando cosechamos, llevamos los productos hacia la ciudad, allí la gente compra al por mayor, por eso me conviene”, dice. Sus principales problemas han sido la falta de personal y pocos fertilizantes, debido a falta de capital. 

Esta es la primera vez que accede a un crédito con MFP y está muy contenta por la confianza que le brindan, por eso dice que pagará con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al recientemente creado banco comunal “Nueva Jerusalén”.
Con este dinero podrá comprar cinco bolsas de fertilizantes (con 700 soles), los 300 soles restantes serán para pagar a los jornaleros quienes realizarán la limpieza de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Yesica, 19, and her partner Vinath have a one-month-old son.  They live in a rustic house which is their own, located in the native community of the central forest.

She has been in agriculture since she was very young, and with the help of her partner has been able to carry out hard work on her land, such as clearing the fields, sowing the crops and taking care of maintenance.  Now she has two patches of land where she produces coffee, annatto and bananas.  She says she is happy with her work because of the money she earns for her great efforts.  "At harvest time we take the produce to the city where people buy it wholesale, because that is what is most convenient for me.", she says.  Her main problems are lack of workers and lack of fertilizer, because she does not have the capital.

This is her first loan through MFP and she is content about the confidence shown in her.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time.  She belongs to the recently formed communal bank "Nueva Jerusalén".

This money will be used to buy five bags of fertilizer (with 700 PEN); while the remaining 300 PEN will be used to hire workers to clear the cropland.

loans.use: To buy five bags of fertilizer (with 700 PEN), the other 300 PEN will be used to hire workers to clear the croplands.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La socia María actualmente tiene 63 años, es casada y tierne cuatro hijos, ella sigue con la ocupación de la enseñanza de de artesanía de tipo bordado, ella hace por ejemplo suéteres y mantas, ella también vende artesanías que ella misma hace. En esta oportunidad, ella está pidiendo el préstamo para comprar más materiales de trabajo rara continuar realizando sus propias manualidades, ella por ejemplo desea comprar de cuerdas, hilos, perlas y encajes. La socia María es una mujer emprendedora y responsable que sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Minibank”.
texts.en:
The member, María, is 63 years old, married and has four children.  She is still working in her embroidery teaching business.  She makes sweaters and blankets, and also sells the crafts she makes.  On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy more work materials to continue with her crafts.  She wants to buy string, yarn, beads and lace.  

María is an enterprising, responsible woman who continues to be a member of the communal bank "Minibank".

loans.use: to buy more string, yarn, beads, and lace to make crafts

loans.name: Elisabel

texts.es: La socia Elisabel actualmente tiene 32 años, tiene una relación de unión libre y tiene tres hijos, ella sigue con la ocupación de la cocina en una institución del estado. En esta oportunidad, ella está pidiendo el préstamo para uso personal y es para educación de sus hijos para matricula y la alimentacion. La socia Elisabel es una mujer emprendedora y responsable que sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Minibank”.
texts.en: This member's name is Elisabel and she is 32 years old. She is in a common law marriage and has three children. She still works as a cook in a state institution. At this time, she is asking for the loan for personal use and it is for school registration and to feed her children. Elisabel is an enterprising and responsible woman who still belongs to the “Minibank” communal bank.

loans.use: to pay for the the school registration of her children.

loans.name: Flomena

texts.en:
Flomena lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is extremely fertile for agriculture. She has seven children and has been doing this work for 20 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and personal business.

Flomena was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, "I heard about Juhudi from a friend at the university." This client was also asked what she learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session and she replied, "loan product diversity is offered."

Her highest monthly expense is business related. When asked how will this loan benefit your family, Flomena replied that surplus income enables her to feed and clothe her family.

Flomena also stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Satisfaction working with animals!" Her biggest challenge is drought during the dry season. The animals on the farm have been given the names of Ayshire and Jersey.

[Cow, poultry, pig, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile, tractor, pump]
Given the above list of assets to choose from, Flomena owns the following: cow, poultry, bicycle

[Mosquito net, electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD]
Given the above list, Flomena's household has the following: net

*****By using mobile devices in the field to build this profile, Juhudi Kilimo is making its operations more efficient.  This keeps costs down, reduces paper usage and provides more information to potential Kiva lenders!*****

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, 42, is the mother of four children - two boys and two girls. She is a widow and therefore none of her children attend school since she is unable to pay school fees for them. Elizabeth has been selling vegetables in a vegetable stall for ten years, working from her home. She is seeking a loan from Yehu to replenish her stock of merchandise.

She plans to reinvest future profits into her business. In the long term, she would like to be a retailer. She also wants to provide quality life for her children despite all the adversities she is passing through. Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase tomatoes, potatoes, sukuma wiki (a popular Kenyan dish made of greens), etc. She is a determined woman who never loses heart.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, potatoes, sukuma wiki, etc.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children. 

Antonieta has a small store where she sells snacks and soft drinks. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stock of snacks and soft drinks.

Antonieta is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Antonieta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of snacks and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy grocery items and household items for reselling.

loans.name: Jecinter

texts.en:
Jecinter is now 36 years old and is taking a concurrent loan to buy new clothing for sale. 

This will be her second loan from KADET LTD. She will use the loan to buy more textile materials and clothing for sale. 

Jecinter hopes to make enough profit so that she will be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy textile materials and clothing.

loans.name: Anaclita

texts.en:
Anaclita is from Monte Alegre, Aurora. She is 63 years old and married with one child. 

Anaclita owns and operates a business planting and harvesting coconuts for sale. She's been engaged in her business for 22 years now. She earns 12,000 PHP a month. 

In 2007, Anaclita joined GDMPC. Anaclita is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to pay for farm maintenance. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for farm maintenance.

loans.name: Sefer

texts.en:
The borrower, Sefer, is a 45-year-old married man with two school-age children. He lives in a city in which the population is very large. This is an advantage to Sefer because his main source of income is generated from his workshop where he fixes shoes.

Sefer is a very hardworking person with a strong desire to get ahead and provide for his family. He currently needs a loan to buy the raw materials he needs in order to both complete orders that customers have recently requested and to accommodate future orders as well. 

Sefer’s workshop has been operating for 20 years and has a reputation for high quality work and products. His dream is to expand and grow his business so he can improve his family's quality of life. He also dreams of giving his children a high-quality education. He hopes his business endeavors and successes will help them to realize their own dreams. 

Sefer thanks all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en: Erma is a married and has three children. Erma is 50 years old and resides at Gubaan, Aurora. Erma owns and operates a farm, planting & harvesting corn for sale to earn a living and she's been 10 years in this business. Each month, she earns 7,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2009, Erma joined GDMPC. In the future, Erma wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose's group is comprised of  hardworking women. Rose is 20 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past 4 years, Rose has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale and will help Rose to generate greater profits and take care of her child and her parents. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to buy land and build a house on it. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Danyoon

texts.es:
Danyoon tiene 28 años, es soltero, pero tiene un hijo de 6 años. Vive solo en una casa rústica que construyó cerca de sus sembríos en una comunidad nativa de la selva central.
Él es un joven alegre y carismático, desde los 20 años es independiente y siembra en los terrenos que su familia le otorgó, allí produce frutos cítricos (naranjas, mandarinas, limas), y plátanos, le va bien. Con la cosecha de plátanos puede tener ganancias cada quince días y con los cítricos cada año. Gracias a su destreza puede vender satisfactoriamente sus productos en el mercado de frutas de la ciudad. Pero además de la agricultura, Danyoon tiene un pasatiempo que también considera como trabajo: la música. Todos los viernes, sábados y domingos se da un tiempo, por las tardes, para tocar y recibe su pago al día. Piensa trabajar con estas dos actividades porque cada una de ellas le trae satisfacciones diferentes. 

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y afirma que será puntual en los pagos, como en los créditos anteriores. En cuanto a su banco comunal “Nuevo Amanecer de Huacamayo”, dice que le agradan las reuniones educativas porque cada vez aprende cosas nuevas.
Con el dinero de este préstamo comprará bolsas de fertilizantes para sus cultivos de plátanos y cítricos, y además pagará a los jornaleros quienes limpiarán sus cultivos de la mala yerba.
texts.en:
Danyoon is 28 years old and single, however he has a 6 year-old son. He lives alone in a rustic house that he built near his fields in an indigenous community in the central forest. He is a happy and charismatic young man who has supported himself since he was 20 years old by cultivating the lands his family gave him. There he produces citrus (oranges, mandarins, limes) and bananas. He is doing well. He can earn an income every 15 days from his banana harvests and once a year from his citrus crop. Thanks to his skill, he sells his products satisfactorily in the fruit market in the city.

Aside from farming, Danyoon has a pastime that he also considers a job: music. Every Friday, Saturday and Sunday he spends time, in the afternoons, playing and being paid, by the day. He intends to work at these two jobs because each one brings him a distinct satisfaction.

This is his third loan from MFP and he states that he will be punctual in his payments as in previous loans. With regard to his communal bank , “Nuevo Amanecer de Huacamayo”,  he says that he enjoys the educational meetings because he learns something new every time. With money from this loan, he will buy bags of fertilizer for his banana and citrus plants and he will pay the laborers who will clear weeds from his crops.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer for his banana and citrus crops and pay laborers to weed his fields.

loans.name: Mbulah

texts.en:
Mbulah is a very devoted woman who continues her farming activity growing vegetables. Since her previous loan, she has been able to increase her farm so as to grow more vegetables. Mbulah says that it has been a profitable project since she has many customers. Her customers prefer her because she sells fresh vegetables and fruits.

Mbulah is requesting another loan in the amount of KES 50,000 to expand her business. With this loan, she plans to purchase fertilizers, pay for labor cost, and to pay for transport to the market. She hopes to grow more variety of fruits and vegetables in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pay for labor cost, and to pay for transport to the market.

loans.name: Clavelia

texts.es:
Clavelia tiene 41 años, su pareja es José, con quien tiene dos hijos de 11 y 6 años. 
Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde pequeña, ayudando a sus padres aprendió muy bien cómo se debe desenvolver dentro del campo. Ahora que ya tiene hijos realiza la misma actividad pero con mayor entusiasmo e inspiración. En sus dos parcelas tiene cultivados café, achiote y frutos cítricos. “Me conviene cultivar estos tres productos porque son los más rentables y además ya tenemos compradores conocidos”, menciona. Con la ayuda incondicional de su esposo, limpia de la mala yerba a sus plantaciones. Todas las mañanas se dirige hacia sus parcelas con las herramientas, a pesar del intenso calor o de las lluvias, ella tiene que trabajar. Este mes empezará con la limpieza de sus cultivos que quedaron maltratados por la última cosecha.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y se compromete a pagar puntualmente las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Flor de Almendra”, es una de las socias más empeñosas y participativas del grupo.
Con este dinero podrá comprar plantitas de café para colocarlas en sustitución de las plantas ya viejas que no producen. Además pagará por la limpieza de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Clavelia is 41 years old.  José is her life partner, and they have two children, ages 11 and 6.

She has been working in agricultural since she was little.  She helped her parents, and she learned very well how you need to work in the field.  Now that she has children, she does the same work, but with greater enthusiasm and motivation.

She has coffee, annatto, and citrus fruit crops on her two parcels of land.  “It is good for me to cultivate these three products because they are the most profitable.  Also, we already have existing buyers,” she says.  With the unconditional help of her husband, she clears the weeds from her crops.

Every morning she heads towards her land with the tools.  In spite of the intense heat or the rains, she has to work.  This month she will start clearing the fields that were left battered by the last harvest.

This is her third loan with MFP.  She pledges to make her monthly payments punctually.  She belongs to the “Flor de Almendra” communal bank.  She is one of the most diligent and active members of the group.

With this money she will be able to buy small coffee plants to replace the plants that are old and do not produce.  She will also pay to clear the fields.

loans.use: to buy small coffee plants and pay to clear the fields.

loans.name: Dulamjav

texts.en:
Mrs. Dulamjav, 46, works as a janitor in the primary school and she has been working for 12 years nonstop. Currently she lives with her husband and her daughter in the ger district, Mongolian traditional nomadic yurts, of Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. 

Her husband runs a taxi around the city with his bad, old car. He does not have any permanent earnings and the earnings are occasional. His business is dependent on his car and it influences whether he has good or bad earnings in a day. Lately his car has been very bad and most of the spare parts are damaged. Therefore, he has decided to repair his car in order to run his business more regularly. The loan Dulamjav is taking will be dedicated to buy the new spare parts for her husband’s taxi car.

loans.use: to buy new spare parts for her husband’s taxi vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy embroidery material for embroidery business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
As a married mother of 4 children, Alicia works hard to support her family. She has a fish pond business in the Philippines. Alicia  is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy a variety of fish and feeds.

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish and feeds.

loans.name: Anacleta

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Anacleta works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fishing. 

Anacleta is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Anacleta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Silverio Jr.

texts.en:
Silverio is from Balintawak, Aurora. He is 43 years old, is married and has 7 kids. Silverio owns and operates a business, planting and harvesting coconuts to sell. He has been engaged in his business for 5 years and earns 12,000 a month. 

In 2011, Silverio joined GDMPC. Silverio is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to pay for farm maintenance. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to pay for farm maintenance.

loans.name: Samaher

texts.en:
Samaher is 28 years old and lives in Gaza. She is married and has three children.

She owns a clothing store for selling women and children's clothes.

She asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy an electricity generator, shelves, hangers, and more goods for the shop.

She hopes that this loan will help her increase her customers and thus improve her income.

loans.use: to buy an electricity generator, shelves, hangers, and more goods for the shop.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a widow with five children and none of her children goes to school. She takes care of her old parents and grandchildren. She resides in her own house and the family has no access to electricity but has access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees for grandchildren and feeding the family. 

She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for over 10 years. She works at the market and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. Besides this charcoal business, she generates additional income through rental rooms.  

She has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. 

She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also building more rental rooms.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 49 years old and married. She has nine children.

Nancy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a nipa (woven palm mats used for house construction and repair) retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of nipa to sell.

Nancy has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the nipa retail for 23 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Nancy aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of palm mats to sell.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha tiene 43 años, su pareja es Rubén, con quien tiene cuatro hijos de 19, 13, 10 y 4 años. Juntos viven en la casa que construyeron con el esfuerzo de su trabajo.
Hace 10 años que ella se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva café y frutas cítricas como naranjas. En estos días se encuentra en la cosecha de las naranjas y sus hijos la apoyan en esta actividad. El precio de las naranjas no son tan favorables este mes, Martha afirma que en setiembre los precios subirán y ganará más. Mientras tanto cuida sus tres parcelas de café, con la limpieza de la mala yerba y el esparcimiento de fertilizantes. “Cada año obtengo una buena cosecha de café, y cada año mejora, ahora acabamos de cosechar los últimos granos”, manifiesta. Por ello, ahora se esmerará en la limpieza del cafetal, contratando personal operario a quien pagará al día.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Flor de Almendra”, uno de los grupos más sólidos de la zona.
Esta vez invertirá los 2000 soles de este préstamo en el pago de los jornaleros que contratará para hacer la limpieza de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Martha is 43 years old. Her partner is Rubén with whom she has four children, who are 19, 13, 10 and 4 years old. They all live together in the house that they built by dint of their own work. 

Martha  has been farming for 10 years and grows coffee and citrus fruit, such as oranges. At present she is harvesting her oranges and her children are helping her with the job. The price of oranges is not as favorable this month. Martha says that in September, the price will rise and she will earn more. Meanwhile, she is tending her three plots of coffee by weeding and spreading fertilizer. “Every year I get a good coffee harvest and every year it improves. Now, we are finishing harvesting the last beans,” she states. Consequently, she will now put a lot of effort into weeding her coffee plantation, hiring a work crew that she will pay daily. 

This is her third loan from MFP and she is committed to making her payments on time every month. She belongs to the “Flor de Almendra” Communal Bank, one of the most  solid groups in the area. This time she will invest the S/. 2,000 in paying the laborers she will contract to weed her plants.

loans.use: to pay the laborers she will contract to weed her plants.

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
Apolinaria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an egg retail business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy more eggs to sell to customers.

NWTF is relisting Apolinaria's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more eggs to sell.

loans.name: Radi

texts.en:
Radi is 60 years old and he is from Tulkarem. Radi is married and has one boy. He owns a small farm where he raises cattle to sell and to use for dairy and to buy others.

Radi has asked Ryada for this loan in order to improve and enlarge the cattle coop and to buy iron doors. He hopes that this loan will help him to develop his work and improve his income.

loans.use: to improve and enlarge the cattle coop and to buy iron doors.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Anita has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall. She has been in this business for 7 years.

In the future, Anita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Basilio Jr.

texts.en:
Basilio is married and has 4 children. Basilio is 43-years-old and lives in the Philippines. Basilio is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn his living. He has been doing this for 3 years and every month he earns PHP 5,000 from this work. He has requested a loan of 7,000 to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

Basilio been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Basilio hopes to finished the studies of his children and to double his income out of his business.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

NWTF is re-listing Beverly's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
As a married mother of 3 children, Bienvenida works hard to support her family. She has a selling cosmetics business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales. Bienvenida is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy more cosmetics to sell.

Bienvenida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Bernagen

texts.en:
Bernagen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a guitar making business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 43,000 through NWTF to purchase wood, strings, glue and copper for her business.

NWTF is re-listing Bernagen's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase wood, strings, glue and copper.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
As a married mother of 2 children, Cristina works hard to support her family. She has a making and selling guitar business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vegetable vending. Cristina is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more guitars to sell to customers.

Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her guitar-making business.

loans.name: Cloudimit

texts.en:
Cloudimit is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rug making business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy raw materials for her rug making business.

NWTF is re-listing Cloudimit's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed in her rug making business.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: Jaime con su anterior credikiva compró productos de cigarrería y refrescos con los que surtió su punto comercial, redujo costos e incrementó sus utilidades. Esto lo hizo pensar en acceder a un nuevo crédito para volver a invertir en un mayor volumen de estos productos, con los cuales ahorrará, pues los precios de compra que le ofrecen sus proveedores son competitivos y esto se lo debe a su credikiva. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Muchas gracias, por el apoyo económico brindado a mi negocio ojalá sigan haciéndolo para lograr educar a mis hijos y tener mi propia casa: “
texts.en:
With his previous loan from Kiva, Jaime bought tobacco products and soft drinks. He supplied his stationary stand with these to reduce his costs and increase his profit. 

This made him think about applying for another loan to continue investing in larger volumes of these products. This way he will save money since the prices the suppliers offer are competitive. This is because of the loan from Kiva. 

He has the following message for Kiva’s lenders: 
“Thanks a lot for the financial support that you offered to my business. Hopefully, you will continue to do so such that I can educate my children and have my own house.”

loans.use: to buy tobacco products and soft drinks.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria de 57 años,  es la propietaria de una tienda ubicada en la ciudad de Bogotá; ella vende al detalle ranchos, víveres, refrescos y en general artículos de la canasta familiar. Maria inició su negocio desde el  año 1982, pero hace dos meses se mudó a otro barrio, donde tiene un potencial de crecimiento por explorar, porque no existe competencia alguna en el sector donde está instalada. Por eso su clientela que son sus vecinos y habitantes del barrio,  no dejan de comprarle y los productos terminan muy rápidamente, mientras debe ella  hacer compras con mucha frecuencia en pequeñas cantidades. Su horario de atención, se extiende desde las 6:00 de la mañana hasta las 9:00 de la noche y diariamente se esmera en aumentar sus oportunidades de crecimiento para aumentar cada vez más el bienestar de su familia. Maria está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará al por mayor y de contado víveres, ranchos, refrescos y abarrotes, ampliando así su inventario de mercancías y logrando dar una respuesta mas oportuna a su clientela e incrementando sus ingreso, los cuales son sus propósito principales.
texts.en:
Maria, age 57, has a store in the city of Bogotá.  She sells snacks, food, soft drinks, and basic needs items.  Maria started her business in 1982.  However, two months ago she moved to another neighborhood.  Here she can explore the potential for growth because there is no competition in the area where her business is located. 

Her customers are from the neighborhood.  They constantly buy from her, and she runs out of the products very quickly.  She needs to make her purchases in small quantities and very frequently.  Her work schedule is from 6:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m.  She works very hard every day to increase her growth opportunities in order to increase her family’s well-being.

Maria is applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy food, snacks, soft drinks, and groceries wholesale and for cash.  She will be increasing her inventory, she will manage to respond to her customers in a more timely manner, and she will increase her income.  These are her primary objectives.

loans.use: to buy food, snacks, soft drinks, and groceries wholesale and for cash.

loans.name: Cristeta

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Cristeta works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fishing.  

Cristeta is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell for her dried fish vending business.

Cristeta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Raafat

texts.en:
Raafat is 28 years old and he is from Gaza. He is married and has one child.

Raafat owns a small shop where he does printer's maintenance. He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a copy machine and and office supplies and furniture. He hopes that this loan will help him to improve his income and develop his work.

loans.use: to buy a copy machine and and office supplies and furniture.
