loans.name: Divian

texts.en:
Divian works hard to support her family. She is married and has a firewood retail business in the Philippines. Divian has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell. She has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Divian would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 42-year-old married borrower. She has four children with ages ranging from 10 years to 20 years. She describes herself as a risk-taker and opportunistic. 

She operates a retail store where she sells items such as curtains, dresses, etc. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located within a competitive business area and her primary customers are residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the KES 8,700 loan to buy a water tank. Her business goal is to run a big boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be the best seller of clothes.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 36 years old and married. she has three children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Alicia has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Alicia requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Alicia has been in this business for two years. In the future, Alicia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Janine

texts.en:
Janine works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buko salad business in the Philippines.

Janine has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her buko salad such as buko, condensed milk, wrappers, sugar, etc. She has been in this business for a year now, and also earns additional income from fish vending.

In the future, Janine would like to save enough money to expand her business and to continue sending her adopted child to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her buko salad such as buko, condensed milk, wrappers, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy textile materials used for dressmaking.

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
Ammar is 25 years old and he is from Gaza. He owns a sewing shop and has experience of four years in tailoring and sewing clothes.

Ammar has asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a sewing machine and an embroidery machine. He hopes that this will increase his work and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina works hard to support her family. Agustina is married and has an Internet cafe business in the Philippines.

Agustina requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy computer supplies and for repair and maintenance of her computers.

She has been in this business for seven years.

In the future, Agustina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for computer supplies and repair and maintenance for her computers.

loans.name: Amorlina

texts.en:
Amorlina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sari sari (variety) store business in the Philippines.

Amorlina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her variety store.

She has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Amorlina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari sari store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 59 years-old and married with four children. Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase more stock to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a blacksmith business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase additional raw materials for her blacksmith business.

Ana has been in this business for five years. Ana earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Ana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Bilda

texts.es:
Bilda tiene 47 años, quedó viuda hace dos años. Tiene cuatro hijos, pero ahora sólo vive con dos de ellos.
Se dedica a la agricultura desde que se casó (a los 19 años). En sus cinco parcelas de terrenos cultiva café y cítricos, como naranjas, mandarinas, tanyelos (híbrido) y tanyarinas (híbrido). Su esposo era quien se hacía cargo de estas labores, pero es una mujer de iniciativas, por eso contrata personas y cumple con su labor. “Lo más cansado es atender el cafetal, pero con mis hijos apoyándome terminamos sin problemas”, menciona. Bilda sabe que este año hubo escasez de papayas y el precio se elevó, por ello esta vez piensa iniciar una siembra de este fruto. 

Este es su crédito número 8 con MFP y está muy agradecida con la entidad por tantos años de confianza. Por su parte, dice que pagará con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Ella es una de las socias más alegres dentro del banco comunal “Flor de Almendra”; le agrada su grupo.
Ella destinará el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de semillas de papaya (con 800 soles), lo restante será para adquirir bolsas de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Bilda is 47 years old and was widowed two years ago. She has four children but now only lives with two of them.

She has been a farmer since she married (at 19 years of age). On her five plots of land she cultivates coffee and citrus, such as oranges, mandarins, tangelos (hybrids) and tangerines (hybrids). Her husband was the one who took care of the farming, however she is a woman with initiative and thus is hiring labor and will meet her commitments. “The most tiring is tending the coffee plantation, however with my children helping me, we are completing the task without any problems,” she states. Bilda knows that this year there was a scarcity of papayas and the price rose, consequently this time she plans to start cultivating this fruit.

This is her eighth loan from MFP and she is very grateful for their many years of confidence in her. She says that she will make all her monthly payments punctually. She is one of the members who is happiest with the “Flor de Almendra” Communal Bank. She is very pleased with the group. She will use the money from this loan to purchase papaya seed (with  800 soles) as well as bags of fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase papaya seeds and bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Dibeh

texts.en:
Dibeh is a 46-year-old Lebanese woman. She is married and living with her husband and three children. They are all attending school.  

She, together with her husband, manages the family’s own household expenses while operating her business. She has been the owner of a home products shop since 2002. She sells different types of products such as casseroles, glasses, dishes and many other items. Her shop is located in her town where many customers from her community visit her to buy their needed products at fair prices. Dibeh keeps on working very hard in order to maintain her family’s financial status at a good level.
 
Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. to expand her inventory of home products. She earns a barely fair income and she confirms that the loan will help her boost her her income by 15%.

loans.use: to expand her inventory of home products.

loans.name: Eleonora

texts.en:
Eleonora works hard to support her family. She is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Eleonora has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store like biscuits, soft-drinks and other grocery items. She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Eleonora would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her store like biscuits, soft-drinks and other grocery items.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: El cliente, Juan José, es un señor de 34 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Angélica, el cliente trabaja en el servicio de transporte publico, el cliente pertenece a una empresa de radio taxi en la ciudad de Cochabamba, actualmente el cliente vive por la zona sur de la ciudad de Cochabamba, aproximadamente a 6 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, la casa donde vive el cliente no es propia, el cliente vive con su esposa en alquiler, ambos no tienen hijos dependientes y el destino del nuevo crédito de la institución es para la compra de un vehículo, ya que el cliente con el vehículo nuevo tendrá mas ingresos y de alguna u otra manera podrá satisfacer sus necesidades que tiene en su familia, ya que en este momento su esposa no se encuentra trabajando, es por lo cual reflejamos esta pequeña historia del cliente, para el conocimiento de todos ustedes.
texts.en:
Juan José is a 34-year-old-man who is married to Angélica. He works in the public transport service. He owns a radio taxi company in the city of Cochabamba. Currently, he lives south of the city about 6km away. 

He does not own the house where he lives but rents it with his wife. None of them have dependent children. With the loan from Kiva they plan to buy a vehicle. With this new vehicle, Juan José will have a higher income and another way to satisfy the needs of his family because currently, his wife does not have a job.

This is why we have told you this little story so that you all can get to know Juan José.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle.

loans.name: Loeurng's Group

texts.en:
Originally from the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, Loeurng is a 41-year-old married mother of three dependent children. Her children are currently helping the family’s business. 

Loeurng is a rice farmer, farming on two hectares of farmland for almost twenty years to support her family. The current business earns her about KHR 10,000 per day to meet the family’s needs. Loeurng’s group consists of four female members; this is the first microloan for all the members in this group with Kiva partner VisionFund and all of them are applying for a new loan of KHR1,000,000 each. Loeurng is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees for her farmland. She hopes that this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to make a good living.

loans.use: to use her portion to buy fertilizer and to pay the plowing fees for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years-old and married with four children who are in school, Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to purchased additional products to sell in her general store.

Josephine has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, milk, soap, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.. 

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchased additional products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 61 years-old and married with two children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. in her general store.

Erlinda has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from selling coconut wine and fish vending. This is her third loan on KIVA.

Erlinda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rodita

texts.en:
Rodita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through Kiva partner NWTF in oer to purchase additional materials for the repair of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Rodita has been in this business for five years. Rodita earns additional income from pig fattening.

Rodita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future. This is her third time on KIVA.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Leonora works hard to support her family. She has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Leonora is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional dried fish to sell for her dried fish vending business. Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business. This is her second loan in Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 34-year-old lady from Kisumu. She is widowed but takes care of 4 children, ages 4, 9, 11 and 16 years.

Jane operates a tailoring business in one of the big markets within Kisumu City. She has been doing this business for the last 13 years and she makes a monthly income of 40,000 KES. 

She is now taking her fourth loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy textile materials used for dressmaking. Jane will use her profits to buy sewing machines. Her dream is to open business outlets.

loans.use: To buy textile materials used for dressmaking.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables and spices in the Philippines. Chona has been in this business for 2 years. She earns more income from rice retail.

Chona is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell for her vegetable and spice business. Chona has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy and sell vegetables and spices

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is 45 years old, married and lives in the Philippines. Paz is making and selling snacks like banana cake and hot cake. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients like sugar, flour, cheese and margarine.

Paz is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Paz hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients in making snacks

loans.name: Faked

texts.en:
Faked is from Iraq. He is 34 years old and married but he doesn’t have children. He is the only provider for the family.

Faked owns a small shop selling used home appliances. He established his business in 2010. He has a good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a loan of $1800 to renovate his shop. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop.

loans.name: Mazen

texts.en:
Mazen is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 22 years, single, and lives with a family of five members, two of whom are employed. 

Mazen owns a small grocery store. He established his business in 2009 and he has now one employee. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting $2000 as a youth loan to buy a refrigerator and a generator. He also wants to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and a generator

loans.name: Adoté

texts.fr: Adoté est vendeur d'appareils électroniques depuis 9 ans. A 31 ans, il habite à Lomé avec sa femme et ses deux enfants de 2 et 6 ans. La femme de Adoté est couturière. Suite à un ralentissement récent de son activité il désir réinvestir pour devenir un vendeur plus important, voire un grossiste. Dans ce but il sollicite un crédit auprès de Wages. Il compte utiliser les profits qu'il réalisera en les réinvestissant dans son activité. Sa priorité est de gagner un revenu suffisant pour garantir la scolarité de ses deux enfants.
texts.en: Adoté has been selling electronic equipment for nine years.  He is 31 years old and lives in Lomé with his wife and his two children, aged 2 and 6.  Adoté’s wife makes clothing.   Because of a recent decline in business, he would like to reinvest in order to become a more active salesman and a wholesaler.  With this goal in mind he is requesting a loan through Wages.  He plans to use the profits that he’ll make to reinvest in his business.   His priority is to earn sufficient income to allow him to provide an education for his children.

loans.use: to buy electronic equipment.

loans.name: Donmaz

texts.en: Donmaz is a 46-year-old married man and the father of three children. He runs a general store. His main customers are neighbors in the area, especially housewives for whom the store provides an opportunity to purchase household products daily for prices within their economic means. Donmaz also has an additional business selling oil for cars. This will be his second loan from Aqroinvest and Kiva, and he has a good client history. Now he would like to buy new food products and increase his monthly turnover. He asked for a new loan in the amount of 1500 Azerbaijani manats (AZN) to be able to increase the variety in his general store, improve the business, and meet customer needs and demand.

loans.use: to increase variety in his general store

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim's group is comprised of 3 hardworking women. Shamim is 18 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Masaka region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Shamim has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Shamim has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale and will help Shamim to generate greater profits and take care of herself. Shamim hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot and build a house on it. 

Shamim is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Elminaz

texts.en:
Elminaz is a 37-year-old woman. She is married with four children. She is an IDP and lives with her family in an IDP settlement. She is an animal breeder and fattens sheep. She has more than 10 years of experience, which makes her an experienced person. She has gained trust and respect from the local butchers and local vendors.

She usually buys lambs, raises them and fattens them, and in 4-5 months, she sells them for a more profitable price at the local livestock bazaar.  People in Azerbaijan use mutton in everyday national dishes, such as pilau and dolmas, and always use yoghurt sauce. Mutton is considered very healthy and also present in everyday life. Fur is very useful for blankets and bed mattresses, which are made by local women.   Her monthly income from this business is 160 AZN.

Now, Elminaz would like to expand her herd and purchase five sheep and one additional cow. She wants to buy a cow because there is a high demand for fresh milk and yoghurt. She applied for a 1000 AZN loan to reach her goals.

loans.use: To buy five sheep and one cow

loans.name: Lutbat

texts.en:
Mr. Lutbat, 51, is a taxi driver and has been running his business around the districts of Ulaanbaatar since June of 2011. He lives with his wife and his four children in a common apartment with three rooms in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. One of his children recently moved out from his parent’s home. 

In winter, his apartment becomes cold and hard to keep warm due to the emission through the outdated windows. His children always get sick due to the cold at home. Since his family moved in this apartment many years ago, there has not been any big repair or renovation to it. 

In response to this, he wanted to replace his old and bad windows with double-glazed ones. He said that it will be very useful and healthy for his family members. 

The loan he is taking will be used to cover the cost of the new double-glazed windows for his family house.

loans.use: To cover the cost of new double-glazed windows for his building a new family house.

loans.name: Falilatou

texts.fr: Âgée de 33ans, Madame Faliletou vit avec son conjoint commerçant et ses 06 enfants à Lomé. Les enfants vont tous à l’école. Faliletou quant à elle est revendeuse des articles d’électricités, de construction et divers dans une boutique. Elle exerce seule son activité et sollicite de WAGES un quatrième prêt pour s’approvisionner en marchandises afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle voudrait rendre son activité pérenne et assurer le bien –être de la famille.
texts.en: Mrs. Faliletou is 33 years old and lives with her husband, a merchant, and her six children in Lomé.  Her children all attend school. Mrs. Faliletou, herself, sells electric and construction materials, along with various other items, in a shop.  She works alone and is requesting a fourth loan through WAGES to be able to stock up on merchandise in order to better meet the demand of her customers.  She hopes to keep her business operating in future years and to be able to assure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy construction and electric materials, and various other items.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: La socia Isabel actualmente tiene 37 años, es casada y con dos hijos, ella sigue con la ocupación de la venta de ropa y en la calle y en los diversos mercados de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella vende todo tipo de ropa, pero se especializa en ropa interior femenina. Isabel está pidiendo un préstamo para comprar la ropa interior más de las mujeres y sostenes para la venta. Además, ella también se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como por ejemplo perfumes, aretes, anillos, colonias y otras más. En esta oportunidad Isabel se ha comprometido a hacer todos los pagos de los préstamos necesarios a tiempo. La socia Isabel es una mujer emprendedora y responsable que sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Minibank”.
texts.en:
Isabel, age 37, is married and has two children.  She continues with the occupation of selling clothes on the street and at diverse markets in the city of Cusco.  She sells all types of clothes, but she specializes in women’s underwear.

Isabel is asking for a loan to buy more women’s underwear and bras to sell.  She also sell beauty products like perfume, earrings, rings, cologne, and others.  Isabel has pledged to make all of the payments on time.  Isabel is an enterprising and responsible woman who continues to belong to the “Minibank” communal bank.

loans.use: to buy more women’s underwear and bras to sell.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 35 years-old and married.  She has four children and three of are in school.

Eden is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Eden requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm equipment.

Eden has been farming rice for 20 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Eden would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm equipment.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

Elsie has been in this business for 20 years. Elsie earns additional income from selling rice.

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 36 years-old and married with three children who are in school. He sells electronics to earn a living. He has been in the business for six years and has employed one person. 

In addition, he farms to generate more income. He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to improve his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. He has requested a loan of 100,000 KES in order to buy more electronics to sell.

loans.use: to buy electronics to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 44 years-old and married with four children who are in school. He practices dairy farming to earn a living. He has been doing farming for fifteen years. 

In addition, he offers cleaning services for a fee. Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has become business oriented because he has been trained on business management. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. Daniel has requested a loan of 70,000 KES in order to buy dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is a hardworking business lady and married. She practices farming for a living. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has improved her her saving culture because she has been trained on financial management. She dreams of producing more output and buying ten cows in the future. Hannah has requested a loan of 40,000 KES in order to buy fertilizers and seedlings for her farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is married, has four children and only two of her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (her brother’s daughter). She has a business of a beauty salon and has been in this business for 10 years. 

Harriet has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids, weaves and a small hand dryer. Besides this salon business she also generates additional income through selling cold drinks, like soda and passion juice. Harriet works from her home and works on all types’ hair, but mainly by retail seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include thieves, seasonality and the ever increasing prices of cosmetics in Uganda. She is aspiring to see her business grow bigger into a fully stocked salon and also to buy a plot of land to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses  includes school fees rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids, weaves and a small hand dryer.

loans.name: Elnura

texts.en:
Elnura is a 21 years old woman, young, friendly and very hardworking. She is IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband and parent in an IDP Settlement. She is a farmer and raises seasonal fruits and vegetables in her garden. She has two years of experience in this field. Her husband helps her to sell her crops.

Elnura usually sells her crop from her yard. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table in an Azerbaijan family and fresh punch is also made regularly.  

Elnura's monthly income is 150 AZN. She has applied for 1000 AZN to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 37 years old, married and has three children. He sells beauty cosmetics to earn a living. He operates his business in a competitive environment with loyal customers. He has been in the business for ten years. 

Francis had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to expand his business. He has also learned how to manage his business since he has been trained in business management. He dreams of operating another cosmetic shop in a different location. Francis has requested for a loan of 50,000 KES to buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics.

loans.name: Hacar

texts.en:
Hacar is a 44 years old woman, married, with four children. She is IDP (an internally displaced person). Hacar breeds cattle for meat purposes. She also has two milking cows. Her profit consists of cattle sales and selling fresh yoghurt and milk. Her husband is on a pension and helps her to run the business. 

Hacar usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then resells for more profitable price from her house. Her monthly income is 130 AZN and this business is the only source of financial income in her family. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. 

Currently, Hacar has applied for a 1000 AZN loan to buy two cattle and fodder.

loans.use: to buy two cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah  is a single mother of five children and four of her children go to school. She has a business of selling Local gin and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDTSACCO to buy more jerrycans of local gin.  

Sarah works at the market seven days a week and sells by wholesale only. She doesn’t have any other income generating activity. Her major business challenges include thieves and transportation of jerrycans of local gin from Kasese to her home. She is aspiring to get enough profits to invest in selling used clothes and also to own a delivery van to ease in transportation. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity, but no piped water. Her monthly expenses includes feeding the family, school fees and paying for electricity bills.

loans.use: to buy more jerrycans of local gin.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 45 years old, married and has four children who are in school. She sells cereals, like maize and beans, to earn a living. She has been in the business for ten years and has employed one person. Besides this, she practices farming to generate more income. She had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped her to add more stock to her business. 

Rachel dreams of expanding her business in the future. Rachel is requesting for a loan of 20,000 KES to buy household goods.

loans.use: to buy household goods.

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en:
Tarana is a 33 years old woman. She is IDP (inernally displaced person) and lives with her husband and two children in an IDP Settlement. She has been breeding cattle and cows for the last six years. Her husband is a workman and his work is low-paid and not permanent. Tarana started her business and her husband helps her to sell the cattle.

Tarana usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then resells for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 120 AZN. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Tarana also sells fresh milk and yoghurt to neighbors.

Currently, Taran has applied for a 1000 AZN loan to purchase one milking cow, one cattle and fodder. This will be her second loan and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy one milking cow, one cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Saeeda

texts.en:
Ms. Saeeda is a married women and has been successfully running a general store with her husband, Abdulshakoor Abdul, for 3 years. They are happily doing the business together but having different duty hours. Ms Saeeda handles the store in day time while her husband joins later in evening. They offer various items like rice, flour, pulses, tea, biscuits, chips, sweets, candies, tissue papers etc. 

This couple has three daughters and all are school going. They need to earn more income to cover their everyday expenditures and to lead their respectable life. So she has requested for a loan of (Pakistan rupees) Rs 30,000/- to buy more items, including biscuits, chips, toffees etc. for the general store. This will enable them to sustain their business and, hence, to better support their family.

loans.use: to buy stocks for her general store e.g. rice, pulses, biscuits, chips, etc.

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en:
Mahmud is a 22 years old young, hardworking man. He is married and lives with his wife and parents in one house in an IDP Settlement (internally displaced person). Mahmud sells car spare parts and also has been providing car service (repairing cars) for the last three years. His working place is in his house because he is not able to rent a special place. His monthly income is 70 AZN, which is very low to cover the needs of a young family. 

Mahmud has applied for a 1000 AZN loan to buy new and modern tools to sell and for repairing. He has a good client history and has already paid back two loans.

loans.use: to buy modern tools to sell and to repair.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 45 years old, married and has four children who are in school. He runs a boda boda (motorcycle) transport business to earn a living. He has been in this business for two years and has employed two people. Besides the boda boda business, Peter also does farming and welding to supplement his income. 

Through Faulu Kenya, Peter has learned how to save, since he has been trained in financial management. He dreams of expanding his welding business and owning a Nissan in the future. Peter has requested for a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Sevindik

texts.en:
Sevindik is 54 years old, married and the father of three children. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He earns a living by breeding cows and cattle, and sells their milk and milk products as well as meat to local butchers. He has 20 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him how to look after cattle. 

Sevindik usually buys small cows, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and resells them for a more profitable price to butchers.  Milk and yogurt he sells to neighbors. He earns about 180 AZN a month, in part because milk, yogurt, and meat are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes as pilau and dolma, and always use yogurt. Milk products are seen as very healthy and used daily.   

Because his family has only one source of income, Sevindik is requesting a loan for 1,800 AZN to buy three cattle and two milk cows. This will be his second loan. He has good client history and plans to use the additional income he earns to care for his family.

loans.use: to buy three cattle and two milk cows

loans.name: Maqsooda

texts.en:
Ms Maqsooda is a 42 years old married woman and has been running a business of milk selling with her husband for 5 years. Her husband's name is Anwarulhaq. They have two buffalo in milk and sell their milk to many of their neighbors, along with butter and cheese that they make from the milk.  She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. They are happily doing the business together to support their family.

Ms Maqsooda and her husband have four daughters and two sons, five of them are school-going. They need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. In order to make huge profits, they have requested for a loan of (Pakistan Rupess) Rs 30,000/- to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. They hope to increase in their production capacity which, ultimately, helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 60 years old, married and has two children. He sells cereals to earn a living. He has been in the business for nine years and has employed one person. Besides this, he also does farming to supplement his income. 

John had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to grow his business. He hopes to open another outlet in the future. He has requested for a loan of 80,000 KES to buy maize, beans and peas to sell.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans and peas.

loans.name: Safura

texts.en:
Safura is a 50 year old married woman with two children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) and lives with her family in an IDP Settlement. She is a farmer and raises seasonal fruits and vegetables. She has 20 years of experience in this field, which makes her an experienced and skilled person in this field. 

Safura usually sells her crop from her house. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served at every table in an Azerbaijan family and they also make fresh punch. Her monthly income is 120 AZN. Raising crops takes a lot of strength and, working in the open air, is very hard for a woman. That why her spouse helps. 

Safura needs additional capital to invest in seeds and fertilizers as well as new garden tools. This will allow her to improve the quality of products she raisea and to increase her monthly turnover. For this purpose she has applied for 1500 AZN. This will be her second loan and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a woman of high integrity and dignity. She utilizes every business opportunity that arises. She continues her food counter, which has been profitable to her. Her major goal is to educate her children and to ensure that they become professionals. 

Jackline is taking out another loan so as to expand her current business. She intends to buy wheat flour, sugar, cooking oil, etc. Thanks for her efforts and she is sure to repay her loan and request for more loans in future.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Comercita

texts.en:
Comercita is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children. Comercita has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store, from which buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Comercita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Comercita hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Ms. Sughran is a married women and successfully running a business of wholesaling for the past 10 years with her husband. They purchase the stock of edible items including sweets, toffees, pop corn, candies, chips packs, etc. from the market and pack them at home and offer for sale to other native cities. 

Ms Sughran is motivated to earn a high income to meet her day to day requirements and fulfill the demands of bread and butter. She has requested for a loan of Rs (Pakistan Rupees) 25,000/- to buy more stock, in bulk at lower prices from the market, to sell in different cities of the country. In this way, she will be able to increase her personal income and better support her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of sweets, popcorn, etc. for onward sales to retailers.

loans.name: Ofeliya

texts.en:
Ofeliya is a 37 years old woman, married, with one daughter. She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person). She is a very successful entrepreneur and has her own sheep farm. She has been breeding sheep for the last 8 years and is very experienced in this field.  

Ofeliya usually buys lambs, raises and fattens them in 4-5 months and resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 170 AZN. People use meat in everyday national dishes, such as pilau and dolma, and always use yoghurt sauce. Mutton is considered as very healthy and is also present in everyday life. The wool is very useful for blankets and bed mattresses, made by local woman. 
 
She has applied for 1000 AZN to make renovations of the herd and to improve conditions of keeping her sheep. This will be her second loan and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to make renovations in the animals' keeping place.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a hardworking businessman, married, with two children who are in school. He runs a taxi transport business to earn a living. 

Besides the taxi service, James also sells cereals to generate more income. Through Faulu Kenya, he has improved on his saving skills because he has been trained in financial management. He dreams of opening another business in the future. James has requested for a loan of 20,000 KES to service his vehicle.

loans.use: to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Haitham

texts.en:
Haitham is a 26-year-old young man. He is married and a father to one son and one daughter.

For the past three years, Haitham has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income for the family. Haitham is requesting a USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of licensing and insuring the taxi and purchasing a new engine for the taxi he drives. This will increase the taxi's capacity to work extra hours and enable Haitham to take additional internal and external requests, which will improve the family's income positively.

Haitham is photographed next to his taxi.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to pay for insuring and licensing the taxi and to purchase new engine for the taxi.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is taking out a loan for Ksh 10,000 to expand her current business. She is grateful for the support she has received because it has helped her grow her business. Fatuma earns a living by selling petroleum and started with one gallon but demand has now increased, so she would like to use this loan to buy four gallons to sell to her customers. This will allow her to continue to satisfy her customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy four gallons of petroleum to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a buffalo for a livestock business.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Ms. Saima is a married woman and runs a general store business. She strives hard to achieve her goals through her business. She has four children, and they all are school-going. She is in charge of providing them with a quality education, good food, and clothing.
 
She has a real need to get a loan to improve her business, so she requested a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy more items for her store including tea, coffee, chips, bread, biscuits, etc. In this way, she will be able to sell more and earn enough profits to support her family well.

loans.use: To buy more items for her store including tea, coffee, chips, bread, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Ansam

texts.en:
Ansam is a conservative woman who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Kamal appears in her Kiva profile photo. Ansam is 30 years old and the mother of three daughters. For the past two years, Ansam's husband has earned a living by running a grocery store.  It has been profitable, but the only source of income for the family and it does not bring in enough money to cover the family's costs. Ansam is requesting a loan from FATEN to help her husband buy more groceries to sell, including rice, sugar and  milk. This will increase sales and the family's income.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is its prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit into this cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The loan amount you see here includes both the loan principal loan and the servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to help her husband to buy more groceries to sell in his store.

loans.name: Samet

texts.en:
Samet is 54 years old and lives in a rural village in the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Cambodia. He is married and the father of six children, four of whom are young and still depend on him. He works as a tailor and a rice farmer, while his wife supplements their income by planting ginger and taro on their one hectare of land. They have been in these lines of work for 30 years and earn about $12 a day. Their main business challenge is insect infestations, which can destroy their crop yields.

Samet is applying for his second loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The first loan helped him expand his current business. Now he is requesting a loan from VisionFund for $1,200 to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for his farm, and to buy materials he needs for his tailoring business. He believes that this loan will allow him to earn more money, and his children to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for his farmland.

loans.name: Niffer

texts.en:
Niffer is 31 years old and married to David. They are blessed with three children, aged eight, five, and three years. She sells clothes, along with farming, a business she started five years ago.  She earns a monthly income of KES 8,000. 

She has requested a fourth loan of KES 15,000 to purchase ladies skirt suits and shoes for sale. The profit from her business will help her repay her loan. 

She dreams of a much bigger business in future.

loans.use: To purchase ladies skirt suits and shoes for sale.

loans.name: Yeni Beatriz

texts.es: Yeni Beatriz  vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura desde muy joven su padre le enseño el oficio  y se siente orgullosa de toda la experiencia obtenida pues eso le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona accesible y apta para la siembra, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y tiene mucha clientela pues sabe que todo lo que vende es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es excelente; Yeni es una mujer enérgica, admirable y luchadora, tiene una gran motivación por salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños su mas grande secreto para alcanzar el éxito es la perseverancia, no piensa rendirse y en esta temporada de cosecha quiere aumentar la producción pero necesita de capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, abono, herramienta, etc. Yeni Beatriz tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de conocidos y tiene una moral intachable, se responsabiliza de cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez de ofrecerle a su familia una vida plena, con un futuro mas prospero.
texts.en:
Yeni Beatriz lives with her life companion and their children in her own house.  She works growing corn and beans and has several years’ experience working in agriculture since her parents taught her the occupation when she was still very young and she feels proud of all the experience she’s acquired because it allows her to improve her crops.  Her fields are located in an accessible zone that’s apt for planting.  She sells in all her community’s surrounding areas and has a large clientele because they know that everything she sells is top quality at affordable prices and besides service is excellent.

Yeni is an energetic, admirable, tenacious woman who is very motivated to get ahead and reach her greatest dreams.  Her biggest secret for attaining success is perseverance.  She does not plan to give up and in this planting season she wants to increase production but needs capital to back her up which is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy corn and bean seeds, manure, tools, etc.

Yeni Beatriz has good payment references from acquaintances and her moral nature is unimpeachable.  She takes on the commitment to repay the loan according to schedule while offering her family a fulfilled life with a more prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy seeds, farm supplies and tools.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia tiene 46 años, está casada con Reymundo, con quien tiene cuatro hijos. Ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en una comunidad nativa de la selva central.
Desde los 18 años se dedica a la agricultura, actividad que heredó de sus padres y que ahora transmite a sus hijos. Posee, gracias a la comunidad, seis parcelas de terrenos donde produce cacao y frutas cítricas. Hace poco plantó más café, por eso se esmera en el cuidado de las plantas, a fin de que le otorguen buenos frutos. “La venta de cacao es buena, pero es solo una vez al año, por eso con las frutas tengo para cubrir los gastos diarios”, menciona. Antonia tiene una ventaja en sus ventas, los compradores llegan hasta su zona para adquirir sus productos, así ahorra en el pago del traslado. Lleva en esta rutina como 10 años y manifiesta que le va muy bien. Ahora piensa sembrar maíz, porque se cosecha en cuatro meses y aprovechará esta temporada que es buena para este producto.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, da su palabra de pagar con puntualidad las cuotas. Pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Jerusalén” y se siente contenta de su ingreso.
Antonia invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de semillas de maíz y bolsas de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Antonia is 46 years old. She is married to Reymundo, with whom she has four children. They live in their own house, located in a native community in the rain forest in the central part of the country.

Since she was 18, she has worked in agriculture, a profession passed on to her by her parents and one that she is now transmitting to her children. Thanks to the community, she owns six parcels of land where she produces cacao and citrus fruits. Recently, she planted more coffee, and for this reason she is taking special care with her plants so that they will provide her with good crops. "Selling cacao is good, but it takes place only once a year, and because of that I have to cover daily expenses with the fruits," she notes. Antonia has an advantage with her sales: the buyers come to her area to purchase her products, saving her the expense of transporting them. She has followed this routine for about 10 years, and she says that it is going very well for her. She is now planning to plant corn, because it is harvested in four months, and she will take advantage of the current season which is good for this crop. 

This is her first loan with MFP, and she gives her word that she will make her loan payments punctually. She belongs to the “Nueva Jerusalén” ["New Jerusalem"] communal bank, and she is happy that she joined. 

Antonia will invest the funds from this loan in buying corn seeds and bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and bags of fertilizers.

loans.name: Eudez

texts.es:
Eudez tiene 45 años, está casada con Eduardo, con quien tiene ocho hijos, pero ahora sólo viven con cinco de ellos.
Ella se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con cuatro parcelas de terrenos que la comunidad le otorgó por los años que lleva como pobladora de la zona. En esos terrenos cultiva café, naranja y achiote, pero le da prioridad al café, porque le convienen los precios. “Las naranjas y el achiote tienen buen precio, pero con el café ya tenemos para cubrir casi todos los gastos del año”, menciona. Por ello, se esmera en la limpieza de sus cultivos y en la fertilización constante de sus tierras. Pero sus terrenos son extensos y lejanos, por ello contrata personal para agilizar esta actividad. Tiene en mente ampliar sus cultivos y cambiar las plantas gastadas por otras más tiernas, así sus cosechas serán mejores.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Flor de Almendra” y menciona sentirse a gusto con socios responsables.
Eudez destinará este dinero en el mantenimiento de sus cultivos de café, naranjas y plátanos. Afirma que los 3000 soles los gastará solo en esta actividad.
texts.en:
Eudez is 45 years old and is married to Eduardo. They have eight children together, but currently only five live with them.

She works farming. She has four plots of land which were given to her by the community for living in the area for so many years. On that land, she grows coffee, oranges, and achiote, but coffee is her priority because of its price. "Oranges and achiote have a good price, but coffee alone allows us to cover nearly all of the expenses for the year," she says. That is why she works hard to clear her crops and constantly fertilize her land. But her plots are vast and far away, so she hires workers to speed up the process. She is thinking about expanding her crops and changing the older plants for younger ones in order to obtain better harvests.

This is her third loan with MFP, so she promises to make her monthly installments on time. She belongs to the communal bank Flor de Almendra and says she feels at ease with other responsible members. 

Eudez will use this money to maintain her coffee, orange, and plantain crops. She says she will spend the 3000 soles on this process.

loans.use: to invest in the maintenance of her coffee, orange, and plantain crops.

loans.name: Rafaq

texts.en:
Rafaq is 29 years old.  He lives in the city of Agsu, Azerbaijan, with his wife and two little children. 

Rafaq owns a shop for repairing cars. He specializes in changing oil. He established his business six years ago, when he got married. 

Rafaq decided to request a new loan so that he can invest in his vehicle repair business. He plans to buy more tires and oil and in this way meet his customers' needs.

This is his first loan from AqroInvest and Kiva.   He hopes it will give him what he needs to continue working, so that he can generate income for his family.

loans.use: to buy more tires and oil to sell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 30 years old and a single lady from Kisumu Nyawita.  She takes care of two children, aged 12 and 9 years.

Lilian operates a green grocery business selling various types of vegetables and fruit.  She has been in this business for the last two years and makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is now taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy kale and various fruits. 

Lilian will use her profits to repay the KADET LTD loan.  Her dream is to be a supplier of various foodstuffs.

loans.use: To buy kales and various types of fruit.

loans.name: Oyunbat

texts.en:
Oyunbat is 45 years old and a welder in the carpet factory in Erdenet, the third largest city in Mongolia. He has been doing his job since 1993 nonstop, and he has become one of the skilful, experienced workers in the company. 

He lives with his wife and three children in his house, which is in the ger district (gers are Mongolian nomadic yurts). His son and daughter are students at the college, and his wife has worked as a builder since 1999. 

Oyunbat’s family owns an old house, which is rundown and loses heat. In winter his family always feels cold and gets sick because it is so chilly at home. He wants to repair some parts of his house. His plan includes rebuilding his floor by cement; insulating the inside walls with foam and glass-wool; repairing his roof with metal sheets, and installing electric floor heating panels.  As he expects, the house will be warmer and more comfortable for his family to live in.  Also he mentioned cutting his coal-fired furnace after the repairs.   

He needs about 6,500,000 MNT to cover the cost of building materials needed to repair to his poor old house. In addition, he and his wife will repair the house themselves.

loans.use: To make repairs to his rundown house.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en: Ivan is an old client of Ugafode Microfinance Ltd, dealing in general merchandise.  He runs a retail shop at a trading centre, a few kilometres from Kyotera town council, Rakai district.  He is taking a loan of Uganda shillings 1,700,000 to buy sugar, salt, soap, omo, kitchen utensils, among other items, to restock his shop.  Ivan has been getting loans from the institution for the last four years and, therefore, this is his sixth cycle. In addition to his shop, he has several sources of income ranging from raising cows and using a motorcycle for public transport to running a small bar.  His customers are the local people.  He hopes that, with this loan, his business will boom and he will meet the needs of his customers as well as raising money to take care of his rather extended family  Ivan gives many thanks to Ugafode for making him what he is today and promises to work harder and one day start up a supermarket.

loans.use: To buy more items for the shop

loans.name: Elia

texts.en:
Elia, a permanent resident in rural Lyantonde, is an agriculturalist who rears cattle and, at times, sells them. He uses the money from  sell of animals to take care of his extended family.

He applied for a loan of two million shillings to buy cows for fattening. Elia has been in the cattle trade for six years and therefore has enough experience in this field. He hopes that in future he will acquire land and start a ranch for himself to boost his business. His biggest customers are traders from Kampala and farmers. Elia, however, faces challenges of middlemen who frequently fluctuate prices, long dry spells that lead to the death of animals, and pests and diseases such as foot and mouth, which result in quarantines and trade embargos.

loans.use: To buy cows for fattening

loans.name: Yonny

texts.es: Actualmente, la señora Yonny tiene 47 años de edad y es madre soltera de tres niños que son 5, 21 y 23 años. Los tres de sus hijos viven con ella y dos de ellos estudian en la universidad, ella continua con su pequeño negocio de venta de artesanías como máscaras y edredones, ella trabaja todos los días la venta de estos productos y cuenta con el aspecto creativo de su obra. La señora Yonny está pidiendo un préstamo para que pueda comprar edredones y diferentes tipos de bolsas. La señora Yonny es una mujer muy trabajadora y se compromete a realizar los pagos de los préstamos necesarios a tiempo. La señora Yonny es una mujer emprendedora y responsable que sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Minibank”.
texts.en:
At present, Yonny’s a 47-year-old and the mother of three children who are 5, 21, and 23 years old.  Her three children live with her and two of them are attending university.  She continues with her small business selling crafts like masks and comforters.  She works every day selling these items and relies on the creative aspect of her work.

Yonny is requesting a loan in order to buy comforters and various types of purses.  Yonny is a very hardworking, responsible woman who is still a member of the “Minibank” communal bank.

loans.use: to buy comforters and assorted purses.

loans.name: Musitafa

texts.en: Musitafa is a repeat client at UGAFODE in his third loan cycle. He deals in cattle trade and is a farmer as well. He applied for a loan of 1,500,000 shillings to buy cows that he will sell to increase his income.  He has been in this business for the last twenty years. Through the business he has been able to build himself a permanent home at Ddwaniro-kooki-Rakai and is educating five of children, other two are yet to begin school. He describes himself as trustworthy  and hard-working, attributes he has displayed during his five year interaction with UGAFODE staffs. Musitafa faces  challenges of price fluctuations, limited capital, and unreliable weather patterns which affect his production levels. However, with this loan Musitafa says the problem of limited capital will be history.

loans.use: To buy  cows

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
Mariluz es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene dos hijos, ella tiene dos hijos de 8 y 10 años de edad, ella es ama de casa que esta al cuidado de sus dos hijos y tiende a la casa pero también ahora se está dedicando a administrar el pequeño taller de automotriz donde se hace reparación de carros. En esta oportunidad Mariluz está pidiendo el préstamo para que pueda invertir en el negocio de mantenimiento de carros o sea desea comprar repuestos, lubricantes, aceites y otras cosas más que se necesitan, ella se ha comprometido a hacer todos los pagos de los préstamos necesarios a tiempo. 

La señora Mariluz es una mujer emprendedora y responsable que sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Minibank”.
texts.en: Mariluz is married and has two children who are 8 and 10 years of age.  She’s a housewife who cares for her two children and her home but is also now running a small car repair shop.  On this occasion, Mariluz is requesting a loan to invest in her car repair shop.  That is, she wants to buy spare parts, lubricants, oil and other things that are needed.  She had committed to make all her necessary loan payments on time.  Mariluz is an enterprising, responsible woman who is still a member of the “Minibank” communal bank

loans.use: to buy vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling frozen foods business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of frozen foods to sell to her customers.

NWTF is relisting Emma 's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of frozen foods to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es:
Wilder tiene 34 años, su pareja es Teresa, con quien tiene cinco hijos de 17, 16, 13, 11 y 3 años. Juntos viven en la casa que Wilder construyó en una comunidad nativa de la selva central.
Él se dedica a la agricultura desde los 17 años, gracias a esta actividad ha podido brindarles a sus hijos lo necesario para vivir. Cuenta con seis parcelas de terrenos agrícolas donde siembra frutas cítricas, café y achiote. Pero le da prioridad a las fruta porque su cultivo es más fácil y lo cosecha en poco tiempo y por muchos días. Por otra parte, menciona que el achiote le da buenas ganancias, espera el mes de octubre para cosechar. “El año pasado el kilo estaba a 6 soles y es un buen precio, espero que este año sea igual o mejor”, dice. 

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que da su palabra de ser puntual con el pago de las cuotas. Pertenece al banco comunal “Flor de Almendra”, donde comparte enseñanzas con los socios gracias a las charlas educativas.
Él destinará este dinero en la compra de bolsas de abono orgánico y fertilizantes para sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Wilder is 34 years old.  He and his wife Teresa have five children, ages 17, 16, 13, 11, and 3.  They live together in a house that Wilber built in a community in the central jungle

He has been a farmer for 17 years and thanks to this he has been able to provide his children with what they need.  He has six parcels of farmland, where he raises citrus fruits, coffee, and achiote.  He gives priority to the fruit because it’s the easiest crop to harvest and he can do it quickly and often.  He also says that achiote provides good earnings and he is waiting for October to arrive so he can harvest.  “Last year the price was 6 PEN per kilo and that was a good price.  I expect this year that the price will be the same or more,” he says.

This will be his second loan through MFP and he gives us his word that he will be on time with his payments.  He is a member of the “Flor de Almendra” communal bank where he shares his experiences with the other members, thanks to the educational chats.

He will use the money from this loan to buy sacks of organic fertilizers for his coffee crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 45 años, tiene siete hijos, pero actualmente vive con sólo dos de ellos: Jose Armando y Jorge Luis, a los que cuida en la casa que alquiló hace 12 años.  
Cuando formó su familia (12 años atrás) comenzó a sembrar en los terrenos de su suegra ubicados a una hora de la ciudad. Ahí siembra diversos productos como alverja, olluco, papa y oca, los que cuida cada fin de semana, pues los demás días los dedica al trabajo en un rancho donde extrae leche y le pagan un sueldo mensual que le ayuda en los gastos del hogar. Pero Mercedes desea mejorar sus cosechas, pues en la venta que realiza de sus productos obtiene buenas ganancias y desea incrementarlas.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Nuevo amanecer” y este es su quinto crédito con MFP. En todo este tiempo (más de 2 años), con esta institución, obtuvo el dinero necesario para invertir en el desarrollo de su actividad, por lo que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además que le agrada pertenecer a su grupo donde todas las personas son responsables.
Mercedes invertirá esta vez en la compra de dos bolsas de semilla de alverja para esta temporada.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 45, has seven children but currently only lives with two of them: José Armando and Jorge Luis who she cares for in the house she rented 12 years ago.

When she formed her family (12 years ago) she started planting on her mother-in-law’s land located an hour away from the city.  She grows various crops there like peas, olluco [Andean tuber], potato, oca [tuber], that she tends to every weekend because on the rest of the days she works on a ranch milking cows; she’s paid a monthly salary that helps with household expenses.  But Mercedes wants to improve her crops because she gets good profits from the sale of her products and she wants to increase them.

She belongs to the “Nuevo Amanecer” (New Dawn) communal bank and this is her 5th MFP loan.  In all this time (more than 2 years) with this institution, she’s gotten the necessary money to invest in her activity which is why she promises to be punctual with her installment payments.  She likes being part of her group because all the people are responsible. Mercedes will use the money this time to buy two sacks of pea seeds for this season.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of pea seeds.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas tiene 40 años, su pareja es Carmen con quien tiene ocho hijos. 
Él es un hombre muy trabajador, se dedica a la agricultura desde joven, en las tres parcelas de terrenos produce frutas cítricas y café. Lleva en esta actividad como 22 años y en todo este tiempo se dio cuenta que el cultivo de café y cítricos es más rentable. En el mes de octubre iniciará con la cosecha de las naranjas, fecha especial y favorable, porque los precios suben. Acaba de cosechar los últimos granos de café y tiene que iniciar con la limpieza y fertilización de sus tierras para el próximo año. Sus planes son de sembrar plátanos, porque tiene cuatro parcelas que requieren limpieza para poder producir ese fruto, por ello se esmerará en esa actividad.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por ello se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Está emocionado porque acaba de ingresar al banco comunal “Flor de Almendra”. 
Tomas destinará este dinero en la compra de 500 mamones de plátanos, cuyo precio es de 50 céntimos cada uno; lo que le sobre será para el pago del personal que contratará para la limpieza de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Tomas is 40 years old, and his partner is Carmen. They have eight children together.

He is a very hardworking man, and has been farming since he was young. On his three plots of land, he produces citrus fruits and coffee. He has been in this business around 22 years and over all this time he realized that growing coffee and citrus fruits is the most profitable. He will start harvesting his oranges in the month of October, which is a special and favorable time of year, because prices go up. He just finished harvesting the last coffee beans and he has to start clearing and fertilizing his land for next year. He plans to plant plantains, because he has four plots of land that need clearing before they can grow this fruit, so he is going to work on this process.

This is his first loan with MFP, so he is committed to paying his monthly installments on time. He is excited because he just became a member of the communal bank Flor de Almendra. 

Tomas will use this money to purchase 500 plantain offshoots, that cost 50 cents each. He will use whatever is left over to pay the workers he will hire to clear his crops.

loans.use: to purchase plantain offshoots and to pay the workers he will hire to clear his crops.

loans.name: Galy

texts.es:
Galy tiene 20 años, su pareja es Javier, con quien tiene un hijo de 5 años, a quien cuidan con mucho amor. Ellos viven en su casa propia construida en una comunidad nativa de la selva central. 
Hace dos años que empezó a trabajar en el campo, pues antes sólo su pareja se encargaba de estas faenas. Ahora cuentan con dos parcelas de terrenos donde cultivan frutas cítricas y café. Este año las ventas no fueron tan buenas, el precio bajó hasta 6 soles el kilo, mientras que años anteriores llegó a costar hasta 12 soles, pero Galy es constante y ahora se esmera en la limpieza de su cafetal para tenerlo listo para el año que viene, por eso ahora requiere de fertilizantes y guano de corral. En cuanto a las frutas, empezará a cosechar dentro de dos meses; “cuando se trabaja todos los días, no nos falta el dinero para nuestros gastos básicos”, dice.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y está agradecida por la oportunidad, a la vez muestra entusiasmo, ya que ingresó al banco comunal “Flor de Almendra”, donde promete ser responsable con los pagos.
El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de bolsas de fertilizantes para sus cultivos de café y frutas cítricas.
texts.en:
Galy is 20 years old. Together with her partner, Javier, she has a 5-year-old son, whom they both care for together. They love him very much. The family live in their own home, built in a native community in Peru’s Selva Central region.

Two years ago Galy started to work in agriculture – before that, it was only her partner who used to perform these tasks. Now they have two plots of land where they grow citrus fruits and coffee. This year sales were not so good. The price dropped to 6 PEN per kilo, while in previous years it had been as high as 12 PEN, but Galy is persevering and now she is putting a lot of effort into clearing her coffee plantation so that it will be ready for next year. This is why she now needs fertiliser and dung. As for the fruit, she will start to harvest it within two months. “When we work every day, we have enough money to cover our basic outgoings”, she says.

This will be Galy’s first loan with MFP and she is grateful for the opportunity. She is also enthusiastic, having joined the community bank “Flor de Almendra”. She has pledged to be responsible with the repayments. 

Galy will use the loan to invest in bags of fertiliser for her coffee and citrus plants.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertiliser for her coffee and citrus plants.

loans.name: Arca De Noe Group

texts.es: Yesica es miembro del Grupo Solidario Arca de Noé, tiene 29 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, el primero de 10 y el segundo de 5 años, y su esposo se dedica hacer trabajos de construcción. Ella desde hace seis años se dedica a la venta de Golosinas, su horario de atención es de 4:00 p.m. y termina hasta las 10:00 de la noche, Yesica atiende su negocio sola y durante el día también vende lociones y cremas para el cuerpo. Su ventaja es que tiene muchos clientes y que les gusta el producto que ella les ofrece. El préstamo que Yesica solicita lo necesita para surtir su negocio con lociones y cremas y comprar la materia prima para la elaboración de golosinas como ser: tacos, baleadas, tajaditas con pollo, pastelitos, etc. Uno de sus sueños es ayudar a sus hijos a que se gradúen y que sean personas de bien. Sus metas es tener un local grande y ahorrar para poder comprar una refrigeradora y una  estufa para fabricar su producto y acondicionar adecuadamente su local siendo que sus metas no las ha podido lograr ya que han bajado las ventas y con la poca ganancia ha mantenido su negocio. Yesica tiene más de cuatro años de ser clienta de FAMA y ha cumplido puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Yesica’s a member of the “Arca de Noé” (Noah’s Ark) communal bank.  She’s 29-years-old, married and has two children.  The oldest is 10 and the youngest is 5.  Her husband works in construction.  For the last six years she’s worked selling snacks.  She starts work at 4pm and ends at 10pm.  Yesica tends to her business alone and during the daytime she also sells lotion and body creams.  Her advantage is that she has many customers that like the products she sells.

The loan Yesica is requesting is to stock her business with lotions and creams as well as with raw materials to make her snacks like: tacos, baleadas (flour tortilla stuffed with eggs and other things], fried plantain with chicken, turnovers, etc.  One of her dreams is to help her children so that they will graduate and become upstanding citizens.  Her goal is to have a larger space and to save up to buy a refrigerator and stove to make her products and to equip her locale properly.  She’s been unable to reach her goals because sales have dropped and profits have just been enough to stay in business.  Yesica has been a FAMA client for over four years and has made her installment payments punctually.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, flour, cheese, and butter, among other things.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas started a shop which she continues to operate. Thanks to the effort that she has put into her business, she has managed to increase her sales and gradually increase the quantity of products she offers for sale to her customers. With her store, her financial situation and the quality of life of her husband and four children have improved considerably. For this reason, she feels very thankful to have her store, and she is always looking to improve it so that in the future her children will be able to have access to a university education. Dorcas seeks another loan to purchase dry maize to sell in her shop. 

In this way, she will increase the variety of products that she offers her customers and her household income will increase a lot. Her main dream is to be able to have several businesses.

loans.use: to purchase dry maize to sell in her shop.

loans.name: David

texts.es: El Sr. David de 41 años de edad es casado y tiene dos hijos que aun dependen económicamente de él. David trabaja en una maquiladora de la localidad mientras que su esposa desempeña con agrado las tareas del hogar. Son un matrimonio solido, siempre han salido adelante juntos a pesar de las adversidades que se les presentan, ellos quieren brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Es por eso que en esta ocasión David pide de nuestra ayuda para terminar de construir dos cuartos en su hogar que ya tiene empezados, sabe que con esto podrá brindarle  a sus hijos más privacidad y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: David, 41, is married and has two children who still depend economically on him.  David works in a local assembly plant while his wife happily works tending to their home.  They are a solid couple who have always gotten ahead together despite the adversities that have arisen.  They want to provide the best for their children.  This is why on this occasion David is asking for help to finish building two rooms at home that he’s already begun.  He knows that with this he’ll be able to provide his children with more privacy and better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 34 years old and is married with two children aged 1 and 4 years old. He sells African clothes in a store which operates from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m. six days per week. He currently employs one person to help him and he has four years of experience in this work. 

Theogene has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more African clothes for resale. He plans to use any profits generated from this loan to satisfy his family's basic needs and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more African clothes for resale.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en: Safina is married and has six children, all of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a retail shop and has been in this business for seven years. She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and rice.  Besides this business she generates additional income through selling milk and piped water.   Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.  She aspires to see her business grow big into a wholesale shop, and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include food school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cow feed.

loans.name: Feria Persa Loncomilla Group

texts.es:
