Este Banco Comunal se llama “ Feria persa  Loncomilla” está conformado por 21 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; feriantes, venta de ropa, artículos electrónicos, venta de herramientas, venta de accesorios, ventas de muebles usados, venta de artículos de línea blanca usados, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de San Javier.
Orlando, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en cuclillas en primera fila, ocupando el primer lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste un pantalón de color azul y lleva puesta una chaqueta de color azul con mangas de color blanco, su cabello es oscuro y lo usa corto.
El se dedica  al rubro de venta de leña y carbón, además se desempeña en otros rubros como transporte, venta de artículos plásticos y a un taller de muebles, se dedica al rubro de venta de leña y carbón desde hace 5 años. Comenta que trabaja todos los días, los artículos plásticos los vende en las ferias libres, su taller de muebles lo tiene en su casa, y los fletes los realiza cuando algún cliente lo solicita ya sea fuera de la cuidad o dentro de ésta, su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
Su mercadería como los artículos de plásticos, los compra en la ciudad de Santiago a precios convenientes, y lo demás lo compra dentro de la ciudad de San Javier.
Con el crédito comprará específicamente accesorios varios como relojes murales, jarros plásticos, clavos.
Una de las metas de Orlando es continuar con el trabajo para generar mayores ingresos, y disfrutar de la vida ya que es muy corta, y darle lo mejor a su esposa y nieta.
Orlando vive junto a su esposa, nieta de 13 años de edad, su hijo quien trabaja como temporero y una tía. Sus sueños a nivel familiar es dejar a su nieta bien consolidada para un futuro no muy lejano.
El se encuentra muy contento y agradecido de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
San Javier es una comuna y ciudad de la zona central de Chile, perteneciente a la región del Maule. Se caracteriza por ser una zona esencialmente vitivinícola. Los viñedos locales pertenecen a la zona denominada Valle del Loncomilla, de donde provienen algunos de los mejores vinos chilenos, Viña Carolina y Viña Gillmore, entre otras.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called, “Feria Persa Loncomilla,” and is made up of 21 entrepreneurs who work in different lines of work, such as street market vendors, sales of clothing, electronic items, tools, accessories, used furniture, household appliances, as well as services. All of them are from the city of San Javier.

Orlando is is a member of the communal bank group. He is seen in the photo, crouching in the first row, occupying the first position from left to right, and wearing blue-coloured pants and blue jacket with white sleeves. His hair is dark, and he wears it short.

His line of work is selling firewood and charcoal.  He carries on other businesses as well, such as transport and the sale of plastic items, and he has a furniture workshop. He has been selling firewood and charcoal for five years. 

He says that he works every day. He sells the plastic items in street markets. He has his furniture workshop in his home and does freight jobs when a customer requests it, whether outside the city or inside of it. He arranges his schedule according to his availability.

Merchandise such as plastic items, he buys in the city of Santiago at good prices, and the rest he buys in the city of San Javier.

With the loan, he will buy merchandise, specifically various accessories such as wall clocks and plastic mugs.

One of Orlando's goals is to continue working to generate greater income; to enjoy life, as it is very short, and to give the best to his wife and granddaughter.

Orlando lives with his wife, 13-year-old granddaughter, his son who works as a seasonal worker, and an aunt. His dream at the family level is to leave his granddaughter well set up for the foreseeable future. 

He is very happy and grateful for the the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza, as it will allow him to invest in his business. With respect to the communal bank group he belongs to, he says that there is very good communication among the members. Moreover, The training has enabled him to learn new sales strategies, as well as accounting. 

San Javier is a city and commune in the central area of Chile, and is part of the Maule region. It is primarily known for wine-growing. The local vineyards are part of the area known as Valle del Loncomilla, from which come some of the best Chilean wines: Viña Carolina, Viña Gillmore and others.

loans.use: Comprará específicamente accesorios varios como relojes murales, jarros plásticos, clavos.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings for the business.

loans.name: José

texts.en:
José is 43 years old, a widower and has three children. They live in Caserío Cruce de Vega, a rural zone in the agricultural Tambogrande district, northern Peru, which has a tropical climate suited for fruit production like mangoes and lemons. He raises small farm animals (sheep and turkeys) to sell. When they reach ideal size and weight he sells them in the local market. He’s been in this line of work for 15 years. He also farms. He has a piece of farm land where he grows lemons and tamarind. Sometimes he works as a day laborer on the large agricultural haciendas in his zone. He tries to support his family with these activities.

José wants to acquire nutritionally balanced feed to fatten up his animals so that they can be sold for better prices in the local market. This investment will make it possible for him to continue growing his business; thus, improving his quality of life. To reach his objective, he’s deemed it convenient to request a 1500 new sol loan for the first time from Edpýme Alternativa. He is quite a responsible, hardworking father. People who know him in the zone where he lives hold him in high esteem and affection. This is the second loan he has taken out with Edpýme Alternativa and Kiva. He repaid the one before early in order to renegotiate the terms and amount of his loan given strategic changes in his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his lemon crop and balanced feed for his animals.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a hard-working, 43-year-old business lady who operates a medical clinic for a living. She has been in this business for five years. She also runs a boda boda (motorcycle) transport business to generate more income. 

She previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya that helped her to improve her clinic. She has requested a loan of 15,000 KES to buy medicines and syringes.

Emma dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy medicines and syringes.

loans.name: Arif

texts.en:
Arif, who is 46 years old, lives in Agsu, Azerbaijan, with his wife and four chilldren. 

He owns and manages a variety store in their village, selling grocery items and some fruits and vegetables. Arif has been in this business for 15 years. 

Arif is a very hard-working entrepreneur. He asked a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy additional stocks for sale.  In the future, he would like to save money to expand his business and to buy new house for his son.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for sale.

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es: La socia Martha Isabel sigue con el negocio de venta de ropa y cosméticos, la socia continua trabajando de forma independiente y repartiendo a sus clientes y a las diferentes instituciones, además, ella en esta ocasión desea invertir el préstamo en la compra ropa y productos de belleza, la socia mediante este medio económica saca adelante a su familia. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y venta de ropa por lo tanto le va muy bien, ella es una persona responsable y carismática pues sus compañeras confianza en ella. La socia desea el crédito para comprar ropa que traerá de la ciudad de Lima como pantalones y casacas.
texts.en: Martha Isabel continues with the business selling clothing and cosmetics. She continues working independently and distributing to her customers and to different institutions. This time, she wants to use the loan to buy clothing and beauty products. Through this financial support, she moves her family forward. She has sold beauty products and clothing for several years already, so it's going very well for her. She is a responsible and charismatic person, since her friends have confidence in her. She wants the loan to buy clothing that she will bring from the city of Lima such as pants and jackets.

loans.use: to buy clothing that she will bring from the city of Lima such as pants and jackets

loans.name: Virgen Asunta Group

texts.es:
La socia Hilda tiene 54 años, es casada y actualmente, Ella vive en la hermosa provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Su actividad económica principal de socia Hilda es la agricultura pues se dedica a venta de frutas como por ejemplo peras, membrillas, blanquillas, duraznos y manzana. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Además, Hilda también se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche y otras cosas más. Ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes donde tiene mercadería surtida. En esta oportunidad Hilda requiere el préstamo para comprar sacos de arroz y sacos de azúcar. (La socia Hilda está levantando la mano en la fotografía).

Este grupo está conformado por vecinos y amigos que formaron el banco comunal “Virgen Asunta” en la provincia del Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de ropa, crianza de pollos, venta de abarrotes y otros brindan servicio de transportes, llamadas a celulares y mantenimiento de carros.    

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.(La persona que aparece en la parte inferior de la fotografia llego tarde a la reunion del banco comunal).

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística, por sus centros arqueológicos, por su centro histórico, por sus paisajes, por su historia y por ser una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido también por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
The communal bank member Hilda is 54 years old. She is married and she now lives in the beautiful province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco. Her principal business is agriculture, since she sells fruits such as pears, quinces, Blanquilla pears, peaches, and bananas. She has already had this business for a number of years, and it is going very well for her. In addition, Hilda also sells basic food products such as rice, sugar, pasta, milk, and other items. She has a little grocery store where she stocks her merchandise. Hilda now needs a loan to buy sacks of rice and sugar. (Hilda is raising her hand in the photograph.) 

This group consists of neighbors and friends who formed the communal bank "Virgen Asunta" in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.  It consists of people who every moment seek opportunities to advance and with their daily effort to give a better future to their children. The business activities of the members are, for example, selling clothing, raising chickens, and selling groceries, and others offer services of transportation, cell phone calls, and auto maintenance.

The members in general appreciate the opportunity offered them and promise to make their various payments according to the established schedules. (The person who appears in the lower part of the photograph arrived late for the meeting of the communal bank.) 

Cusco is located in the district and province of Cusco in the department of Cusco, in the heart of the old city of the Incas. It is characterized by being a tourist zone because of its archaeological centers, its historic center, its landscapes, and its history, and for being an enchanting city in the southern region of the country. Cusco is also known for its traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for one of the seven wonders of the world, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice and sugar

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE CALCA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Carlos tiene 45 años de edad,el socio trabaja como profesor de nivel primario en el distrito de Calca,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene 10 años en este trabajo,el sueño del socio es tener un colegio.El socio solicita el credito para pagar la mensualidad de los estudios de su hijo.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Virgen del Carmen de Calca". The bank is located in the Calca district, belonging to the province of Calca and the department of Cusco.

Carlos is 45 years old and works as primary school teacher in the Calca district. He works from 8am to 1pm and he has had this job for ten years. His dream is to own a school. 

The member requests a loan to pay the monthly payment for his son's education. He is happy for the loan and agrees to comply  with the payment of his instalments.

loans.use: to pay the monthly payment for his son's education

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a married woman and has been running her own beauty parlor for the last four years. She is doing her job passionately; she knows the techniques of makeup and hair design and serves her customers by providing bangles, jewelry, mehndi, etc. She is a well-known beautician in her town.

Shazia is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband is not in good physical shape to be employed so she is working hard to meet their day-to-day expenses. She has slowly but surely improved her business through the support of Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor, including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams. The loan would enable her to cater to a large number of customers efficiently.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor, including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams.

loans.name: Adalverto

texts.es:
El señor Adalberto desea el préstamo para cambiar el portón que tiene actualmente, porque esta en  malas condiciones y poner una más seguro y duradero.
 Esto brindara una mayor seguridad para lo integrantes de la familia ya que debido a la inseguridad de la ciudad el tener el portón totalmente cubriendo la fachada de su vivienda los pone en situaciones difíciles por lo que desean poner una portón con barandales para que se aprecie bien el interior.
el trabaja como repartidor  para una tintorería y tiene un sueldo basa mas comisiones sueldo con el cual puede solventar los gastos de la familia; su esposa por su parte trata de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos por lo que espeso a vender en el pulga apoyar a su marido y así el no se vea tan presionado.
texts.en:
Adalberto wants the loan to replace the current gate because it’s in poor shape and he wants to install a more secure, long-lasting one.  This will provide more security for his family members because due to the city’s insecurity having a gate covering the entire façade of their house puts them in difficult situations so they want to install a gate with railings so that the interior can be seen easily.

He works as a delivery man for a dry cleaner and earns a base salary plus commissions that allows him to cover household expenses.  His wife tries to help her husband with expense so started selling in the flea market to help her husband so that he won’t be under so much pressure.

loans.use: to replace the gate.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a 40-year-old lady from Kisumu City. She is married to Walter and they have three children ages 2,10, and 13 years.

Millicent operates an arts and crafts business that specializes in African artifacts and traditional jewelery. She has been doing this business for the last 5 years and she makes a monthly income of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES).

She is now taking her second loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy pieces of art for sale in her shop. She will save her profits for future use. Her dream is to own a big stall selling African jewelery.

loans.use: to buy pieces of art and jewelery for resale in her shop.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is 34 years old and married.   She has four children, and all four are in school. 

Shr has a business preparing washing chemicals to remove stains and whiten cloths. She has had this business for the past six years. She prepares this chemical and provides it to different shopkeepers. 

She has good demand for her washing chemical, but to fulfill this demand, she needs a loan of Rs.15,000.   She is planning to buy raw material so that she can make more chemical and cater to orders from the market and increase her income.


Her wish is to provide education for her children and provide good food, so that they can have a good life when they grow up.

loans.use: To buy raw material for preparing washing chemicals.

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
Thanks to the Kiva loan that this group of entrepreneurs received from Kiva lenders some months back, they have been able to repay the loan successfully. The loan had a huge impact on the lives and businesses of these women. They added more inventory to their business, which helped them attract many more customers. 

Having repaid the previous loan, the SMT credit officer deems it fit to increase these borrowers' loan amounts by 200,000 SLL per person. With a new loan of 700,000 SLL each (for a total of 2,100,000), they will be able to further develop their businesses, make more sales and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy firewood, biscuits, flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Álvaro

texts.es:
El señor Álvaro esta solicitando un crédito para pagar las inscripciones porque no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para pagarlas y no desea afectar a familia.
 Sus hijas podrán seguir estudiando y sigan preparándose para el día de mañana ser unas buenas profesionistas.
Don Álvaro trabaja como chofer de un camión de carga para una compañía grande, y con el sueldo que percibe puede solventar los gastos de la casa así como algunas veces darles pequeño gustos a los integrantes de la familia, su esposa se dedica  alas labores del hogar y eventualmente trabaja como costurera y con ese ingreso extra trata de apoyar  a su esposo con los gastos.
texts.en:
Álvaro’s asking for a loan to pay school tuition because he does not have enough money to pay it and he does not want this to affect his family.  His daughters will be able to continue studying and preparing themselves so that they can become professionals in the future.

Álvaro works as a truck driver for a large company.  He’s able to cover household expenses with the salary he earns as well as being able to provide the occasional treat to his family members.  His wife does household chores and sometimes works as a seamstress using the extra income to help her husband cover expenses.

loans.use: to pay school tuition.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida  is widowed with seven children; only one of her children goes to school. She takes care of additional family members (her mother and grandchildren).  

She has a business selling used clothes, and she has been in this business for 10 years.  She generates additional income through poultry farming.  She works at the market six days a week and sells both retail and wholesale.  

She has applied for a loan of 1,900,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.  

She is aspires to see her business grow big, so that she buy another plot of land to build rental rooms and also to sell at wholesale only . 

She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Haifa

texts.en: Haifa is a 42-year-old married woman. To help support the family, Haifa runs a small business at home selling evening dresses and blankets. She applied for this loan so she can start selling casual clothing items as well.

loans.use: to add selling casual clothing items

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es: Oscar tiene 30 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos, el reside en Barrio Belén, de la Ciudad de Juticalpa, departamento de Olancho. El inicio su negocio de barbería desde hace 5 años, actualmente se dedica a lo mismo y también vende ropa nueva, el oficio lo aprendió en una barbería donde trabajaba y decidió poner su negocio propio, el trabajo lo realiza solo y su horario de trabajo es de 8:00 am y culmina a las 7:00 pm, una de sus ventajas es que tiene muchos clientes y su desventaja es que tiene que pagar alquiler. El préstamo que esta solicitando Oscar lo invertirá en la compra de camisas nuevas y herramientas que necesita en la barbería. Con la ayuda de este préstamo podrá suministrar su negocio y mantener todo lo necesario para atender a sus clientes de forma eficiente. Su sueño es tener su propio local y poder hacer su casa. Oscar ha financiado dos préstamos en FAMA y ha sido un cliente que ha cancelado sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Oscar, 30, is single and has no children.  He lives in the Belén neighborhood in the city of Juticalpa, Olancho Department.  He started his barber shop five years ago and still works in the same occupation but also sells new clothes.  He learned his occupation working in a barber shop and decided to open his own.  He works alone from 8am until 7pm.  One of his advantages is that he has many customers but his disadvantage is that he has to pay rent.

The loan Oscar’s requesting is to buy new shirts and tools he needs in the barber shop.  With help from this loan he will be able to equip his business with everything needed to provide more efficient customer service.  His dream is to have a locale of his own and to build his house.  Oscar has had two loans with FAMA and has been a client who has made his installment payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy new clothes and barber shop supplies.

loans.name: Aasia

texts.en:
Ms. Aasia is an energetic married woman and has been running her own general store for the past seven years. She offers various items in her store, including bread, eggs, butter, milk, cold drinks, shampoo, cleaning products, etc.

Aasia has four daughters and two sons. She is responsible for their everyday expenditures, including food, clothing and education. She has enhanced her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy additional items to sell, including rice, sugar and other grocery items in bulk from markets. She then would be able to manage increasing demand efficiently.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell, including rice, sugar and other grocery items in bulk from markets.

loans.name: Qasham

texts.en:
Qasham is a 33-year-old married father of two children, both in school. 

Qasham works very hard to provide for his family. He has been supporting his family through the income earned from a small general store. He sells items like snacks, spices, electric bulbs, and soda in his village. He has had the store for the past eight years. 

Qasham has requested a 2,000 AZN loan through Aqroinvest to buy more items to sell in the store. This is not his first loan from AqroInvest. Qasham has a good credit history and good morals.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in his store.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 40 years old and married to John. She is blessed with four children aged 16, nine, six and two years. She owns a retail shop, a business she started two years ago and from which she earns a monthly income of KES 5,000. 

Margaret has requested a first loan of KES 20,000 to purchase four bales each of wheat flour and maize flour, tea leaf sachets and bar soaps to sell. The profit she earns will help her save and build herself a permanent house. Her dream is to see her children get to a higher institution of education as well as to build rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase four bales each of wheat flour and maize flour, tea leaf sachets and bar soaps to sell.

loans.name: The Truth Group

texts.en:
The Kiva loan that members of the "Truth" group received some months back has created a huge positive impact in the lives of these borrowers. They were able to add more inventories into their respective businesses. This led to increases in sales and profits. Members of this group were able to use the profit they made to repay their Kiva loan, feed their children, pay their school fees, etc. 

Having finished repaying their last Kiva loan, they have applied for a new one. And because of their good repayment record, the loan officer has decided to increase their loan amount by 100,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for each. Thus each is going to receive this time a loan of 1,500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones. With the help of this new loan, they have another opportunity to further increase on their business inventories. Anjay, who is the group's leader is going to use his share of the loan to buy CDs, VCDs, DVDs and audio cassettes at wholesale to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy CDs, VCDs, DVDs and audio cassettes at wholesale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 36 años, está casada con Olo, con quien tiene dos hijos jóvenes. Ella y su familia viven en su casa propia ubicada en una zona agrícola.
Rosa es una mujer admirable, pues a pesar del problema que tiene en la pierna que le impide caminar bien, se dedica con ahínco a la agricultura. Todas las mañanas se dirige a sus terrenos para atender sus cultivos de papa, arverja y maíz (sus principales productos).  Luego de la cosecha los comercializa en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad. Su principal motivo de esfuerzo son sus hijos, quienes también le ayudan en el trabajo. La agricultura requiere de mucha inversión, Rosa empezó de lo elemental, por eso agradece mucho las charlas educativas que recibe en sus reuniones de su banco comunal.

Este es su préstamo número 11 con MFP y se compromete en pagar las cuotas mensuales con puntualidad. También manifiesta que cumplirá con las reuniones dentro de su banco comunal “Lindo Amanecer de Cumutay”.
Rosa destinará este dinero en la compra de 10 bolsas de fertilizantes (con 1500 soles) y dos bolsas de semillas de arvejas (con 1000 soles).
texts.en: Rosa is 36 years old, she is married to Olo, with whom she has two young children. She and her family live in a house of their own located in an agricultural area. Rosa is an admirable woman, because in spite of the problem she has in her leg, which prevents her from walking properly, she devotes herself diligently to the agricultural activity. Every morning she goes to the plots of land to take care of her potato, peas and corn crops (which are her main products). After the harvest, she sells them in the wholesale market of the city. The main drive for her effort are her children, who also do some work to help her. Agriculture requires a lot of investment, Rosa started with the basics, and that's why she is very thankful for the educational talks she receives at her communal bank's meetings. This is her 11th loan with MFP and she commits to making the monthly repayments on time. She also expresses that she will fulfill all the meetings of her communal bank, 'Lindo Amanecer de Cumutay'. Rosa will assign the money to buy 10 bags of fertilizer (1500 soles) and two bags of pea seeds (1000 soles).

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of fertilizers and 2 bags of pea seeds

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 36 years old. She is married to Waweru and they have two children, aged 12 and 4 years.

She has been in the business of selling clothes for two years and earns a monthly income of 5,000 KES. This loan will be used to purchase more stock of clothes to sell. The anticipated profits will be used to expand her business and open up a beauty shop.

This is her first loan with KADET Ltd. Her hope and dream is to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José tiene 52 años, está casado con Mardonia, con quien tiene tres hijos. Juntos viven en la casa que construyeron con esfuerzo.
Él es un hombre de carácter afable y bondadoso, se dedica a la agricultura desde los 25 años. En su zona las hortalizas crecen sanas y fuertes, por ello se esfuerza en el cultivo de espinacas, lechugas, zanahorias, además de arvejas, papas y maíz. Es un hombre muy organizado, sabe en qué mes debe sembrar cada producto a fin de obtener buenas cosechas y ganancias. Para eso, a veces contrata personal para agilizar sus labores, mientras su esposa se encarga de preparar los alimentos. Adicionalmente se dedica a labores de albañil, pintor, gasfitero, etc. Es un hombre muy curioso y trabajador. Pero esta vez se esforzará más en las labores del campo, ya que se acerca la temporada de siembras; “si siembro en este mes estaré cosechando en enero, en ese mes los precios son buenos”, menciona. José tiene muchos planes, entre ellos; mejorar su producción y sembrar en mayor cantidad. 

Esta es la primera vez que José accede a un crédito con MFP y se siente contento por el apoyo que le brindan, por eso dice que cumplirá con los pagos mensuales.
El dinero de este préstamo lo destinará en la compra de bolsas de semillas de arvejas con (2200 soles), con los 800 restantes invertirá en fertilizantes.
texts.en:
José, 52, is married to Mardonia with whom he has three children.  They all live together in the house they built with much effort. 

He is a pleasant, kind man who has worked in agriculture for the last 25 years.  Vegetables grow healthy and strong in his area so he strives to grow spinach, lettuce, carrots, peas, potatoes and corn.  He is a very well-organized man.  He knows which product must be planted in which month in order to obtain the best harvests and profits.  To do so, he sometimes hires staff to make the work more efficient while his wife prepares the meals.  He also works as a bricklayer, painter, plumber, etc.  He is a very curious, hardworking man.  On this occasion, therefore, he will strive even harder in the work in the field because planting season is approaching.  “If I plant this month I will be harvesting in January and prices are good that month,” he mentions.  José has many plans among which is improving crop yields and to plant in larger amounts.

This is the first time José has called on an MFP loan and he feels happy about the support he’s getting and says that he will make his monthly payments.  He will use the money from this loan to buy sacks of pea seeds (2200 soles) and will use the 800 left over to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, and other agricultural items to resell for profit.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.fr: Brenda est vendeuse de produits cosmétiques. Elle vit avec son fils de 15 ans qui est scolarisé. Brenda vend ses produits sur la devanture de sa maison. Afin de développer son activité, elle sollicite un crédit auprès de WAGES. Ce crédit lui servira à augmenter son stock en produits cosmétiques. Elle compte utiliser les bénéfices qu'elle effectuera pour réaliser des projets pour le moment en suspend.  Elle espère qu'elle pourra bientôt ouvrir une boutique tout en continuant à garantir l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Brenda sells cosmetics.  She lives with her 15 year old son who is in school.  Brenda sells her products from the front of her house.  In order to expand her business, she is requesting a loan from WAGES.  
This loan will serve to increase her stock of cosmetics.  She plans to use the profits from her business to carry out pending projects.  She hopes that she will be able to open a shop to continue to guarantee the fulfillment of her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc, 58 years old, is widowed and has two daughters. She supports her family through the income she earns from running a general store in front of her house. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.  

She started this business four years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Hasifa

texts.en: Hasifa lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is divorced and has two children, both of whom go to school. She also cares for one additional family member. Hasifa earns a living by selling matooke (a meal made from green bananas) in a local market. She has been in this business for the last 10 years, and works every day of the week. She is requesting a loan for 400,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bananas.  She generates additional income by serving various other food items, and her major business challenges are transportation costs and the seasonality of her goods. Her goals for the future is to become a wholesaler and educate her children to university level. She lives in a rented house that has access to electricity, but not piped-in water.  Her major expenses are rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Zenovia

texts.es:
Zenovia tiene 65 años, es viuda y sus hijos ya son mayores e independientes. Ella vive sola en su casa propia, la que construyó de joven con su esposo.
Ella es una dulce mujer, pero muy empeñosa; su edad no es impedimento para dedicarse a una actividad muy cansada, la agricultura. Los suelos de su zona son propicios para la siembra de arveja, papa, maíz y algunas hortalizas, por eso aprovecha al máximo cada temporada para producir. “Me gusta mi trabajo porque me siento libre caminando por las quebradas y montes con mis animales y cuidando mis cultivos”, dice. Ella aprovecha su tiempo desde los primeros rayos del sol, sólo así puede asegurar el cuidado de todos sus productos. Lo que no le gusta es que algunas veces se infectan con plagas y recuerda con tristeza como alguna vez perdió casi toda su producción, pero con la experiencia continúa trabajando. Hace un mes acaba de cosechar el maíz y tiene un el espacio disponible para cultivar arvejas, eso hará este mes.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de Cumutay”, y le agrada la modalidad de trabajo de su grupo. Este sería su crédito número 11 con MFP y está muy agradecida por la confianza hacia su persona por tanto tiempo, más de 5 años con esta institución. 
El dinero de este préstamo lo destinará en la compra de una bolsa de semillas de arvejas (con 600 soles); lo restante lo empleará para cualquier gasto eventual en su chacra.
texts.en:
Zenovia, 65, is a widow; her children are all independent adults now.  She lives alone in her own house that she built with her husband when she was young.

She is a sweet woman who is very dedicated.  Her age is no impediment for her to devote herself to a very tiring activity: agriculture.  The soil in her area is apt for pea, potato, corn and some vegetables so she takes maximum advantage of each season to produce.  “I like my work because I feel free walking along the canyons and mountains with my animals and caring for my crops,“ she says.  She takes advantage of her time from the first glimmers of dawn; it’s the only way she can be sure to care for all her crops.  What she dislikes is that sometimes they become infested with pests and she remember sadly how once she lost almost her entire crop but with experience she continues to work.  She just finished harvesting corn a month ago and now has space available to plant peas which she’ll do this month.

She is a member of the “Lindo Amanecer de Cumutay” (Beautiful Cumutay Dawn) and she likes the way her group works.  This would be MFP loan #11 for her and she is very grateful for the trust placed in her for so long; she’s been with this institution more than 5 years.  She will use the money from this loan to buy a sack of pea seeds (600 soles) and will use the rest for any other expense that might arise relating to her fields.

loans.use: to buy a sack of pea seeds.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 41 years old. She is married to Martin and they are blessed with two children, aged 12 and 7 years. 

She has been in the cafeteria business for three years and currently earns a monthly income of 5,000 KES. The loan will be used to expand her business by starting up a butcher shop. The anticipated profits will be used to pay school fees for her children.

This is her first loan with KADET Ltd. Her hopes and dreams are to have a happy family and successful businesses.

loans.use: to open a butcher shop

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia tiene 42 años, está casada con Eusebio, con quien tiene tres hijos.
Lleva más de 20 años dedicándose a la agricultura, actividad que le ha dado mucha satisfacción.  Sus principales cultivos son arveja, papa y maíz, los cuales comercializa en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, donde viaja después de cada cosecha. “Se invierte bastante dinero en la agricultura, pero al momento de cosechar recuperamos y ganamos”, dice. Gracias a su trabajo pudo obtener los cinco terrenos que ahora posee; y una de las ventajas es contar con toros para el arado de la tierra. Muchas veces, también alquila sus animales a otros agricultores, ganando como 90 soles al día. Celia ya está preparada para la siembra de estos meses, ya que la temporada de grandes siembras llegó y no se quedará atrás, cultivará papas y arvejas.

Este es su crédito número 11 con MFP y está muy agradecida por el apoyo brindado. Pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de Cumutay”, donde sus socios son puntuales y colaboradores.
Celia invertirá, esta vez, en la compra de fertilizantes para sus próximos cultivos de arvejas y papas. Cada bolsa le costará a 120 soles.
texts.en:
Celia, 42, is married to Eusebio and they have three children.  She’s been working in agriculture for more than 20 years, an activity that has given her much satisfaction.  Her main crops are peas, potatoes and corn that she sells in her city’s wholesale market; he goes there after each harvest.  “Much money is invested in agriculture but at harvest time we recuperate and earn profits,” she says.  Thanks to her work she was able to buy the five parcels of land she now owns.  One of the advantages she has is that she owns bulls to till the soil.  She often leases her animals to other farmers earning about 90 soles daily.  Celia is prepared for planting these next months because the main planting season has arrived and she will not fall behind; she will grow potatoes and peas.

This is her MFP loan #11 and she’s very grateful for the support provided.  She belongs to the “Lindo Amanecer de Cumutay” (Beautiful Cumutay Dawn) communal bank; all its members are punctual and cooperative.  On this occasion Celia will buy fertilizer for her upcoming pea and potato crops.  Each bag will cost 120 soles.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Carina

texts.es:
Carina tiene 41 años, es madre de dos hijos, a quienes durante todo el tiempo a su lado les ha brindado educación y una crianza con buenos hábitos. Ellos viven en su casa propia, donde todos aportan para la economía del hogar y así puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Su negocio es el alquiler de motocarros. A diario van a su casa dos personas para alquilarle sus dos unidades. Lleva realizando este negocio hace más de 3 años y le ha permitido tener un ingreso adicional, ya que también trabaja como personal administrativo en la municipalidad de la ciudad. Le está yendo bien, ya que percibe dos ingresos y eso le permite poder tener algunas comodidades en su hogar, al mismo tiempo de apoyar a sus hijos, quienes aun están estudiando y necesitan de bastantes materiales para poder realizar sus estudios de manera adecuada. Carina espera seguir con su negocio e incrementar su flota con algunos vehículos más.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Además está muy comprometida en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Y está contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son responsables y solidarios entre ellos.
Con el monto solicitado, 1000 soles, comprará piezas y repuestos para el mantenimiento de sus motocarros que se encuentran deteriorados por el uso constante y el paso del tiempo.
texts.en:
Carina, 41, is the mother of two children who she has provided with education and taught good habits to all this time.  They live in her own house where they all contribute towards the household economy in order to have a better quality of life.

Her business is renting cars.  Every day two people come to her house to rent her two cars.  She’s been in this business for more than 3 years and it’s made it possible for her to earn additional income since she also works for the city as an administrative assistant.  She’s doing well because she earns two incomes and this allows her to have more comfort at home while supporting her children who are still studying and need quite a few supplies to carry out their schooling adequately.  Carina hopes to stay in business and increase her fleet with more vehicles.

This is her first MFP loan.  She’s very happy to know that she has financial support because she will feel more sure about advancing with her business.  She’s very committed to make her payments and happy to belong to her communal bank because all the members are responsible and mutually supportive.  She will use the requested 1000 soles to buy spare parts to repair her vehicles that have had some wear and tear due to the constant use and the passage of time.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
Marleni tiene 29 años, está casada con Eduardo, con quien tiene un pequeño hijo, Luis. La casa donde viven es propia.
Desde pequeña aprendió de sus padres las labores agrícolas y cuando formó su propia familia empezó a trabajar junto a su esposo. “El trabajo es muy cansado y absorbente, sembramos papas y arvejas en terrenos que están a gran distancia”, menciona. Por eso debe levantarse de madrugada para alcanzar los primeros rayos solares del día. Por su parte, Eduardo ya lleva un año trabajando como peón en una empresa constructora que le brinda ingresos mensuales fijos. Ahora Marleni está empezando a ampliar sus terrenos de cultivos, sembrará arvejas y papas, por ello requiere de ayuda, para seguir alcanzando sus metas.

Su banco comunal se llama “Lindo Amanecer de Cumutay”, donde es una socia muy puntual y responsable. Este es su crédito número 11 con MFP y se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo que le ha dado esta institución durante más de 5 años con estos créditos.
Esta vez, Marleni comprará una bolsa de semillas de arvejas para iniciar una nueva siembra.
texts.en:
Marleni is 29, and married to Eduardo, with whom she has a a small son, Luis. The house where they live is their own.  

She learned farmwork from her parents from when she was small, and when she formed her own family she began to work alongside her husband. “The work is very tiring and time-consuming, we grow potatoes and peas on plots of land that are at a great distance," she says. That is why she must get up at dawn to catch the day's first rays of sun. 

For his part, Eduardo has now been working for a year as a laborer for a construction company, which provides him with a fixed monthly income. Now Marleni is beginning to expand her crop lands. She will plant peas and potatoes, so she needs help to continue attaining her goals.

Her communal bank is called “Lindo Amanecer de Cumutay,” where she is a very punctual and responsible member. This is her 11th loan with MFP and she feels very grateful for the support this institution has given her during more than five years with these loans. This time, Marleni will buy a bag of pea seeds in order to start a new planting season.

loans.use: To buy a bag of pea seeds.

loans.name: Allahrakhi

texts.en:
Ms. Allahrakhi is an energetic married woman. She has had a business of rope making for the past 10 years. She is working hard to earn as much as possible to complete her household’s requirements. She collects orders from markets and provides rope according to their requirements.

Allahrakhi has six children. Fulfilling the basic requirements of food, health, and education of her family requires a lot of effort from her and her husband. 

She requested a loan of 25,000 Pakistan rupees (PKR) from Kashf Foundation to purchase more raw material such as yarn and polyesters to cater more orders from her customers.

loans.use: to purchase more raw material such as yarn and polyesters.

loans.name: Berna

texts.en:
Berna  is married with five children and three of her children go to school.  She takes care of additional family members (her sisters).  She has a poultry farm and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of chicken feed and chicks. She generates additional income through selling cosmetics. 

Berna works from her home and sells to all categories of people, retail, and works seven days a week.   Her major business challenges include thieves and transportation of chicken feed from Kisenyi to her home.  She is aspiring of owning 5000 chickens and also buying a delivery van to ease transportation.  She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed and chicks

loans.name: Gemima

texts.es:
Gemima tiene 36 años, es una mujer muy generosa, amable y trabajadora. Su pareja es Cesar, el padre de sus dos hijos de 16 y 9 años. 
Su trabajo consiste en la venta de pescado fresco, su actividad empieza desde muy temprano en el puerto de pescadores donde compra el pescado para luego venderlos al menudeo en el mismo puerto de pescadores. Tiene un parlante con el que llama la atención de las personas, pues es vendedora ambulante. Ella se inició vendiendo dulces y golosinas, pero con las ganancias de esta actividad, más un préstamo por MFP incursionó en la venta de pescado. Lleva realizando este trabajo por más de 5 meses y lo hace con la ayuda de su pareja. Lo considera rentable porque le permite tener ingresos trabajando solo medio día y el resto del tiempo puede dedicarlo a su familia. 

Este es su crédito número 9 con MFP y está muy contenta de saber que tiene un respaldo financiero, ya que le dará la garantía de seguir trabajando tranquila. Además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, pues todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado, 3000 soles, comprará más pescado, en mayor cantidad y de toda variedad, pues considera que a mayor variedad, tendrá mayores ventas y aumentará sus ganancias.
texts.en: Gemima is thirty-six years old; she is a very generous, nice and hardworking woman. Her husband's name is Cesar: he is the father of both her sons, who are sixteen and nine years old. Gemima's business is selling fresh fish. She starts work very early in the morning at the fishing docks, where she buys fish that she then sells retail in the very same harbour. As a street vendor, she has a loudspeaker to attract people's attention. Her first business was selling sweets and candy, but thanks to what she earned with it and a loan with field partner MFP, she was able to start selling fish. She has been doing this for five years and her husband helps her. She considers it a profitable business because she can earn an income working only for half of the day. She dedicates the other half to taking care of her family. This is her ninth loan with field partner MFP and she feels very happy knowing that she has financial backing, since it gives her the security of being able to continue working without worrying. Furthermore, she is very happy with the communal bank she belongs to, since all its members are very responsible people who stick together. With this 3,000 soles loan, she will buy more fish, in greater quantities and variety, because she thinks that the more varied her stock, the greater her sales and her income.

loans.use: to buy more fish, in greater quantities and variety.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana tiene 39 años, su pareja es Dedmer, de 49 años, el padre de sus dos hijos: Jimena de 15 años y Herber de 7 años, quienes son su principal motivo para seguir trabajando. Ellos viven juntos en su casa propia, la que pudo comprar en base a esfuerzo y mucho sacrificio.
Su negocio es la venta de comida regional. Todas las mañanas instala su mesa en el frontis de la casa de sus padres, atendiendo muy amablemente a sus clientes, quienes en su mayoría son sus propios vecinos y la recomiendan a otras personas. Se inició hace más de 8 meses, con un préstamo particular, comprando y vendiendo en pocas cantidades, para luego ir aumentando de acuerdo a la demanda de sus comidas y hasta el momento lo realiza sola. Comenta que le gusta su actividad porque sabe de cocina y se decidió a empezar por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso propio y tener un oficio, pues tenían apuros económicos. Ahora, viendo los buenos resultados, desea ampliar y abrir una bodega en la casa de sus padres.

Este es su crédito número 4 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un poyo financiero, ya que así se siente segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por su parte, se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo.  Además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevo soles, invertirá en la compra de ingredientes e insumos para la preparación de comidas.
texts.en:
Diana is 39; her spouse is Dimer, 49, and he’s the father of their two children: Jimenez, 15 and Herbert, 7, who re her main motive to continue working.  They live together in her own house that she was able to purchase thanks to much effort and sacrifice.

Her business is selling regional food.  She sets up a table in front of her parents’ house every morning; she tends to her customers very kindly.  Most of them are her neighbors and they recommend her to others.  She started more than 8 months ago with a private loan buying and selling in small amounts to gradually increase according to demand for her dishes; to date she works alone. She comments that she likes her activity because she knows how to cook and decided to start because she needed income of her own and to have an occupation because they had some economic difficulties.  Now, seeing the good results, she wants to expand and open a store in her parents’ house.

This is MFP loan #4 and she is very happy to know that she’ll have financial support because she will feel surer about advancing with her business that way.  She commits to make her payments punctually like she did with her previous loans.  She is very happy to belong to her communal bank because they are all very responsible and supportive.  She will use the 1500 new soles to buy ingredients and supplies for food preparation.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies..

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 50 years old and married with five children. He operates a hardware store to earn a living. He has been in the business for twenty-seven years and has one employee.  He operates his business in a busy environment with loyal customers. Previously, Peter acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to grow his business and educate his children. He dreams of operating another hardware store in a different location. Peter is requesting a loan of 70,000 KES to buy cement, water pipes and nails.

loans.use: To buy cement, water pipes and nails

loans.name: Nhan

texts.en:
Nhan is 65 years old and married with three children. He lives with his family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. To earn a living he and his wife have been running a general store, selling soft drinks and a variety of different products to the local community. He has been engaged in this business for 12 years. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase basic goods such as soft drinks and household items to expand his product offering. He hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase new items (soft drinks and household items) to expand his product offering.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung, 48, is widowed and has two children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. He supports his family by selling soft drinks and fruit juices such as sugar-cane juice to people in his community. He started this business in 1998. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying more different soft drinks to better satisfy his customers.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions and setting aside some money as savings.

loans.use: To buy more different soft drinks to better satisfy his customers.

loans.name: Afua

texts.en: Afua is married and has five children. Afua sells frozen chicken, meat, and fish at Mbeam near Abura, which she has done for four years. Her husband is a farmer. Afua uses her income to care for her children and pay some household expenses. Afua will use the loan to purchase chicken, meat, and fish in bulk. With the new profits from her expanded business, Afua plans to continue to expand her business and care for her family.

loans.use: To purchase chicken, meat, and fish in bulk

loans.name: Jakeline

texts.es:
Jakeline tiene 23 años, está casada con Misael, con quien tiene dos hijos, a los que quiere mucho. Actualmente, desde hace un año, viven en la casa de su abuela.
Desde que llegó a su nueva vivienda pensó en vender comida, pues la zona es muy concurrida.  Es así que comenzó a ahorrar para comprarse un carrito móvil para la venta de su comida. Ahora, durante las mañanas, en la puerta de su casa, vende desayunos y diversas bebidas (avena, manzana, soya y demás); y por las tardes vende hamburguesas con papas fritas y café. En este tiempo, de arduo trabajo, pudo obtener buenos resultados, por ello se siente con el ánimo de comprar más víveres, “mi materia prima es aceite, papa y azúcar, entonces tengo que comprar por cantidad para reducir costos”, afirma. 

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo económico que recibe, lo que le permite mejorar su negocio, además de aprender a ahorrar en su asociación, donde los integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.  
Jakeline invertirá este dinero en la compra de un nuevo carrito móvil de comida y si el dinero le alcanza podrá comprar sacos de azúcar y botellones de aceite.
texts.en:
Jakeline is 23 years old and married to Misael. They have two children, and she loves them very much. For a year now they have lived in Jakeline’s grandmother’s house.

When Jakeline moved into her new home she started to think about selling food, since the area is very busy. Consequently, she began saving up to buy a van. She now sells breakfast and various kinds of drinks (made from oats, apples, soya etc.) every morning from the doorway of her home. Of an afternoon she sells hamburgers with fries and coffee. She has worked hard since she started and has been successful so far. For this reason she is keen to buy more supplies. “The basic goods I use are oil, potatoes and sugar. I have to buy them in bulk to reduce costs”, she says.  

This is her second loan with MFP. She is very grateful for the financial help she is receiving. It allows her to improve her business and learn to save money with her community bank, whose members are all responsible and supportive people.

Jakeline will invest this money in a new van and, if the money stretches far enough, she will also buy some bags of sugar and bottles of oil.

loans.use: to buy a new van for her food stall and, if the money stretches far enough, some bags of sugar and bottles of oil.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth tiene 20 años, su pareja es Delmer, quien es docente y el padre de sus dos hijos de 11 y 4  años, a quienes quiere mucho. Juntos viven en su casa propia, la cual compraron luego de con mucho esfuerzo.
La actividad que realiza Ruth es la venta de frutas regionales, como melones y sandias. Por las mañanas instala una mesa en el frontis de su casa donde atiende a sus clientes. También cuenta con otro negocio de venta de productos de belleza que compra por catálogos y los vende entre sus familiares y amistades. Se inició en el negocio de la venta de frutas con un préstamo de MFP y hasta el momento lo realiza sola, lo considera rentable por las ganancias que le deja y por ser la única en su barrio. Antes de empezar tenía deseos de ser un persona productiva y generar sus propios ingresos para no depender completamente de su pareja y apoyarlo con los gastos de su hogar. Por tanto, viendo los resultados, desea continuar e invertir en otro negocio, como una bodega de abarrotes en su vivienda.

Este es su préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP y está contenta de saber que seguirá contando con el apoyo financiero necesario para concretar sus planes. Además, está a gusto con su banco comunal, pues es un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado, de 800 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de más melones y sandias.
texts.en: Ruth is 20 years old; her partner is Delmer, who is a teacher and the father of two children, who are 11 and 4 years old, whom she loves a lot. They live together in a house of their own, which they bought with a lot of effort. Ruth's activity is the sale of regional fruits, such as melons and watermelons. In the morning, she sets up a table in the front of her house, where she serves her customers. She also has another business, selling beauty products by catalog. She sells them among her friends and family. She started the fruit selling business with a loan from MFP and so far she has been doing it on her own. She considers it to be profitable because of the earnings she gets and for being the only one in her neighborhood. Before she started, she wanted to to be a productive person and generate an income of her own, so she didn't have to depend completely on her partner and to be able to support him with the household expenses. Therefore, seeing the results, she wishes to go on and invest in another business, like a groceries store in her house. This is her 4th loan with MFP and she is happy to know that she will continue to get the financial support she needs to materialize her plans. Besides, she feels comfortable with her communal bank, because it is a close and supportive group. With the requested loan (800 nuevos soles), she will invest in the purchase of more melons and watermelons.

loans.use: to buy more melons and watermelons for sale

loans.name: Heri Ya Mungu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mukeine, leader du groupe d’affaire «Heri ya Mungu »,est entrepreneur, très ambitieuse, âgée de 34 ans,mariée, mère de 6 jeunes enfants, qui étudient tous. Son mari est un officiel de l’Etat. Elle est sociétaire d’une officine pharmaceutique. Elle a commencé cette entreprise avec son fonds propre (salaire), alors qu’elle démissionna d’une clinique privée où elle fut infirmière soignante. Il y a 4 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir son 4eme crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec quelques boites de médicaments essentiels et génériques (paracétamol, antibiotiques, aspirines, anti paludéen, anti diarrhéiques, pommades, glucosé, etc.). En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir confortablement et ouvrir sa clinique privée. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en: This client, by the name of Mikele, is the leader of the “Heri ya Mungu” business group. She is an ambitious entrepreneur, 34 years old, married, and the mother of six young children, all of whom are in school. Her husband is a civil servant. She is a shareholder in a pharmacy. She launched her business with her own funds (from salary) after she resigned from the private clinic where she used to work as a nurse. She has been working in this business for four years. She just obtained her fourth loan from Hekima. This new loan will allow her to stock up on boxes of essential generic medications (paracetamol [acetaminophen], antibiotics, aspirin, antimalarial drugs, antidiarrheal drugs, balms, glucose etc.). She would like to see her children grow up in comfortable conditions and to open her own office. This client thanks Hekima for its actions in support of low-income women excluded from traditional banking. It should be noted that some clients in the photo are carrying their infants.

loans.use: to stock up on boxes of essential generic medications (paracetamol [acetaminophen], antibiotics, aspirin, antimalarial drugs, antidiarrheal drugs, balms, glucose etc.).

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario tiene 42 años, está separa del que fue su pareja por muchos años y con quien tiene tres hijos. Uno de ellos es mayor e independiente y tiene 27 años; el segundo, de 5 años, Darcery; y Richard de un año de edad. 
Viendo la necesidad de dinero que padecía cada mes decidió intentar incrementar sus ingresos de una manera que no le interfiera con su trabajo en la municipalidad de la ciudad, donde trabaja como operaria de limpieza. Empezó a vender desayunos con el servicio de entrega, sus clientes son sus compañeros de trabajo; hace ya más de 4 años que comenzó y lo hace con la ayuda de una señora a quien contrata. Le está yendo muy buen, ya que tiene buenos pedidos y nunca falla a nadie con su desayuno. Ahora se siente tranquila, ya que a fin de mes ve buenos ingresos a su hogar y así puede darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

Este es su crédito número 5 con MFP y está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se siente segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado, se compromete a seguir siendo puntual y pagar sus cuotas tal como le programen. Además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, pues todos son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado, 2500 soles, comprará ingredientes e insumos para  la preparación de sus comidas, buscará precios bajos por sus compras en volumen para tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosario, 42, has been separated from her spouse for many years; she has three children.  One of them is 27-years-old and is an independent adult.  The next one, Darcery, is five and Richard is one.

Seeing that she needed money each month she decided to try to increase her income in a way that would not interfere with her job with the city where she works in sanitation.  She started out selling and delivering breakfasts; her customers are coworkers.  She started more than four years ago and she hires a woman to help her.  She’s doing very well since she has good orders and she never fails to deliver breakfast to anyone.  She has peace of mind now because at the end of the month she sees good household income and she’s able to give better quality of life to her children.

This is her 5th MFP loan and she is very happy to know that she’ll have financial support because she’ll feel more sure about advancing with her business this way.  She commits to continue being punctual with her payments according to schedule.  She’s happy to belong to her communal bank because all are responsible and supportive.  She will use the requested 2500 soles to buy ingredients and supplies to prepare her dishes.  She will look for low prices for buying in volume so that she can earn higher profits.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Charita

texts.es:
Charita tiene 39 años, es una mujer amable y muy trabajadora, desde el momento que su pareja se fue no dudó en trabajar en cualquier actividad para sacar adelante a su hija, Alith de 15 años. 
Su tienda de abarrotes se encuentra abierta desde muy temprano, es por eso que sus múltiples clientes van en busca de algún artículo o producto de primera necesidad, ya que saben que lo encontrarán y que serán atendidos con una sonrisa y buen trato. Su negocio está ubicado en un espacio que acondicionó en su casa. Viene realizando este trabajo hace 8 años y le gusta, pues no tiene que salir mucho de casa  y puede apoyar en lo que su hija necesite y ella le ayuda en la atención de los clientes. Ahora, Charita desea comenzar a ampliar su tienda y ofrecer mayor variedad de productos.

Este es su crédito número 4 con MFP y está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, ya que no desea quedar mal con su grupo, ya que todos son muy puntuales.
Con el monto solicitado, 3000 soles, comprará productos y mercadería como arroz, azúcar, aceite, golosinas, bebidas y otros, para ofrecer en mayor cantidad y variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en: Charita is 39 years old. She is a kind and hard-working woman. From the moment her partner left, she didn't hesitate to start working in any activity so that she would be able to support her daughter Alith, who is 15 years old. Her grocery store opens very early, and that is why her customers go looking for basic items, since they know they will find them and that they will be received with a smile and pleasant manners. Her business is located in an area of her house that she prepared for that. She has been doing this for 8 years and she likes it, because she doesn't have to get out of the house a lot and she can be there for whatever her daughter needs her; and also her daughter helps her with the customers. Right now, Charita wishes to expand her store and offer a larger variety of products. This is her 4th loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she has a financial support, since it makes her feel confident to move forward with her business. On the other hand, she commits, once again, to make the repayments on time, since she doesn't want to look bad in front of her group, because they are all always on time. With the requested amount (300 soles), she will buy products and merchandise, such as rice, sugar, oil, candy, beverages and others, to offer a greater quantity and variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy products and merchandise such as rice, sugar, oil, candy, beverages and others

loans.name: Benny

texts.en:
Benny is a single mother of four children, of whom two go to school. She also takes care of an additional family member: her older sister.

Benny has a business of tailoring and has been in this business for 7 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) to buy another sewing machine and rolls of clothing materials. She generates additional income through selling medicines from Dynapharm. She works from Kampala city and sells finished clothes on retail. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

She aspires to see her business grow big so as to open a tailoring school and also to build rental rooms. She resides in her own house but the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine and rolls of clothing material.

loans.name: Ibis

texts.es:
Ibis tiene 27 años, su pareja es Denis, con quien tiene dos hijos de 7 y 5 años de edad. Ellos viven en la casa de los padres de su pareja, ambos trabajan mucho para así poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Su negocio es la venta de bebidas, tiene un refrigerador donde están los productos que ofrece, cada día realiza un inventario y hace la lista de las bebidas que le hacen falta y se dirige al mercado a comprarlos. Cuando está en su casa, ordena, almacena y exhibe las bebidas de diversas marcas, presentaciones, sabores y tamaños. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 5 años y hasta el momento lo hace sola. Durante este tiempo se ha dado cuenta que nunca se sabe qué tipo o marca de bebida te van a pedir los clientes, por esto trata de tener todas las variedades. 

Este es su crédito número 5 con MFP, por lo que se compromete a seguir siendo puntual y cumplida como en los créditos anteriores que tuvo. Además desea seguir trabajando con los socios de su banco comunal, ya que todos son muy amables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado, 2500 soles, comprará más gaseosas, de diversas marcas y presentaciones para tener en stock disponible.
texts.en:
Ibis is 27-years-old and her spouse is Denis with whom she has two children who are 7 and 5 years of age.  They live in her spouse’s parents’ house.  They both work very hard to provide a better quality of life for their family.

Her business is selling beverages.  She has a refrigerator where she keeps the products she sells.  Every day she does an inventory and makes a list of the beverages she needs and heads out to the market to buy them.  When she’s home, she organizes, stores and displays the various brands, presentation, flavors and sizes.  She’s been doing this work for five years and to date does it alone.  During this time she’s noticed that one can’t predict what brand or type of beverage customers are going to request so this is why she tries to have all varieties available.

This is her MFP loan #5 so she commits to continue being punctual and responsible like she’s been in previous loans.  She wants to continue working with her communal bank members because they are all very kind and supportive.  She will use the requested 2500 soles to buy more soft-drinks in various presentations and brands to have in stock.

loans.use: to buy more soft-drinks.

loans.name: Nyangasi

texts.en:
Nyangasi is grateful to Yehu and Kiva for the opportunity given to him; he has been able to grow his tailoring business considerably. Nyangasi is now requesting another loan so as to invest it in his current business. In addition, he wants to incorporate selling of khangas (printed cotton fabric) in his store. This will increase his income. 

He is taking out another loan of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to purchase clothing materials for making trousers, and to buy khangas to stock in his store for sale. He hopes to improve his living standards using the loans.

loans.use: to purchase clothing materials for making trousers and to buy khangas to stock in his store for sale.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong, 48, is married and has two children: one son and one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a bricklayer. She earns an income running a general store in front of her house. 

She started this business thirty years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu is 49 years old and  has two sons. Her husband is a bricklayer. She has been running a business of selling second-hand clothes in a market for 20 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and raise her two children. She and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Thu is requesting a loan to buy more clothing in order to expand the size of her business and help her to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 45 years old, married to Monicah, and blessed with four children aged 19, 17, 13 and 10 years. He supplies sand and bricks, a business he started three years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

He has requested a first loan of KES 30,000 to purchase bricks and sand for sale. Profit made will aid him to educate his children. His dream is to one day purchase a motor bike and bicycle spare parts for sale.

The profit he earns from his business will aid him to repay his loan. He hopes to succeed in his business and in life.

loans.use: To purchase bricks and sand for sale.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 23 years old. She is married to Thomas and they have one child aged two years.

She has been in the retail shop business for two years and currently earns a monthly income of KES 8,000. The loan will be used to buy stock of sugar, flour and washing detergents. The anticipated profits will be used to buy additional stock for the retail shop.


This is Vivian's first loan term with KADET LTD. Her hopes and dreams are to have a happy family and a successful business.

loans.use: to buy  sugar, flour and  washing detergents for sale.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia sells fish and soap at Mbeam near Abura. Afia has received education through Junior Secondary School. She is married and has seven children. Her husband is a teacher.

 Afia has been selling soap and fish for 6 years. She is responsible for caring for her children and paying other household expenses. Her loan will be used to purchase fish and soap in bulk. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to continue to expand her business and care for her family.

loans.use: To purchase soap and fish in bulk

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh is 29 years old.  She is married and her husband is a driver for hire.  She has two children and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City.

She has run a general store from her home for two years.  She sells milk, beverages, stationery and confectionery.  She intends to use her loan to buy a variety of milk products to sell from her store.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a variety of milk products to sell.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha is 43 years old and married with two children, one son and one daughter. Ha lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns income as a bricklayer. Ha supports her family by sewing clothes and other products at her house. She started her business twenty years ago. 

Ha intends to take out a loan to buy more materials to increase her production of clothes. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more materials to increase her production of clothes

loans.name: Ngo

texts.en:
Ngo, 47, is married and has two sons. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a security guard.

Ngo has been running a beauty shop in front of her house for twenty-four years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity of different haircare and cosmetic products to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy haircare and cosmetic products to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es:
Clorinda tiene 46 años, tiene siete hijos, pero ahora sólo vive con cuatro de ellos. Viven en la casa que compró hace 20 años.
Ella es una mujer trabajadora y sus hijos son su principal fuerza para seguir adelante. Ya tiene 10 años de experiencia en la agricultura, sus principales sembríos constan de papa, alverja, habas, zanahoria y maíz. Los que siembra a media hora de caminata de su casa, pues aún no cuenta con terrenos propios y tiene que alquilar unos. Durante la temporada de siembra cuida con mucho esmero de sus productos, pues depende de ello las ganancias que obtendrá durante la cosecha. “Mis hijos me ayudan, por lo que no contrato muchos peones para la extracción de los frutos maduros”, afirma. Le gusta su trabajo, pues le brinda la estabilidad de un ingreso seguro durante los meses que se tarda la maduración. Ahora, por las mañanas, se encuentra trabajando en la limpieza de las carreteras, por lo que tiene un dinero extra, pero por las tardes cuida de sus animales y sus sembríos. 

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo económico que recibe, lo que le permite mejorar su condición económica, además de aprender a ahorrar en su grupo, donde los integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.  
Clorinda invertirá este dinero en el pago del arriendo de su terreno agrícola, pues ya se venció el plazo de un año.
texts.en:
Clorinda is 46. She has seven children, but now only four of them live at home with her. She lives in the house she bought twenty years ago. Clorinda is a very hard-working woman and her children are her main reason for wanting to get ahead in life. 

She already has ten years’ experience in agriculture. Her fields are mainly sown with potatoes, peas, beans, carrots and corn. She grows them on a plot of land which is half an hour’s walk from her house, but the land doesn’t belong to her – she has to rent it. During the sowing season she is especially careful with her products, since that is what her earnings from the harvest depend on. “My children help me, so I don’t take on many labourers to harvest the ripe vegetables”, she says.
